job.title: Research Scientist or Research Engineer
job.company_description: Web search rebuilt for LLMs
job.description:
About Exa
About the role

Search is our interface to information. A search engine with new capabilities -- creativity, memory, analogy -- will change what we know and how we think.

We're looking for research scientists and research engineers to join our team. We have a lot of compute per capita and have a good shot at defining a future technology. If that sounds up your alley, here's what we're looking for:

  • You have graduate level ML experience (or are an exceptionally strong undergrad)
  • You have an eye for fundamental, novel architectures that can scale
  • You're comfortable implementing your own ideas and creating large-scale datasets
  • (Research engineer applicants only) You have a good understanding of performance optimization and distributed computing

Still apply even if you think you don't fit all the criteria‚Äîexceptionally good researchers often don't follow conventional paths.

job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.company_description: Live home fitness training powered by computer vision.
job.description:
About Tempo

Tempo is a Series B consumer fitness startup backed by Founders Fund and Khosla Ventures that uses computer vision to deliver an unparalleled fitness training experience to your home. Our unique hardware solution gives amazing trainers the ability to see their class participants in real time and deliver detailed advice that was previously only possible in person.

About the role
Skills: C++, Python, Machine Learning, CUDA

At SmartSpot, you'll be responsible for improving our pipeline for processing 3D data of human exercise and for deepening our engines for workout recommendations, difficulty scaling, and personalization. We're looking for a creative problem solver who has broad knowledge of a variety of fields within machine learning, and is interested in building real world solutions that impact our customers directly.

Basic Qualifications

  • B.A./B.S. in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • 3+ years programming experience in C++
  • 2+ years of work experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
  • Strong mathematical background (3D geometry, linear algebra, numerical methods, algorithms)

Preferred Qualifications

  • 2+ years experience with Python
  • Familiarity with the state of the art in supervised learning research
  • Immediate availability
Technology

Tempo's software ranges from iOS and React consumer applications to Python distributed applications on AWS to embedded 3D data analysis and compression libraries written in C++/OpenCL.

We're exploring new technologies to optimize our analysis of our extremely unique dataset of human motion - teaching computers to detect mistakes in customers' technique to help them perform at their best.

Plus, we're using data science to deliver the first comprehensive fitness training that's based on real science, not bro science.

job.location: Los Angeles, CA, US / Remote (CA; US)
job.title: Junior / Mid - Data Analyst
job.company_description: BlueCargo builds software for trucking companies to optimize their dispatch of container from the port terminal to first warehouses.
job.description:
About BlueCargo

BlueCargo provides real-time information for trucking companies that move cargo from marine ports to first warehouses. We are building a platform that will be a one-stop shop for truckers to dispatch, schedule their workload and move containers efficiently

Our startup was founded by two female entrepreneurs, graduated from Y Combinator (2018 batch), and has raised a 4 million seed round. We are at the beginning of an exciting growth phase where we have already developed product-market fit, a working platform, and hundreds of daily active users. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to grow the team and deliver a product to bring us to the next level.

If working to bring technology to the logistics industry sounds exciting, then we‚Äôd like to connect with you! We are looking for a highly experienced professional who has created several full stack web applications and has experience with AWS.

About the role
Skills: Python, SQL

About the company

Blue Cargo is a pioneering technology company in the logistics and supply chain industry. We are at the forefront with our innovative freight audit solutions and lead the industry in tracking container data. Our platform aggregates data from multiple sources, providing a single, streamlined interface for superior logistics management. This comprehensive approach ensures accuracy, transparency, and efficiency in freight cost management and cargo tracking. Our commitment to innovation and sustainability drives us to continually transform the logistics landscape, making it more reliable and accessible for businesses globally.

Founded by two female entrepreneurs who graduated from the Y Combinator 2018 batch, Blue Cargo has successfully raised a Series A in 2022. We are at the beginning of an exciting growth phase, having already developed product-market fit, a working platform, and hundreds of daily active users.

About the team

At Blue Cargo, you will be joining a small, dedicated data team responsible for:

  • Analytics: Building and monitoring metrics to deliver insights to improve data quality across the features we develop.
  • Machine Learning Algorithms: Developing, maintaining, and enhancing machine learning algorithms integrated into our pipelines to ensure optimal performance and innovation.

The data team collaborates closely with all other engineering teams, providing crucial support, making this position exciting as you get to work on many different projects.

What will you do?

As a Data analyst at Blue Cargo, you will play a crucial role in building the platform technology and infrastructure that drives our product delivery. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Develop and maintain metrics and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
  • Identify key insights to drive improvements in our processes and systems.
  • Monitor system performance and ensure data integrity.
  • Detect, prioritize, and resolve systemic issues to improve data quality.

What are we looking for?

We are on the lookout for a talented Junior / Mid-Level Data Analyst who can bring their analytical expertise to our complex systems. The ideal candidate is smart, meticulous, and highly precise, with a passion for uncovering insights and driving improvements in a supply-chain software.

Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Python and SQL
  • Experience with analytics software such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
  • Ability to work independently and great communication skills
  • Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision and oversee complex tasks while prioritizing multiple projects based on strategic goals.

Nice to have:

  • Interest or experience in logistics and/or supply chain management.
  • Startup experience.
  • Basic understanding of machine learning techniques.
  • Experience in data engineering (PySpark, Glue ‚Ä¶)

Compensation

  • Salary: $90k - $130k (salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location).
  • Perks: Comprehensive medical benefits and unlimited PTO.
  • Fun perks:
    • A flexible, international, fun and dynamic work environment.
    • Exciting on-site team events and activities.
  • Support/Community: Proud to be a Y Combinator-backed company.
Technology

Our current tech:

Stack: Python/Django (Backend), React/JS (Frontend), AWS services (Lambda, RDS, S3), PostgreSQL (Database), Node-Red, CircleCI and other continuous integration toolsTeam: 3 engineers

job.location: New York, NY, US / Amsterdam, NH, NL / London, England, GB / Remote (US; England, GB; NL)
job.title: Analytics Platform Engineer
job.company_description: The Smart Market for Institutional Investors
job.description:
About OneChronos

OneChronos is a technology company at the intersection of Capital Markets, Machine Learning and Auction Theory. We‚Äôre bringing ‚ÄúSmart Markets,‚Äù the academic term for markets that match counterparties using mathematical optimization, to finance. Smart Markets have a proven ability to outperform traditional auctions, and the theory underpinning them was the subject of the 2020 Nobel Prize in Economics.

Our goal is to expand the pie of trades that can occur, by empowering users with venue-level tools to better manage and express their trading or risk management objectives. OneChronos is a Y Combinator alum and venture backed start-up company with offices in New York City‚Äôs Soho neighborhood. Take a look at our launch post on Hacker News for more information: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30247159

We‚Äôre a company of mostly engineers, founded by engineers, and every person at the company is an individual contributor in some form.

About the role
Skills: Python, Rust, TypeScript, SQL

Job Title: Analytics Platform Engineer

Overview and Job Description: We are seeking an Analytics Platform Engineer to join our team and help build our next-gen analytics platform. 

The Company:

OneChronos is a technology company at the intersection of Capital Markets, Machine Learning and Auction Theory. We‚Äôre bringing ‚ÄúSmart Markets,‚Äù the academic term for markets that match counterparties using mathematical optimization, to finance. Smart Markets have a proven ability to outperform traditional auctions, and the theory underpinning them was the subject of the 2020 Nobel Prize in Economics.

Our goal is to expand the pie of trades that can occur, by empowering users with venue-level tools to better manage and express their trading or risk management objectives. OneChronos is a Y Combinator alum and venture backed start-up company with offices in New York City‚Äôs Soho neighborhood. Take a look at our launch post on Hacker News for more information: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30247159

We‚Äôre a company of mostly engineers, founded by engineers, and every person at the company is an individual contributor in some form.

The Job:

Our systems are built for the massive speed and scale of algorithmic trading. We work in terms of terabytes and billions of rows daily, and every layer of our technology needs to be performance-tuned to handle some of the worlds largest and highest velocity datasets. As a small company, we are rapidly and continually improving our analytics platform to keep up with our large and growing datasets, and solve complex problems efficiently and fast.

We are looking for an engineer with a knack for taking initiative and proposing creative engineering solutions that will take our data platform to the next level. That includes data engineering, but also software development in the form of process automation and customer-facing analytics products. The ideal candidate will be familiar with handling multiple real-time and historical data streams, and have a strong understanding of data engineering principles. You will be responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure necessary to support our analytics initiatives, including data pipelines, ETL processes, scalable data platform solutions, as well as working with the business side to bring forth the most value from our data. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data-driven decision-making processes.

Responsibilities:

  1. Work with both business teams and engineers to understand and make sense of our data, derive value by uncovering hidden relationships, and research the most advanced engineering techniques to store, process, and productionize it.
  2. Develop and maintain robust data pipelines to ingest, process, and transform data from various sources, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.
  3. Implement ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data into data warehouses and analytical databases for reporting and analysis purposes.
  4. Optimize data storage, retrieval, and orchestration processes to improve performance and efficiency, utilizing cloud-based technologies such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure.
  5. Work closely with data scientists and analysts to support their data needs and provide technical expertise in data modeling, schema design, and query optimization.
  6. Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner, ensuring maximum uptime and reliability of the analytics platform.
  7. Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering, continuously seeking opportunities to enhance our data infrastructure and processes.
  8. Document technical specifications, data flows, and system architectures to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration among team members.
  9. Develop software to automate and remove trudgery from the above.

Qualifications:

  1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent work experience.
  2. Solid understanding of data engineering concepts, including data modeling, ETL, and data warehousing.
  3. Proficiency in programming. We‚Äôre a company of polyglots, but the languages we use in data engineering are mostly SQL, Python, Rust, and Typescript.
  4. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and their data services (e.g., S3, Redshift, BigQuery).
  5. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to analyze complex data issues and implement effective solutions.
  6. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  7. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Don‚Äôt be deterred if you haven‚Äôt used the specific technologies listed. We‚Äôre more interested in fast learners than people with specific language or platform experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

  1. Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Metabase, Superset)
  2. Understanding of various data formats (e.g. Parquet, Arrow)
  3. Experience with stream processing and big data analytics
  4. 1+ years of experience in an engineering or data-focused role at a software company or data provider, or similar
  5. Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to take a project from start to finish

Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation (cash and equity)
  • Hybrid and remote work flexibility
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance
  • 401(k) plan
  • Subsidized health & wellness program
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits
  • Competitive vacation policy


OneChronos is committed to equal employment opportunities to all employees and applications regardless of academic area of study, race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state or local law. As an equal opportunity employer, we recognize that diversity is a huge positive attribute and we welcome the differences and benefits that a diverse culture brings.

job.title: Solutions Architect
job.company_description: The fastest path to relevant recommendations and search
job.description:
About Shaped

Shaped is a machine-learning platform for data teams to build real-time, personalized recommendation and search systems. We want to provide companies with the same powerful personalization stack used at TikTok, Meta, and Amazon.

We're based in Brooklyn, New York and backed by top investors like Y-Combinator and executives from Meta, Google and Amazon.

About the role
Skills: Machine learning, Python, SQL, Data Modeling

We‚Äôre looking for a customer-facing developer to help customers integrate and develop recommendation models using the Shaped Platform. Responsibilities include connecting external data sources to Shaped, creating ranking models with our declarative SQL interface, and helping customers achieve their business objectives.

As a founding solutions architect, you'll collaborate with a diverse range of customers to solve their ranking challenges. Additionally, you'll contribute to shaping our product roadmaps and engineering culture.

We‚Äôre excited to work with you. Come build the future of AI with us!

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's in computer science, data science or mathematics related field. Master's degree or PhD will be advantageous.
  • 2+ years of industry experience in a software engineering, data science or solutions architecture role
  • Proficient with Python, SQL
  • Have the willingness to wear many hats, be passionate about unblocking issues for customers, and have an excitement for problem-solving
  • In-depth knowledge of mathematics, statistics and algorithms.
  • Operate well within fast paced, small teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities

  • Become an expert at using the Shaped ranking platform
  • Experiment with ranking models for customer's discovery use-cases
  • Analyze data to identify performance improvements for customers' models swiftly
  • Experiment with pre-trained image, language, audio and video embedding models that understand our customer's discovery data
  • Build strong relationships with customers‚Äô technical teams and leaders to ensure long-term success with Shaped
  • Deliver technical demos to showcase the Shaped‚Äôs capabilities to customers.
  • Proactively communicate with customers on timelines, updates and next steps
Technology

The product can be thought of as a declarative machine-learning tool for creating ranking and recommendation models within a few hours. All you need to do to get started with Shaped is map your user and item data schema through our model creation endpoint. Shaped then handles all the difficult parts of recommendations, i.e the data ingestion, model training and real-time deployment. This makes it really easy for customers to get personalized recommendations and see value from day one.

Behind the scenes Shaped uses state-of-the-art neural networks to learn the most from our customers data. We pride our selves in understanding any data that's fed through the API, whether it be unstructured data, like image or text, or structured tabular data. The key to making Shaped, really easy to use, has been all our data connectors, both at the data warehouse level (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift) and real-time application connectors (e.g. Segment, Amplitude).

Our infrastructure uses AWS severless technologies mostly written in python.

job.title: Bioinformatics specialist
job.company_description: Cancer Diagnosis 10X faster, 10X cheaper
job.description:
About Data Driven Bioscience

Data Driven Bioscience is revolutionizing the approach to cancer diagnosis by connecting cancer diagnostic testing with intelligent software. Unlike other industries, we are unaffected by COVID-19 and are continuing to grow.

This is an opportunity to create novel software applications that connect machine learning with cancer tests, and to do work that matters. You will work closely with an interdisciplinary team to connect some of the largest databases in the world through software. We pay a very competitive salary and offer stock ownership of one of the hottest startups anywhere.

We are hiring for a number of different positions including user interface development, back end/cloud-focused dev-ops and data scientists.

There is the potential to work part time and/or remotely.

About the role
Skills: Python, R

Use your skills to cure cancer.

About us:

Data Driven Bioscience is revolutionizing the approach to cancer diagnosis by connecting a novel DNA & RNA sequencing assay with intelligent software.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to help with both the development of a clinical diagnostic and to support researchers involved in one of the largest genomic projects in the world. This individual will work with a team of exceptionally competent scientists and engineers. We are a small company and are looking for someone who is adaptable and can succeed in many different roles.

We pay a VERY competitive salary and offer stock ownership of one of the hottest startups anywhere. This position can be remote or local.

About you:

This is a position for someone who wants to apply their skills to directly help cancer patients. You will develop new applications that connect cancer tests with large databases and machine learning to improve cancer diagnosis and treatment.You will continue to grow and learn cutting edge skills around machine learning, high performance computing and databases.

Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Analysis of large-scale NGS data sets‚Ä¢ Provide bioinformatics support to researchers involved in genomic projects‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and maintain bioinformatics pipelinesWhile the list of qualifications below is a guide, don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt check all the boxes. We are looking for someone who is really good at some of these aspects.Please apply and we‚Äôll follow up promptly.

Preferred Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ PhD. degree with 2+ years (or MS degree with 5+ years) of working experience in bioinformatics‚Ä¢ Solid computational skills and a deep understanding of NGS data and its analysis‚Ä¢ Familiarity with git version-control workflows‚Ä¢ Extensive experience in NGS, systems biology and analysis of large-scale genomics datasets‚Ä¢ Extensive experience with scientific computing, R or Python preferred‚Ä¢ Experience with computational analysis, algorithm development, statistics, and machine learning‚Ä¢ Strong UNIX/LINUX expertise required‚Ä¢ Experience with NGS datasets and pipelines including pipeline testing, troubleshooting and optimization‚Ä¢ Experience with cloud computing: AWS, Google Cloud

Job Type: Full-time.

Part-time and contract positions are also available.

job.title: Full Stack AI Product Engineer
job.company_description: The operating system for inbound B2B revenue
job.description:
About HockeyStack

HockeyStack is an analytics and attribution tool for B2B SaaS. It collects and helps analyze data from all parts of the SaaS customer journey - marketing, sales, and product engagement. Our goal is to make tracking and gaining insights from all this data easier and faster.

About the role

The next generation of enterprise software will be AI-first. We‚Äôre looking for Fullstack Product Engineers to rebuild HockeyStack to be the first ever AI-first enterprise application.

Most enterprise software companies have added chatbots to their products in an effort to turn AI-first. Now every landing page reads ‚ÄúThe #1 AI ‚Äù. Complete and utter BS.

Our ideal world is a world where enterprise software manages itself. No more field configs. No more handbuilt workflows. No more points of friction where the human has to think like a machine to translate what they want into machine language. In a world where AI generates code (Fume (YC W24)), why would this not be achievable? Of course it is. But no one has done it yet.

We are looking for cracked engineers who will work directly with me to make this a reality.

Requirements:
- San Francisco, in person every day
- Backend AND frontend knowledge (Node.js, React, Next.js, SQL stack)
- Obsessive about details
- An eye for good user experience
- Experience building AI programs of any sort before
- Willing to pour their hearts out

Not requirements:
- Years of experience, a senior title ‚Äî please apply even if you are straight out of college

Technology

We are continuously ingesting data from customer websites and also integrate with 25+ SaaS tools. Basically, we store a lot of data and have to make sense from it all. Our main technologies for the backend include NodeJS, AWS, and ClickHouse.

job.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
job.company_description: AI-enabled financial automation and intelligence for CPG Brands
job.description:
About Confido

Confido is a next-generation financial automation and intelligence platform that helps fast-growing CPG brands operate and scale more efficiently.

About the role

Confido (YC S21) automates the expensive work of retrieving and analyzing CPG accounting data so that fast-growing CPG brands can track and optimize their spend. In 2024, it shouldn‚Äôt take 100+ hours of human labor for Mr. Beast‚Äôs Feastables (one of our customers) to determine how many millions were spent on in store promotions last quarter; and whether or not that money was well spent. To solve these problems, we‚Äôve built an all-in-one solution that deeply integrates with ERPs and other accounting systems, scrapes financial data from retailers and distributors, and leverages modern AI to analyze financial documents.

Today, we work with 50+ fast-growing brands, processing $3b+ in revenue. We have raised $3.6M from leading investors.

Our team has deep industry experience from Anheuser-Busch and SimpleMills, and engineering experience from Google, Square, HubSpot, and ThoughtSpot.

The Role

Location: New York, NY (relocation assistance available)

Compensation: $180,000 and $210,000 + Benefits + Meaningful Equity (.9% - 1.5%).

As a full-stack engineer at Confido, you will spearhead the development of new features and systems from the ground up. This role offers the unique opportunity to shape the product landscape and make a tangible impact on our technology and our customers.

You may be working on

  • AI (computer vision + NLP) powered data processing of financial documents
  • Scaling data collection capabilities across different sources
  • Financial analytics and forecasting
  • Interfacing directly with customers to understand their needs and craft intuitive UXs
  • Create intuitive user interfaces that simplify complex data into actionable insights
  • And more‚Ä¶

Requirements

(1) Strong technical background with 4+ years of full-time engineering experience (Backend or ML /AI experience highly preferred)

(2) Scrappiness and interest in learning the ins and outs of the CPG industry

Preferred qualifications

(1) Excellent communication skills with the ability to talk directly with customers and manage feature development

(2) Strong desire to work at an early-stage startup and touch all parts of the product

(3) CS or equivalent degree

Technology

Confido develops in: Ruby on Rails for our back-end, TypeScript React for the front-end, and Python for ML services and R&D analysis. We also use a variety of cloud/serverless services including AWS Textract, Lambda, S3, SES, Postgres, Porter K8s, and Render.

job.title: Full Stack Web Developer
job.company_description: Open-source humanoid robots
job.description:
About K-Scale Labs

We're building friendly open-source humanoid robots.

About the role
Skills: Python, React

We are looking for a full stack web developer to help build our company‚Äôs open-source web store: https://github.com/kscalelabs/store

We use React (with TypeScript) on the frontend and FastAPI on the backend

Technology

Our tech stack is PyTorch, some 3D printers and thinking really hard.

job.title: Software Engineer (New Grad)
job.company_description: Scheduling and workforce management SaaS for home healthcare providers
job.description:
About Axle Health

Axle Health builds scheduling and workforce management software to empower in-home healthcare providers to deliver exceptional, personalized care right where patients feel most comfortable‚Äîat home.

Some of the biggest providers in the country use our software to improve the utilization of their field teams by 15%+, and automate the operational burden of scheduling and dispatching.

Our platform includes proprietary logistics algorithms to optimize scheduling, a mobile app for field staff, an operations dashboard for office teams, engagement and booking tools for patients, and a wide range of integrations and external APIs for modular access.

We‚Äôre a team of all-star engineers and operators, backed by $4m from top investors such as Y Combinator and Pear VC, applying our intellect and logistics experience to upend how home healthcare is delivered.

About the role
Skills: Django, Express, Git, Node.js, Python, React, React Native, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

About You

We're looking for a dynamic Software Engineer ‚Äî someone who is insatiably curious and who thrives on solving the toughest challenges. We value practical experience and a strong commitment to personal growth.

Our dream candidate can effortlessly adapt to different domains and is fueled by a passion for tackling complex problems head-on. Whether you've honed your skills through diverse internships, mastering multiple technology stacks, or poured your heart into a long-term personal project, we want to hear your story.

What You'll Do

  • Write human readable, high-performance, and maintainable code
  • Collaborate with internal teams and customers to gain insights and translate those insights into world class products
  • Evaluate and prioritize between tasks and projects based on their strategic value and potential impact

Requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs in Computer Science or an equivalent technical field
  • Very strong skills in an industry-standard programming language (preferably JS and Python)
  • Effective communication, both written and verbal
  • Motivation to learn new skills and solve hard problems

What We Offer

In addition to offering a competitive salary and best-in-class equity, we want to ensure every team member has the tools they need to work to the best of their ability. To that end:

We are committed to your Ownership:

  • We cultivate an environment where team members feel ownership over the work they do. Everyone in an organization has big ideas and we want to hear them and implement them
  • All of our employees have equity compensation. We want you to benefit from all the hard work you do in helping patients and catalyzing this shift in healthcare.

We are committed to your Wellness:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Unlimited PTO and sick days
  • Flexible working hours

We are committed to your Growth:

  • Fast paced work environment geared towards professional growth
  • Get the chance to move roles within the organization to learn new skills and contribute in other areas

We are committed to building Community:

  • Monthly team events, dinners, & happy hours
  • Special team events: yacht party, Universal Studios, Magic Castle, Vegas, etc.
Technology

Healthcare is complex, healthcare in the home even more so. Part of the reason in-home care isn't widespread is because it's not economical without a heavy technological component. Providing economical in-home care is a series of optimization problems. How do you assign visits to the lowest cost health professional qualified for a visit? How do you account for different license requirements across states? How do you ensure visits that require refrigerated supplies are completed earlier in the day? Solving this 3-dimensional tradeoff between time, geography, and licensure is what we do day-in and day-out.

job.title: Founding Software Engineer
job.company_description: AI workforce for insurance industry
job.description:
About FurtherAI

At FurtherAI, we are building a workforce of AI Teammates to automate insurance workflows. These AI Teammates can practically automate any insurance workflow involving processing unstructured documents, data entry into internal systems or web portals, or even making phone calls.

Our core mission is to answer a critical question: Can AI be made as reliable, adaptive, and continuously learning as a new human employee?

We have successfully raised a pre-seed round from top-tier investors, including Y Combinator, South Park Commons, and Converge VC. Our founding team features a second time founder and a language modeling scientist from Apple, who have known each other for over 12 years.

About the role
Skills: Python

As the founding software engineer at FurtherAI, you'll play a pivotal role in building the core product while also spearheading efforts to ensure scalability, optimize performance, and continuously improve the product to meet evolving needs and challenges.

This is an in-person role based in San Francisco, CA. Remote exception (within USA) can be given for exceptional candidates.

Kind of challenges we work on

LLMs are great at getting 80% of the work done but are notoriously difficult to go from 80% ‚Üí 100%. We incorporate various technical and product strategies to tame these nondeterministic creatures.

Tech challenges

  • Building agents that can navigate websites and accurately fill forms
  • Extracting data accurately from any kind of document
  • Building a rule engine that can incorporate any rule in plain English

Product challenges

  • Providing deterministic guarantees while using non-deterministic models
  • Using human help to validate and ask questions to clarify

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience in building products in the 0 to 1 stage
  • Experience building high-performance backend systems in Python
  • Passionate about web automation, web scraping, LLMs + Vision models
  • Ability to communicate well, both in person and on paper
  • Passion for iterating fast and building things. If you are world-class here, other requirements are optional

Perfect opportunity if you want to

  • Build new product experiences that use AI agents as centerpiece
  • Work with cutting-edge LLM and VLM models
  • Learn about the complete machine learning & AI pipeline
  • Be one of the first employees in a fast-paced startup
  • Shape our culture
  • Start your own company in future!

job.title: Lead Software Engineer
job.company_description: Modular energy storage for businesses and utilities.
job.description:
About Vista Space

Vista provides clean, affordable energy to commercial, industrial, and utility clients globally using a mass-produced, modular solar energy generation and storage system. The founding team previously worked at SpaceX, Rocket Lab, NASA and Firefly.

About the role
Skills: C++, Python, Rust, Distributed Systems, Data Warehousing, Internet of Things (IoT)

We are an ex-SpaceX team working on delivering clean, affordable energy to every business using a mass-produced, modular energy storage and generation system. We‚Äôre looking for a Lead Software Engineer to join us full-time in San Francisco. The role involves designing software and firmware to manage a distributed network of commercial energy storage units.

What to Expect

The Lead Software Engineer will be part of our energy engineering team responsible for delivering end-to-end products and services to Vista customers. This role will be focused on supporting the Voltaris product line of energy storage systems with software platforms, features, and functionality involving data collection, management, and processing, hardware controls, internal and customer-facing applications, and energy system management functionality.

This is a multi-faceted role where flexibility to apply your skills to a variety of projects and needs is a must. Ability to understand customer and market requirements, combined with a solid technical foundation is expected. Members of our team display a rock-solid work ethic, team-oriented personality, creativity, passion, and a desire to lead the adoption of renewable energy at scale.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Design and develop the architecture for the software systems that will control and manage the energy storage unit, including the customer-facing front-end, back-end for our data aggregation platform, and on-device firmware.
  • Define requirements and maintain documentation.
  • Lead complex features and product functionality.
  • Deliver end-to-end feature and technical leadership.
  • Manage feature handoffs to operational stakeholders.
  • Maintain feature and user experience quality.
  • Work with engineering and UX teams to deliver scalable solutions that not only meet current needs, but consider future growth scenarios.
  • Stay updated with the latest technologies and industry trends to incorporate innovative solutions into our products.
  • Communicate with stakeholders, including executives, team members, and users.

What You‚Äôll Bring

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven track record in software development or technical product management in fast-pace environments.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C/C++, Rust, or JavaScript.
  • Experience with software development tools and frameworks, and familiarity with embedded systems and IoT technologies.
  • Experience in electrical engineering or large scale electrical systems a plus.
  • Experience with UI/UX development for industrial applications and users a plus.
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.
  • Ability to execute and manage multiple projects and tasks in parallel.
  • Knowledge of battery and energy systems.
  • Deep passion for transitioning the world to sustainable energy.

Benefits and Compensation

Expected Base Pay: $120,000-$150,000/year
In addition to the base pay, as a full-time Vista employee you are eligible for the following benefits on the first day of hire:

  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Competitive employee equity plan
  • Eligibility for additional cash and/or stock incentives and bonuses
  • Health insurance
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Vista is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Vista is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

job.title: Full-Stack Engineer
job.company_description: Interactive product demos
job.description:
About Navattic

Navattic helps teams instantly create interactive product demos.

About the role
Skills: TypeScript

Hi, I‚Äôm Chris, the Co-Founder and CTO at Navattic. I‚Äôm excited to open this position because it has many responsibilities I want as an engineer. As a full-stack engineer, you‚Äôll take ownership over a large portion of our core products and own projects end-to-end. To ground it with examples, full-stack engineers at Navattic have:

  • Implemented a feature that allows users to further customize the look and feel of interactive demos with custom fonts, margins and padding. This project included reviewing customer requests, scoping where these components would live on our theme builder and implementing the feature end-to-end.
  • Improved the logic in our capture player so that the transition between DOM states is seamless. Because SVGs rely on stylesheets for their size and positioning, it was a non-trivial challenge quickly loading in new DOM states while properly formatting SVGs elements. Launching an improvement here helped customers create interactive demos that maintain a tight fidelity to their actual application.
  • Built out a reporting dashboard that helps customers track aggregate demo activity over time. Importantly, this allows customers to see which demos are highest performing. We collect millions of analytics events at Navattic and it was an interesting technical challenge creating the data pipelines and performant queries that could surface this data to users in a matter of milliseconds.

These projects reflect what we‚Äôre accomplishing at Navattic: enabling non-technical users to instantly create beautiful interactive demos. We‚Äôve abstracted away the challenging technical components to make sharing your product demo easy and accessible to all users.

We fortunate to have grown to 750+ customers (including Dropbox, Elastic, Mixpanel, Ramp and Digital Ocean), and we have great investors like YCombinator, 645 Ventures, and strategic angels.

One formality, we do require at least 1.5 years of experience as a full-time software engineer for this role.

Engineering Culture

Our engineering culture is motivated by our belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast.

Collaboration is Natural & Communication is Deliberate

Engineers at Navattic (and the team at large) are naturally curious, have deep end-user empathy and are earnest to collaborate. These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We‚Äôve found that extended periods of focus, combined with a bias towards action, are powerfully amplifiers of productivity at Navattic.

Increase Leverage, not Team Size

We built Navattic with the quality, breadth, and depth that many customers would expect from much larger teams over larger time scales. We‚Äôve done this through investment in:

  • Great developer tooling. We‚Äôve built a CI/CD pipeline to facilitate rapid deployments. We‚Äôve also built custom developer sandboxes to reduce time spinning up new environments and conduct performance tests.
  • Building blocks to create powerful and customizable demos, fast. Our no-code builder is powerful, but easy to use (see an interactive demo) using modular components. Building with composability in mind is an essential part of our philosophy.

Give Engineers Ownership & Autonomy

We, as engineers, find clever ways to solve problems, which amplifies when we deeply understand the problem. We do our best work as engineers when we had a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution. Our engineering culture reflects this experience: engineers own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users, to UX design and ultimately, implementation. These are skills that we often don‚Äôt get to practice as engineers, and, at Navattic, we provide mentorship to grow them and help from the team where you want it.

Interview Process

At Navattic, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We‚Äôll dive into past projects and provide additional context on Navattic. Our interview process is three rounds:

  1. 30-minute introduction call
  2. A technical screen (take home task)
  3. Call with the founding team

You‚Äôll meet the founding team and get the chance to show off your technical aptitude. If we don‚Äôt give an offer, we‚Äôll provide feedback!

Your First Two Months at Navattic

We want an exceptional onboarding experience for every new hire. At Navattic, we spend a lot of time focused on building your confidence in our codebase and practices culminating in the delivery of a prominent, impactful feature. We‚Äôll pair you with a peer who‚Äôll guide you through your first tasks and be someone you rely on, from answering questions to pair programming.

Technology Stack

I‚Äôm sharing our tech stack with the caveat that we don‚Äôt require previous experience in it (but a love of typed languages is helpful üòÄ): TypeScript (frontend & backend), Javascript, Node.js, React, Apollo GraphQL.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and early-stage equity
  • Bi-annual offsites (this fall we're going to Barcelona!)
  • WeWork All-Access Passes (we have satellite hubs in NYC and SF)
  • Top-notch health insurance for you and your dependents.

Navattic‚Äôs success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We‚Äôre being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.

Navattic provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

Technology

React/Typescript/Node.js

job.title: Founding Engineer
job.company_description: Helping CPG brands automatically flag and dispute invalid retail fees
job.description:
About Intercept

Intercept is in the business of building trust in transactions between brands, distributors, and retailers in the $2.2T CPG industry (CPG = Consumer Packaged Goods, basically everything that you buy in a physical store). Around ~20% of a CPG brand's revenue gets spent on retailer and distributor fees, which contain many mistakes and are frequently audited and disputed. Intercept uses AI to automate this auditing process and dispute the invalid fees, earning money back for the brands.

About the role
Skills: Python, React, TypeScript, Machine Learning

Intercept is in the business of building trust in transactions among CPG brands, distributors, and retailers (CPG = Consumer Packaged Goods). Our goal is to make the movement of goods as seamless as possible.

Job Summary

As one of the first employees at Intercept, you will work in person directly with the founders, a team coming from MIT, Wharton, Waymo, and Wayfair. Your work will span the full depth of our technical stack - creating new data pipelines, web automations, and user interfaces, building LLM-powered tools for data extraction and workflow automation, and turning customer feedback directly into new features and products.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is excited about increasing the pace of innovation within physical products, enjoys interacting with and building for people outside of tech, and wants to build a product that‚Äôs solving real business problems for real businesses that desperately need it. You‚Äôll learn how to build highly-advanced AI-powered tools for an industry that is severely lacking in technology, a skillset which will become increasingly valuable as society moves closer to AGI.

Expect the experience to be both difficult and fun. We work very hard, and we will expect the same from you.

Required Qualifications:

  • Exceptional coding skills and the ability to ship high-quality code quickly
  • Strong product ownership and the ability to deliver end-to-end features
  • Comfortable working across the entire stack, spanning frontend/backend/data pipelining

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proficiency in our tech stack: Next.js, Typescript, Python
  • Experience building LLM applications
  • Actively leverages AI in their software development workflow
  • 2+ years of experience shipping high-quality production code
  • Enthusiasm for working on real-world, messy problems at the intersection of bits and atoms
Interview Process

  1. Coffee chat w the founders

  2. Technical screen

  3. Work trial

job.title: Software Engineer - Fintech
job.company_description: The only piece of software a coffee shop needs to operate.
job.description:
About Dripos

Dripos is an all-in-one solution for coffee shops that handles everything from point of sale to accounting for our customers. We look to bring people into our data-driven and iteration-based company, which believes in transparency and candor.

About the role

Dripos is transforming the coffee shop industry with its all-in-one software solution, eliminating the need for multiple systems. We provide everything a business needs to operate: ordering, scheduling, payroll, accounting, mobile apps, and more. We are backed by leading venture capital firms like Base10 Partners and Cota Capital, as well as notable angel investors including Y Combinator managing partner Michael Seibel, Punchh founder Shyam Rao, and Bench founder Ian Crosby.

Recent News:

  • TechCrunch: Dripos raises $11M Series A to replace Square, Toast, and more
  • Stripe: With Dripos, it's no tall order running a coffee shop
  • Bosstab: Dripos and Bosstab

Dripos is hiring a Software Engineer to help build and scale one of the first comprehensive fintech platforms (payroll, banking, and accounting) for brick and mortar businesses. We are looking for full stack engineers to handle the end-to-end development of multiple financial products. Ideally, you have a strong sense of ownership and enjoy seeing your work immediately scale in production. This is the perfect role for an engineer that‚Äôs passionate about fintech and wants to have an outsized business impact.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Create intuitive products for customers to manage the entirety of their financials
  • Design the architecture of a complex and interconnected fintech system
  • Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing engineering team
  • Collaborate closely with the client-facing teams to transform ideas into an impactful product

What we‚Äôre looking for

  • At least 1 year of relevant experience is preferred
  • Track record of shipping high-quality products and features at scale
  • Desire to work in a very fast-paced environment
  • Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Excited to join a dynamic, fully in-person team in New York City

We use

  • JavaScript, React, TypeScript
  • MySQL, Redis, MongoDB
  • AWS

Benefits

  • Full benefits, 401k, mental health stipend
  • Paid lunches and late-night dinners
  • Learning stipend
  • Vision and dental benefits
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Relocation support for NYC
Technology

At Dripos don't like putting people into buckets, you are responsible for completing features from start to finish. Our product spans multiple apps (React-Native), websites (React, Next.js), and servers (MySql, Express) with daunting and complex real-time integrations between all of our services. Despite the product complexity and feature independence, we are a tight-knit team that collaborates closely to achieve our goals.

job.title: Software Engineer - Internal Tools/Data Pipelines
job.company_description: The only piece of software a coffee shop needs to operate.
job.description:
About Dripos

Dripos is an all-in-one solution for coffee shops that handles everything from point of sale to accounting for our customers. We look to bring people into our data-driven and iteration-based company, which believes in transparency and candor.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, MongoDB, MySQL, Node.js, React

Dripos is transforming the coffee shop industry with its all-in-one software solution, eliminating the need for multiple systems. This role will collaborate closely with all departments to equip them with efficient tools and essential data, facilitating streamlined work and informed decision-making across the company. This is the perfect role for an engineer that wants to make an outsized business impact.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Develop and maintain data pipelines that aggregate information from multiple platform into a singular, real-time accessible database
  • Create dashboards and scripts to transform raw data into actionable insights, enabling leaders to access real-time metrics
  • Develop tools that improve department efficiency and reduce stress, including migration tools, internal dashboards, and more
  • Manage systems to streamline deployment pipelines across various apps, websites, and servers

What we‚Äôre looking for

  • At least one year of relevant experience
  • Deep understanding of APIs, data caching, and setting up data pipelines
  • Readiness to learn and build systems independent of our core product
  • Desire to work in a very fast-paced environment
  • Excited to join a dynamic, fully in-person team in New York City

We Use

  • JavaScript, React, TypeScript
  • MySQL, Redis, MongoDB
  • AWS

Benefits

  • Full benefits, 401k, mental health stipend

Despite the product complexity and feature independence, we are a tight-knit team that collaborates closely to achieve our goals.

Interview Process

Interview Process:

1. 15-Minute Phone Screen: Initial fit assessment on both sides.

2. 60-Minute Zoom Call: Detailed discussion about your background and our company, including a quick technical screening problem.

3. Four-Hour On-Site Interview: In-depth interviews with multiple team members to evaluate your fit with our guiding principles and your programming knowledge and fluency.

We move fast‚Äîsuccessful candidates will have a final call with a founder and receive an offer later that day.

job.title: Developer Relations Engineer
job.company_description: A protocol & developer stack for delivering your product experiences. Everywhere.
job.description:
About Dialect
About the role

Website: https://dialect.to Twitter: https://twitter.com/saydialect

About Dialect

At Dialect we‚Äôre on a mission to unfurl the internet, and give developers the tools to create experiences that are sharable‚Äî& actionable‚Äîeverywhere. We call them Blockchain Links, or Blinks.

About the Role

Dialect is hiring its first Developer Relations Engineer to lead the education & adoption of a new developer tools product category.

You may be a good fit for this role if you have an obsession with great developer tools, an enthusiasm for evangelizing them, and a relentless drive to discover the language that defines them.

This position offers competitive compensation, including salary, equity, and benefits package commensurate with experience and location. This role requires being onsite in New York City one or two days a week.

Responsibilities

  • You will collaborate with the leadership, engineering, and product teams at Dialect to understand and shape our vision, and then share that knowledge with the community.
  • You will work closely with the developer community to educate them on these new concepts and the tools we‚Äôve built around them, & respond to feedback to help better shape how we communicate our products, & what the products are themselves.
  • You will be in charge of creating and managing a variety of technical documentation, including blogs, tutorials, videos, webinars, and workshops, to empower developers and bridge knowledge gaps, enhancing partners understanding and collaboration.
  • You will develop and execute strategies to educate and inspire developers about Dialect‚Äôs tools and features.
  • You will engage and build relationships with developers in blockchain and Web3 communities.
  • You will collaborate with the leadership team to maintain consistent messaging and brand alignment across all developer-focused initiatives.
  • You will align the team daily, weekly, and monthly on our vision and strategy as we explore this new product category. You will monitor and report on the effectiveness of community engagement initiatives, adjusting strategies as needed.

Requirements & Skills

  • You have 2+ of experience in Developer Relations or a similar role, ideally in the blockchain/web3 domain. Or: surprise us with something about you that makes you uniquely qualified for this role.
  • You have an ownership mindset. You take responsibility & you find solutions.
  • You possess a strong technical background with a solid understanding of blockchain technology and smart contract development.
  • You have experience creating technical content, including tutorials, blog posts, and videos.
  • Your communication and interpersonal skills are excellent, enabling you to engage effectively with a technical audience.
  • You thrive working independently in a dynamic, remote environment and can manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • You are passionate about blockchain technology and deeply committed to community building.
  • You are online. You understand that customer feedback comes through all kinds of channels, including X, Discord, and other community forums.
  • You are a commander of process, not its subject. We are a small, highly competent team, we move quickly, & we believe that every team must strive to create as little process as necessary, but no less.

job.title: Software Engineer
job.company_description: Restaurant Data for the Enterprise
job.description:
About Spice Data
  • The world‚Äôs largest companies are buying more external data
  • We license data to leading Fortune 500 enterprises
  • Our product is not a particular dataset, but rather the ability to quickly collect, clean, and reliably provide high-quality data over time
  • We're currently focused on the restaurant industry
  • Founded in 2019 by Richard Kreger (CEO, enterprise sales) and Cameron Cairns (CTO, software engineer)
  • Very small team, all San Francisco-based
  • Raised only from YC and a couple angels (i.e. minimal dilution)
  • Profitable
About the role
Skills: Python, SQL, Docker, Unix

Join our small and nimble engineering team!

  • Work in our downtown San Francisco office a few times per week
  • Create and manage data collection scripts that utilize everything from basic HTTP requests to browser and mobile app automation
  • Build and maintain automation/scheduling tooling to ensure data is collected on a timely and consistent basis
  • Create data cleaning and normalization scripts (with some opportunity to integrate ML/LLMs if that‚Äôs of interest)
  • Design data analytics dashboards and tooling for continuous monitoring and improvement of the processed data
  • Help with miscellaneous DevOps tasks to help manage the infrastructure running all the above
  • Our codebase is mostly Python with Typescript and Golang used when they make sense

About you

  • Skills: Python, SQL, Unix
  • Excited to work on a variety of different projects, sometimes many at the same time
  • Able to execute with minimal supervision
  • Bonus skills: Typescript, Full Stack Web Development, Mobile App Development, Docker, Kubernetes, Background in Statistics

Benefits

  • Lunch provided when in office
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Company paid Platinum PPO health and comparable dental & vision insurance
  • $100K - $120K salary, 1% - 3% equity

Interview Process

  1. 15 minute call with CTO about the position, your experience, and career goals
  2. 1st 30 minute technical screening call (coding interview)
  3. 2nd 30 minute technical screening call (coding interview)
  4. Onsite at our office to learn more about us and to get a feel for how we‚Äôd work together
  5. Offer extended

job.title: Founding Fullstack Engineer
job.company_description: AI workflow automations for enterprise
job.description:
About Brainbase

Brainbase is an AI workflow automation builder designed to handle complex enterprise workflows. Our customers use us to spin up everything from sales autopilots to full fledged customer support workflows in less than a day.

SMBs and unicorns choose us over our competitors because we are the only platform that combines the power of AI with the ease and robustness of an off-the-shelf enterprise tool.

About the role
Skills: Node.js, Python, React, TypeScript, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

About Brainbase

Brainbase is to AI workers what Retool is to internal tools.

Very soon every company will have an AI workforce working alongside their human team. At Brainbase we let businesses create their own enterprise-grade AI workers. Everyone from SMBs to government agencies are choosing us to create workers that do everything from outbound sales calls to customer support.

Brainbase is built on an entirely new type of AI agent our founder developed during his PhD at Harvard, which allows for more complex workflows on a longer time horizon, enabling us to move entire workloads from human employees to AI workers.

Our company was founded in January 2024 and we already hit our 100K+ ARR milestone and have raised a seed round from YC, 500 Global and other top tier firms, with participation from the founders of Youtube and Hubspot, as well as many top YC alumni.

About the role

As part of our founding team, you will have a high agency role in bringing AI to the enterprise: shipping new features, talking to users and shaping company culture for other team members to come.

You will work one-on-one with our CEO and founding team to primarily iterate based on customer feedback, help with infrastructure scaling (cloud and on-premise) and improve our underlying proprietary agent system.

Who‚Äôs a good fit?

We think you should apply if the following sounds like you:

  • Resourceful ‚Äì You‚Äôve been known to get a lot done with very little, whether it is time, money or compute
  • Resilient ‚Äì You don‚Äôt quit when something is difficult, only when you have realized a better way to do it
  • Decisive ‚Äì You can make informed decisions under stress with incomplete data, and move on to the next task (no hedging)
  • LÃ∂iÃ∂kÃ∂eÃ∂ Love difficult problems ‚Äì You like working at puzzles, chess or anything that you‚Äôre not immediately good at
  • Fun ‚Äì You can smile/joke/enjoy yourself through the pain and the slog, and can lift up others even when things are objectively not going well

What we‚Äôre looking for?

In addition to the personal qualities mentioned above, this role requires the following:

üíª Must haves

  • In SF, or willing to relocate
  • US work permit (we do not currently sponsor H1-Bs, OPTs are fine)
  • 2+ years of software experience (new grads encouraged since pet projects count)
  • Excellence in NodeJS, Python, React, Typescript, NextJS
  • Some experience with LLMs (OpenAI API, Langchain, HuggingFace, etc.)
  • Demonstration of autonomy and entrepreneurial spirit (side projects, previous companies)

üíª Good to haves

  • Proficiency in AWS, cloud deployment, CI/CD
  • Experience with micro-service based architecture
  • Machine learning research experience
  • Previous startup experience

NSFABIQ - Not So Frequently Asked But Important Questions

  • üß† Why should I join Brainbase and not start my own startup?

    If you‚Äôre accepted into our team, there is no question that we believe you‚Äôre capable of running your company. In fact you can be sure that we have all the faith in you that you‚Äôll probably start your own unicorn at some point. But startups are (famously) hard, and it‚Äôs usually good practice to see how a good one is run before you start your own. This is truer than ever with the current AI boom, where you really want to see what sets a great AI company from a mediocre one.

    As a founding member of our team, you‚Äôll get to experience all the great parts of being a founder (autonomy, talking to customers, shipping, culture creation) without any of the overhead (fundraising, operations, taxes). In the end, if you choose to leave to start your own journey, we‚Äôll do everything we can to support you.

  • üß† I‚Äôd like to join, but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm founding engineer material

    If you‚Äôre in doubt, and satisfy the Must Have‚Äôs from above, you should apply. We love having exceptional people join our team in any capacity and we might end up seeing something in you that you don‚Äôt yet yourself.

  • üß† What‚Äôs the application process like?

    We vary the application process based on what we can already gather from your resume and previous experiences but you should expect (1) a screening phone call, (2) technical screen (take home or over Zoom) and (3) paid trial for a week at the offices.

Technology

Our tech stack is divided into two sectors as building the interfaces for businesses to manage their workflows and developing the AI models that run automations.

For our interfaces, we work on the familiar stack of NextJS/React/TypeScript, with MongoDB as our database. We use Tailwind CSS for our styling.

Our backend is dockerized and runs on AWS servers and serverless instances, written in a combination of Node and Python.

For our development, we work with large-language models, primarily in Python, with Pytorch as our preferred ML framework.
