job.title: Customer Success Associate (Remote)
job.company_description: Business-in-a-Box‚Ñ¢ for LLCs
job.description:
About doola

Help build the OS for the next generation of creators

doola is building the OS for the next generation of online creators. Formation. Legal Docs. EIN. US Address. Bank Account. Payments. Taxes. Website. US Phone Number. $1000s in Software Perks. And More. We handle the operational details. You grow your business. From start to six figures+ in revenue, we're with our companies for the long term. Welcome to your business's OS.

Our mission is to unlock the power and potential of human entrepreneurship and democratize access to wealth creation by empowering anyone in the world to turn their dream idea into their dream US business.

About the role

What we're looking for

doola is seeking a compassionate, driven, and hungry individual to level up our user experience. We don't take a phenomenal customer experience for granted: it's core to the success of our company, brand, and product development. In this role, you'll report to and work directly with our customer success lead to support entrepreneurs all over the world and build our company right here at home. This is an incredible opportunity to make a meaningful impact and help launch our customers, our company, and your career. For the right candidate, the sky is the limit.

What you will do

  • Resolve customer queries and concerns with care, compassion and urgency
  • Own the user journey from immediately post-sale onwards - there's not a problem you can't solve and an expectation you can't exceed
  • Additional projects as they arise, in line with how you are looking to grow in your career!

Who you are

  • Excellent attention to detail, operations and communication skills
  • A hunger to create and improve systems, and a flexible, humble and curious mindset
  • Strong organizational skills and self-sufficiency - you can balance speed and quality, with a focus on tangible results
  • Interest and ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Experience with Intercom (or similar) and native or near-native English fluency

About doola

doola is building the OS for the next generation of online businesses. Formation. Legal Docs. EIN. US Address. Bank Account. Payments. Taxes. Website. US Phone Number. $1000s in Software Perks. And More. We handle the operational details. You grow your business. From start to six figures+ in revenue, we're with our companies for the long term.

Our mission is to unlock the potential of human entrepreneurship and democratize access to wealth creation by empowering anyone in the world to turn their dream idea into their dream US business.

We're seeing some exciting growth right now. Our product resonates strongly with customers worldwide, and we have worked with entrepreneurs on every continent (except Antarctica, yet!). We're backed by some of the top investors in the world, including Nexus Venture Partners, Harvard Management Company, Y Combinator, and HustleFund, and you'll be an early member of our rapidly growing company. We know we're only scratching the surface of what's possible in terms of the value we know we can provide.

Our customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at doola.

doola is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. doola considers qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. doola is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for talented individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or accommodation made due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

APPLY FOR THIS JOB

Technology

To get a sense of the technology we use at our company, and the hard/interesting technical problems we're solving, here is what we look for in full stack engineers:

  • Thoughtful problem-solving: For you, problem-solving starts with a clear and accurate understanding of the context. You can decompose tricky problems and work towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates. You're comfortable asking for help when you get stuck.
  • Shipping quality user interfaces: You can work with others to build and maintain quality user interfaces for a big audience, using Web technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and a modern UI framework like React. If you've experienced the technical challenges of rapid growth, that's a plus.
  • Familiarity with the backend: You understand how parts of a system fit together‚Äîfrom the user interface to the data model. Experienced candidates should be familiar with relational and document-oriented database systems like MySQL and MongoDB.
  • Pragmatic and business-oriented: You care about the business impact of what you're building, and you prioritize projects accordingly. You're not just going after cool stuff‚Äîyou understand the balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line.
  • Put users first: You think critically about the implications of what you're building and how it shapes real people's lives. You understand that reach comes with responsibility for our impact‚Äîgood and bad.
  • Not ideological about technology: To you, technologies and programming languages are about tradeoffs. You may be opinionated, but you're not ideological and can learn new technologies as you go.
  • Empathetic communication: You communicate nuanced ideas clearly, whether you're explaining technical decisions in writing or brainstorming in real-time. In disagreements, you engage thoughtfully with other perspectives and compromise when needed.
  • Team player: You understand when work is better, together. You enjoy collaborating cross-functionally to accomplish shared goals, and you care about learning, growing, and helping others to do the same.
  • Bonus points: You're proficient with any part of our technology stack: React, TypeScript, Node.js, and MongoDB.

job.title: Machine Learning Engineer Graduate
job.description:

job.title: Backend Software Engineer

We are an incredible team with passion. We enjoy learning new things and taking on challenges. Team culture here is open and inclusive. job.title: Founding Developer Success Engineer
job.company_description: Add powerful collaboration features to your product ridiculously fast.
job.description:
About Velt

Our mission is to redefine how people work together online. We're not just making collaboration faster‚Äîwe're crafting it to be the best.

Today we‚Äôre all using online platforms more than ever before - building, researching, learning, connecting etc. And we're not doing it alone. We're doing it together with other people and machines, turning the internet into the world's biggest team.

Yet, the web was built for solo voyages. We saw a shift when platforms like Figma and Google Docs brought a multiplayer approach, breaking down walls and inspiring seamless teamwork.

At Velt, we're taking it further. We're on a mission to infuse the magic of collaboration into the fabric of the web‚Äîone app at a time. We aim to erase the lines between online and offline co-working, crafting an environment where distance is irrelevant, and 'flow' is the norm.

Right now, more than half of work hours are spent on coordination and communication‚Äîless on creating. With Velt, we're setting out to reverse these figures, reducing time spent on logistical issues by over 90%. Imagine what we can create when we spend less time talking about work and more time doing it!

We're building a better web‚Äîa web for us, for our team, for everyone. Join us, and let's accelerate the future of web together üöÄ

Our Products:

  • Velt SDK: JS SDK to add powerful collaboration experiences to your own product for your end-users. This helps you ship such experiences ridiculously fast, increase user growth and engagement.
  • Superflow: JS plugin to enable product, marketing and design teams to comment and collaborate directly on their websites. This helps them iterate and ship their products 10x faster.

Team

We are a team of ex-Googlers. We've launched products like Augmented Reality in Google Search & Maps. As an early team member, you will work directly with the founders.

Come build a better web with us üöÄ

About the role
Skills: React, TypeScript

Velt‚Äôs platform is trusted by industry leaders including Pendo, Runway, Webflow, Classwallet and is shaping the way users collaborate and work together online.

We are seeking a passionate Developer Success Engineer to elevate our developer experience. You will empower developers to leverage our SDK effectively, and play a key role in shaping the future of our product.

What you need to succeed:

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Worked as a full time web developer for atleast 2 years
  • Proficiency in JavaScript and React and familiarity with MDX and GitHub
  • Experience in creating developer documentation and tutorials
  • Background in support engineering with full-stack experience
  • Ability to debug complex software issues
  • Passion for developer experience and technical education
  • Experience with developer communities and open-source ecosystems

What you will do

  • Respond to and resolve customer‚Äôs technical support requests
  • Analyze customer needs and identify patterns. Convert these into feature requests and bug reports
  • Maintain our documentation to address common questions and showcase new features
  • Create examples and demos to showcase product capabilities

We are looking for the following four fits:

1. Startup stage fit:

  • You have experience working independently with abstract problem statements.
  • You have experience thriving in unstructured and ambiguous environment.
  • You get excited about just delivering - whether it‚Äôs a juicy challenging problem or a dry boring problem.
  • You have the ambition to be the best in your craft.

2. Problem fit:

  • You are excited about the problem we are working on and have an opinion about the problem/solution.

3. Experience fit:

  • You have worked as a full time web developer for atleast 2 years.
  • You have worked at atleast one company for >2 years.

4. Culture fit:

  • You prioritize speed over perfection.
  • You can explain difficult concepts to a 5 yr old.
  • You are kind and can find common ground in difficult scenarios.
  • You are hungry to learn and grow extremely fast.

Why you should join us

We are looking for someone who can hustle and is excited to go all in. This is not a 9-5 job. It's fast paced and demanding. We are working on very high impact products. This requires high velocity, low ego & lots of hunger. At Velt:

  1. You will be one of the early employees & shape our engineering practices, products, company culture & business.
  2. You will get equity and participate in success of the company.
  3. You will work with an outstanding team.
  4. You will learn and grow at an accelerated pace.
  5. You will create your best work & shape the future of every shared experience on the web.
  6. Your work will get shipped to end users as soon as daily.
  7. Your work will matter. You will have a direct large impact on the company and our customers.

Submit the following when you apply:

  • Why are you looking for a change right now?
  • What excites you about the problem space and what is your point of view on that?
  • Why are you the right fit?
Technology

We're building an SDK that adds a performant & robust multiplayer experience to any web app. We abstract away the infrastructure complexity for the developer. They have access to simple & beautiful APIs that gives them full control to make the UI feel native.

This is a highly complex and exciting problem.

Interview Process

Intro call

Here we determine if the skills, experience, and motivations are aligned.

Round 1: Interview with the founder (60 mins)

In this interview, I will deep dive into how you think, solve problems & work with other people. We will go deeper into specific examples from your past work experiences.

Round 2: Technical interview (60 mins)

You will get a technical problem to work on.

Round 3: One take home project (Few hours)

We will provide you with a small project to work on. You can work on this part time at your own pace. During the project you will have access to us, you can ping us if you have any questions.

Final Round: Present your project & Offer (45 mins + 45 mins)

In this round you present your project to us. Here, we are mostly interested in the approach you took to solve the problems you faced, any deep insights you learnt etc.

Within 24 hrs of this round, we will make a decision and update you.

job.title: Growth Lead
job.company_description: Ecommerce sales tax on autopilot.
job.description:
About Numeral

Numeral handles all aspects of sales tax from registration to remittance for e-commerce stores. We offer white-glove service so stores can get back to working on growing their business.

About the role

üî¢ About Us

Want to join one of the fastest-growing companies in the W23 batch? Perfect, we‚Äôre hiring for our founding growth & marketing role starting‚Ä¶right now.

We‚Äôre small. We‚Äôre backed by Tier 1a investors. We honed our craft in the early days of today‚Äôs top companies (Stripe, Airbnb, and Notion).

Growth is borderline unmanageable. The next 3 hires have the opportunity to play a critical role in the trajectory of the business. Is that you?

üèõ Background

We‚Äôre looking for someone to lead growth at Numeral. This is a generalist role that reports to our CEO, who has a background in Growth from Airbnb and a number of other startups.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is intense, analytical, and brings a creative spark. Domain expertise is a plus but not required. Like early-stage investing, growth isn‚Äôt just about numbers ‚Äî it requires strong intuition and feel.

üíª Role:

  • Own enrichment & collection of lead generation data
  • Own marketing website experience
  • Work with engineering to design growth features
  • Manage multiple vendors
  • Build dashboards to track progress
  • Whatever good ideas you come up with

üìì Qualifications:

  • Background in B2B growth preferred, but not required
  • Other strong signals for analytical rigor & hard work (e.g. consulting, banking, startups)
  • Good at writing
  • Good at spreadsheets; ideally some SQL skills

üìå Mission

Online store owners, large and small, have a million things to do every day. Most of those things aren‚Äôt related to their making their company and product better. We are building the automation layer for internet commerce and are starting with accounting and sales tax compliance.

Today we‚Äôre helping hundreds of businesses avoid having to hire 47 accountants and an entire finance team to spend hours on the phone with Susan at the CDTFA (and every other state tax agency). Tomorrow, we‚Äôre there to help business owners get back to what they love full-time.

job.title: Founding Senior/Staff Engineer
job.company_description: The complete way to do compensation
job.description:
About Complete

Complete helps candidates, employees, and teams navigate the opaqueness of compensation. We've done this by reimagining the offer letter experience (replacing those boring PDFs üò©), internal rewards tools, and the compensation planning platforms themselves.

About the role
Skills: Python, TypeScript

Complete is on a mission to make compensation a winning advantage for the world's highest-impact companies. We are breaking compensation workflows out from spreadsheets and bringing them into the 21st century ‚Äî think leveling and compensation cycle planning, total rewards statements for employees, interactive candidate offers [sample], and much more!

Why Complete?

We realize that Compensation is a key determinant to a company's success (and their biggest spend!). Yet, enterprises lack the expertise to build and operate a defensible compensation strategy, making it one of the most costly mistakes to their financial and operational efficiency.

We believe that companies with creative compensation strategies do and will continue to win. Our customers include highly impactful startups like Render, Vercel, Brex, Linear, and Cortex, all the way to world-class enterprises like Roblox.

Complete is backed by Accel and YC. We're also lucky to count technology leaders and operators like Will Larson (CTO of Carta), Eric Sagar (COO of Plaid), ****Mathilde Collin (CEO of Front) as our angels and/or advisors.

Who we are?

  • üéØ We‚Äôre exceptionally product minded builders. We obsess over quality and believe that software built in the 21st century should not require product trainings.
  • üíú Our culture is best described as low ego and painstakingly fast. Companies do not need big teams to prove PMF ‚Äî they need focus.
  • ü•áWe‚Äôre a small team of 5 with exceptional product and business acumen. It‚Äôs allowed us to compete and consistently win against competitors.
  • ‚≠ê Our customers include the likes of startups like Linear and Brex to public companies like Roblox, and we‚Äôre adding amazing logos to this list every day‚Ä¶ with NO sales team (yet!)
  • üè¢ We work in person in SF, 4-5 days/week. We believe that bringing the most talented folks together in one room is the fastest way to win as a startup.

What are we looking for?

Complete is at an exciting inflection point and we‚Äôre looking for a Senior/Staff Engineers to help scale us to a $XXM+ in ARR. You'll be a great fit if you like to move with urgency and high agency. We're engineers and builders obsessed with customer outcomes and love challenging the status quo. At a high level, there are three areas you can expect to lean on at Complete:

  • Ownership: We need experienced engineers who can own and grow entire lines of businesses end-to-end.
  • Autonomy: We value autonomy and believe that a small team of highly experienced product engineers can come together to create magic!
  • Scale: We're scaling! To new countries, to X0,000+ users, and to high-profile logos. We‚Äôre actively winning in the enterprise segment, which means working on deep and interesting problems like revamping our authorization, customizability, observability, security, and so on.

Tech stack

We believe that engineering productivity has shot up in the past 3-4 years, thanks to excellent platforms that not only support weekend projects, but have the caliber to scale:

  • Hosted on Render (Services, Workers) and Vercel (Frontend)
  • Clerk for authentication
  • Merge.dev for integrations with ATS and HRIS systems
  • React frontend
  • Python backend (primarily Django) with Postgres
  • Unified GraphQL API
  • GitHub, Graphite, Slack, Notion, Linear

Above all, we‚Äôre defining our tech stack as we go, and believe we‚Äôre still early enough to be too rigid about certain choices. We want YOU to come and help us set our technical vision.

Technology

The frontend is a React application written in Typescript and hosted on Vercel.

The backend is a Django application written in Python and hosted on Render.

We use Linear, Notion, and Slack for async communication and project management.

Interview Process
  • Intro + coding: You'll start with a 15 minute call with our Head of Engineering (Anant) to get to know each other better followed by a 45 minute coding screen.
  • Half day onsite: We'll bring you in for a half-day onsite + lunch. We're very flexible on the schedule and can do late afternoons/evenings to accommodate your availability.
  • [Optional] Work trial: Here's where it gets interesting: we'll give you an offer, and an option to work with us in the office for anywhere from a day to a full week (depending on your availability) to get a feel of what it'll be like working with us. If you love your first week, you can officially accept your offer (we know you would üòâ)

job.title: ‚ö°Ô∏è Founding Full Stack Software Engineer ‚ö°Ô∏è
job.company_description: Your AI recruiter for interviewing and identifying the best talent
job.description:
About Apriora
About the role
Skills: Kubernetes, Node.js, Python, React, TypeScript, Microsoft Azure

Why Apriora?

Apriora is one of the fastest growing startups to come out of the latest YC batch with strong traction. We‚Äôre generating revenue and well-funded by some of the best investors in the Valley with years of runway.

What are you up to?

Apriora is building the future of hiring. Apriora conducts job interviews in real-time with an AI recruiter. Companies use us to get the best hiring signal on their applicant pool and hire in a fraction of the time. Our AI recruiter has a live conversation over a video call with each of your candidates based on the interview questions you choose or that are recommended based on the job description. During the interview, our AI asks personalized follow-up questions in real-time based on the candidate's responses. Our AI recruiter can be customized to your roles in minutes and has already conducted thousands of interviews across engineering, IT, retail, hospitality, and more.

Who are you?

We‚Äôre people who:

  • genuinely enjoy solving complex engineering problems
  • learn quickly and do what it takes to deliver results
  • work really, really hard
  • move with urgency

What technologies do you use?

You should have experience in:

  • Javascript (Typescript, React, Node, Next)
  • Python (FastAPI, concurrency)
  • Cloud / DevOps (Azure, Kubernetes, Docker)
  • System Architecture

We also prefer candidates with experience in:

  • Great frontend design (Figma)
  • ML/DL (open source, inference at scale)

What can I work on?

Apriora is similar to a marketplace, as we serve both candidates through the interview experience and employers through the data aggregation and analysis platform. As a hands-on engineer, you will build both consumer-facing and enterprise-grade software with a clear opportunity for growth. Problems that you could work on related to consumer software are:

  • How can we bring the average interviewer response latency down to 200ms?
  • How can we fine-tune our models to decrease hallucination and increase response accuracy?
  • How will our system architecture change as we scale to thousands more users, concurrently?

Problems that you could work on related to enterprise software are:

  • How do we integrate with our customer‚Äôs internal hiring systems?
  • What‚Äôs the best way to present the interview data visually and as fast as possible?
  • And many, many feature requests that need to be built out!

What‚Äôs in it for me?

  • Take ownership of building the next billion dollar company
  • Collaborate with a tight-knit team of talented builders
  • Launch products that directly impact people‚Äôs careers
  • Work with the co-founders daily in-person in SF
  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Health insurance, unlimited PTO, and great company events

If you‚Äôve gotten this far and our culture/tech resonate with you, we want you to apply. Submit your application with the phrase ‚Äúfast track‚Äù and we‚Äôll fast track your application with an interview directly.

Technology

Backend: Python, Next, NodeFrontend: React, TypescriptInfrastructure: Azure, PostgreSQL

job.location: New York, NY, US / NY, US / Remote (New York, NY, US; NY, US)
job.title: Founding Software Engineer
job.company_description: Enabling birth & postpartum doulas to easily accept Medicaid
job.description:
About Loula

Loula is a New York, NY based digital health startup building a provider network for birth and postpartum doulas accepting health insurance. Starting in California, Loula provides a platform that makes accepting health insurance seamless ‚Äî we take care of credentialing and contracting, eligibility checks, and revenue cycle management so that doulas can focus on providing excellent care to their clients.

Our mission is to dramatically increase access to doula care for expecting families by making insurance acceptance accessible to doulas.

About the role
Skills: TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

‚ú® About Loula

We're building the Headway for birth & postpartum doulas. Loula's platform and provider network supports doulas by simplifying the process of accepting insurance, specifically Medicaid. Doulas typically operate outside of the traditional healthcare system and face enormous administrative challenges when accepting health insurance. Loula is revolutionizing the birth and postpartum care industry by making doula care more accessible to the families who need it the most. Loula handles all doula credentialing, contracting, and revenue cycle management, allowing them to focus on doing what they do best -- providing excellent care to families.

üíº The Role

We are looking for a mission-driven, full-stack software engineer with 4+ years of professional experience to join Loula as a full-time founding engineer. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about their work making a positive impact and who's excited about having autonomy and ownership at an early-stage startup. As a founding engineer, you will not only drive the product forward but also help shape Loula's culture and future.

üöÄ What You'll Do

  • Implement software architecture: Design and develop the foundational architecture of Loula's software systems.
  • Lead product development: Drive the development of Loula‚Äôs platform, including front-end and back-end components.
  • Define the product roadmap: Collaborate closely with the founding team and Loula customers to draft, develop, and refine a robust product roadmap.
  • Talk to customers: Conduct user interviews, shadow users, and implement feedback to continuously improve the product.
  • Technical Leadership: Take ownership of the tech stack and ensure the systems are simple, extensible, and scalable.

üëºüèæ Why Loula?

  • Mission-Driven Work: Make a real difference in the lives of families and birth workers by making doula care more accessible.
  • Ownership and Impact: Be a foundational part of a super early-stage company, with significant ownership and the opportunity to shape Loula‚Äôs direction and culture.
  • Growth & Development Opportunities: As Loula expands across the United States and into adjacent specialties like lactation consultants and midwives, you will have the opportunity to advance internally, take on different roles, and move into leadership positions.

üå± You are

  • An experience full-stack software engineer. Bonus points if you've worked in startups, worked on early-stage products through launch, led a technical team, and/or worked in digital health before.
  • Energized by a user-centric product development approach. You love talking to customers to understand their needs, how they think, and how they use the product to inform the the product roadmap.
  • Independent and proactive. You are able to work independently and without explicit direction to make well-informed decisions and deploy key projects without sacrificing quality.
  • Mission driven. Working with health insurance isn't the most glamorous path, but you are deeply driven by our mission to improve health outcomes for new families by empowering the professionals who care for them. You bring an ownership mentality, collaborative approach, and positivity and optimism to the work.

üíª Tech Stack

  • Frontend: React, TypeScript, Vercel
  • Backend: TypeScript
  • Database: PostgreSQL
  • Hosting provider: AWS, Aptible

üí∞ Compensation & Benefits

  • Salary: $120k - $140k and a generous early-stage equity package
  • Hybrid work environment: We are fully-remote right now, but fully based in New York City. We plan on moving to a more hybrid work setup, and you'd ideally be willing to come into an office 2-3 days a week. This is flexible and can be discussed!
  • Covered Health Insurance

üì® How to Apply

If you're interested, please fill out this quick interest form! Thanks!

Interview Process

Initial Assessment

  • Initial phone screen with Lindsey, the CEO
  • Take home coding exercise

‚ÄúOnsite‚Äù Interview (in person or Zoom)

  • Live pair programming session with an engineer
  • Live system architecture design session with an engineer
  • Founder interview with Lindsey
  • Team chat - meet with the rest of the team

Decision!

job.title: Healthcare Revenue Cycle Manager
job.company_description: Enabling birth & postpartum doulas to easily accept Medicaid
job.description:
About Loula

Loula is a New York, NY based digital health startup building a provider network for birth and postpartum doulas accepting health insurance. Starting in California, Loula provides a platform that makes accepting health insurance seamless ‚Äî we take care of credentialing and contracting, eligibility checks, and revenue cycle management so that doulas can focus on providing excellent care to their clients.

Our mission is to dramatically increase access to doula care for expecting families by making insurance acceptance accessible to doulas.

About the role

‚ú® About Loula

We're building the Headway for birth & postpartum doulas. Loula's platform and provider network supports doulas by simplifying the process of accepting insurance, specifically Medicaid. Doulas typically operate outside of the traditional healthcare system and face enormous administrative challenges when accepting health insurance. Loula is revolutionizing the birth and postpartum care industry by making doula care more accessible to the families who need it the most. Loula handles all doula credentialing, contracting, and revenue cycle management, allowing them to focus on doing what they do best -- providing excellent care to families.

üíº The Role

We are looking for a part-time Revenue Cycle Manager to join Loula‚Äôs small but mighty team. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about independent perinatal healthcare workers and excited about the opportunity to streamline financial processes in a growing startup. As a Revenue Cycle Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that Loula‚Äôs insurance billing and payment processes run smoothly and efficiently.

  • Time commitment: 15-20 hours/week
  • Contract Role: Part-time contract position with the potential for future growth and additional hours as Loula expands.
  • *Please disregard the salary range ‚Äî this is an hourly position*

üöÄ What You'll Do

  • Oversee Revenue Cycle Operations: Manage and optimize the end-to-end revenue cycle process, including medical coding, medical billing, claims submission, and payment collections.
  • Claims Management: Handle the submission, tracking, and follow-up of insurance claims, resolving issues with denied or delayed claims.
  • Process Improvement: Identify and implement process improvements to increase efficiency, reduce errors, and enhance the overall financial performance of the organization.
  • Reporting: Generate and analyze revenue cycle reports, providing insights and recommendations to the leadership team to support decision-making.

üëºüèæ Why Loula?

  • Mission-Driven Work: Make a real difference in the lives of families and birth workers by making doula care more accessible!
  • Inclusive Team: Join a close-knit team that values diversity, inclusivity, and the unique perspectives each member brings. We believe in creating a supportive and collaborative environment where everyone can thrive.
  • Growth & Development Opportunities: This role offers the potential to grow into a full-time position as the needs of our team and customers expand, providing you with the chance to grow and take on increased responsibilities within Loula.
  • Impact: Be a key part of a growing company, with the opportunity to define how Loula manages its revenue cycle management processes.

üå± You Are

  • Experienced in Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management: You have a strong background in medical billing/coding, revenue cycle management, or insurance operations.
  • Detail-Oriented and Organized: You are meticulous in your work, ensuring that all billing and coding processes are accurate and compliant.
  • Independent and Proactive: You can work independently, identify issues, and implement solutions without explicit direction.
  • Mission-Driven: You are passionate about improving perinatal healthcare access and supporting the professionals who make it possible.

üì® How to Apply

If you're interested, please fill out this quick interest form! Thanks!

job.title: Solutions Engineer
job.company_description: Labeling medical images at scale
job.description:
About Centaur Labs

At Centaur Labs, we label data at scale to enable breakthroughs in medical AI. Our novel approach uses collective intelligence to aggregate medical opinions from experts and students all over the world. Our labeling customers include leading AI startups and prominent research organizations. We are a small, tight-knit team headquartered in Boston, and we're funded by Y Combinator, Accel, and GFC.

About the role
Skills: Python, SQL, Bash/Shell

Solutions Engineer

We‚Äôre looking for a dynamic and resourceful Solutions Engineer to join our team and play a pivotal role in ensuring our customers experience seamless and successful integrations with our cutting-edge data labeling platform. As a Solutions Engineer, you‚Äôll be on the front lines, working closely with customers to understand their needs, solve complex technical challenges, and ensure our solutions meet their unique requirements. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the technical onboarding of new customers, ensuring a smooth and positive experience from day one.
  • Write and maintain custom scripts to tailor our platform to customer needs. Develop SQL queries for analytics, manual updates, and internal tooling. Contribute to the development and enhancement of our API.
  • Become an expert on our data labeling platform, able to demonstrate its capabilities to stakeholders at all levels and troubleshooting any technical issues that arise.
  • Design and implement tailored solutions to meet specific customer needs, including working with datasets of differing modalities and across various platforms.
  • Engage with customers regularly to understand their pain points, gather requirements, and design innovative solutions to enhance their workflows.
  • Work closely with our product and engineering teams to translate customer feedback and requirements into actionable product enhancements.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including publicly available code snippets to help customers utilize our platform.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in a full-time technical role, preferably with a focus on customer-facing solutions. Strong understanding of computer science, data management, or related fields.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience writing code in Python (or a similar scripting language) and SQL queries, with the ability to develop scripts and contribute to API development. Ability to quickly learn and work with new technologies.
  • Demonstrated ability to tackle complex technical problems and design effective solutions that meet customer needs.
  • Motivated by helping customers succeed, with a strong desire to roll up your sleeves and solve tough problems in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred:

  • Prior experience working with data labeling or machine learning.
  • Prior experience working with customers in a life sciences-adjacent domain.
  • Strong operational skills, including project management, and the ability to juggle multiple priorities.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of thriving in a rapidly changing environment.

Pay & Benefits:

The annual US base salary range for this role is $100,000 - $140,000 USD. This salary range will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and location.

Additional benefits include:

  • Competitive equity grant in a Series A company
  • Work remote
  • Yearly professional development stipend
  • Generous PTO and parental leave

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Centaur Labs, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace ‚Äî so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You might just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

Technology

We use React.js and Swift on the frontend, and Python and Swift (Vapor) on the backend. Our data store is PostgreSQL, and we're hosted on AWS.

Centaur faces a wide variety of difficult technical problems, from efficiently serving millions of images and videos to our users, to ensuring our platform is secure and our valuable data sets remain private, to performing complex analysis on our users' performance and building machine learning models to take our decision making capabilities to the next level.

Interview Process
  1. Phone screen (20 mins)
  2. Technical interview (1 hr)
  3. Team interview (3 hrs)
  4. Offer!

job.title: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
job.company_description: AI-voice agents that are indistinguishable from humans.
job.description:
About Marr Labs

Marr Labs is making AI-voice agents that are indistinguishable from humans. Han and Dave previously created speech tech company Vlingo that powered the first Siri app and was acquired for $225M.

About the role

Position Summary

As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and executing test plans to ensure the quality and reliability of our AI-voice agents. Your technical expertise will help identify issues and ensure that our solutions meet the highest standards before reaching our clients.

Key Responsibilities

  • Test Planning and Execution: Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases based on product requirements and specifications. Execute manual and automated tests to validate software functionality, performance, and reliability.
  • Bug Identification and Reporting: Identify, document, and track defects and issues using bug tracking tools. Collaborate with the development team to resolve issues and ensure timely fixes.
  • Automation: Design and implement automated test scripts to improve test coverage and efficiency. Maintain and enhance existing test automation frameworks.
  • Quality Standards: Ensure that all software releases meet quality standards and client expectations. Conduct thorough reviews of product features and functionality to guarantee compliance with quality benchmarks.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, developers, and other team members to understand requirements and provide feedback on product quality. Participate in regular team meetings and reviews.
  • Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the development and improvement of QA processes, tools, and methodologies. Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging technologies.

Skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Experience with test management and bug tracking tools (e.g., Jira, TestRail)
  • Knowledge of programming or scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript)
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to work independently
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills

Qualifications

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in quality assurance or software testing, with a strong background in technical testing.
  • Technical Background: Proficiency in software testing methodologies, tools, and frameworks. Experience with automated testing tools and scripting languages is a plus.
  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary/equity package
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Chance to get in on the ground floor of one of the most innovative AI companies being built today
Technology

At Marr Labs, we are pioneering AI-voice agents to revolutionize workforce automation. Our technology stands out in the crowded field by meticulously avoiding 'hallucination', ensuring focused interactions, and delivering a user experience that is indistinguishable from live personnel. Our solution transcends traditional speech recognition and synthesis, offering nuanced understanding and interactions through voice, whether over the phone or other mediums. Our AI-voice agents are tailored for a range of sectors including customer service, sales, legal, medical fields and more. We believe in the transformative power of our technology ‚Äì not just as a tool but as a game-changer. Marr Labs' AI-voice agents are poised to redefine service and knowledge roles across industries, unlocking unprecedented value, estimated in the billions of dollars. Our vision is clear: to leverage the untapped potential of AI in voice interaction, setting a new benchmark in automation and efficiency. This is not just innovation; it's the future of workforce automation, redefined by Marr Labs.

job.title: Software Engineer (LLMs)
job.company_description: Travel Management Meets AI
job.description:
About SkyLink

SkyLink is an AI-based Travel Management Company

About the role
Skills: Torch/PyTorch, Python, TensorFlow

About SkyLink

SkyLink allows travelers to book and manage travel through chat or email as if they're talking to a corporate travel agent. Through recent breakthroughs in natural-language processing and generative language, our highly trained AI models are able to take colloquial English and handle complex travel itineraries and changes. We work with enterprises and Travel Management companies to drive productivity, increase booking throughput, and streamline operations. We are revenue generating and have customers.

We are backed by Menlo Ventures, Y Combinator, Human Capital, and Fortune 50 CEOs. Our board of advisor includes former CEOs of Global Travel companies.

About You

You are a rockstar engineer who loves to build complex products and systems from the ground up. You are a team player who enjoys collaborative environments but is not afraid to voice their opinion. You have a strong architectural sense and have a demonstrated ability to turn architecture into code. You thrive in ambiguous settings and know how to balance tech debt and "doing things right". You want to be part of a small, fast-paced, and energetic team looking to impact global travel.

About the role

We are looking for an ML/NLP engineer who will be instrumental in creating a top-tier AI travel management platform. The perfect candidate will bring a wealth of experience, with 7-10 years in Software Engineering and at least 3 years specialized in NLP and chatbot creation. They should have a passion for leveraging transformer technology to enhance the capabilities of new chatbots and possess a keen interest in applying their expertise to the travel domain.

A great fit:

  • Strong understanding of ML concepts (NLP, LLMs, model training, finetuning, GPT, embeddings, etc)
  • Has architected and built chatbots and/or NLP systems
  • Is familiar with LLMs through APIs (OpenAI, etc) and with standing up your own models
  • Has strong prompting skills and is working on bettering them everyday
  • Ability to curate, test, and maintain datasets
  • Strong programming skills (Python)
  • Is scrappy, knows how to ship, and values progress over perfection
  • Wants to set, maintain, and adhere to great software engineering standards (comments, testing, documentation, high quality review)
  • Is just as excited to code and build as they are to architect and design software
  • Wants to deeply understand technical domains and work on large-scale challenges
  • Wants ownership and autonomy in a role that will supercharge your growth both professionally and personally

You will:

  • Work with transformer models to architect and design a chatbot for corporate travel
  • Build a hierarchical based LLM orchestration layer
  • Determine Intents and maintainable chat workflows from those intents
  • Create and maintain multiple datasets for travel chat conversations
  • Build and deploy both general and fine tuned models across cloud infrastructure
  • Build individual preferences into our system

Tech Stack

  • LLMs: OpenAI and Hugging Face
  • Backend: Python, Django, Celery, Redis, Postgres
  • Frontend: React, Typescript
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker

Benefits

  • Healthcare
  • New laptop of your choice.
  • 401(K) Plan
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Hybrid in New York City
Technology
  • Backend Tech Stack: Python, Django, Celery, Redis, Postgres
  • Frontend Tech Stack: React, Typescript
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker
Interview Process

Introduction zoom chat with a cofounder

This is an informal call for us to meet each other and get to know one another. The conversation will cover some light technical discussion about your past projects and your ability to code and build fairly involved systems. We would like to hear details about those projects and both your product and technical decisions (good or bad) which show ownership and autonomy. We also want to understand what you are looking for in your next role and why you are interested in early-stage startups. You will get to ask us about the role and learn about what working at SkyLink will feel like.

Two technical interviews

These technical interviews will give you an ability to show off your NLP and ML skills and your ability to think about and design real world chatbots with LLMs. We will also evaluate your ability to critically think, create complex backends, and scale real world systems.

Offer!

You have a strong architectural sense and have a demonstrated ability to turn architecture into code. You thrive in ambiguous settings and know how to balance tech debt and "doing things right". You want to be part of a small, fast-paced, and energetic team looking to impact global travel.

About the role

We‚Äôre looking for our first founding backend engineer to help us build the best-in-class AI travel management platform. An ideal candidate has 5 years of software experience building nuanced technical systems and working in shared, collaborative codebases and environments.

A great fit:

  • Is scrappy, knows how to ship, and values progress over perfection
  • Has built scalable systems
  • Has strong security, relational database, and software design skills
  • Can manage infrastructure across dev, staging, and production environments
  • Wants to set, maintain, and adhere to great software engineering standards (comments, testing, documentation, high quality review)
  • Is just as excited to code and build as they are to architect and design software
  • Wants to deeply understand technical domains and work on large-scale challenges
  • Has experience with or interest in AI and large language models
  • Wants ownership and autonomy in a role that will supercharge your growth both professionally and personally

You will:

  • Create Unified Integrations and APIs on top of complex travel systems (Sabre, TravelPort, Amadeus, etc)
  • Design and implement database models that scale across our various customers and their systems
  • Implement algorithms to determine ideal travel itineraries for corporate travelers.
  • Implement travel purchases, rebookings, and cancellations
  • Integrate our chatbot into email, slack, teams, sms, and any chat platform that may come up
  • Architect an AI-driven platform to drive travel with LLMs
  • Maintain and manage AWS infrastructure and internal CI/CD

Tech Stack

  • Backend: Python, Django, Celery, Redis, Postgres
  • Frontend: React, Typescript
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker

Benefits

  • Healthcare
  • New laptop of your choice.
  • 401(K) Plan
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Hybrid in New York City

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker

Introduction zoom chat with a cofounder

This is an informal call for us to meet each other and get to know one another. The conversation will cover some light technical discussion about your past projects and your ability to code and build fairly involved systems. We would like to hear details about those projects and both your product and technical decisions (good or bad) which show ownership and autonomy. We also want to understand what you are looking for in your next role and why you are interested in early-stage startups. You will get to ask us about the role and learn about what working at SkyLink will feel like.

Two technical interviews

These technical interviews will give you an ability to show off your system design and backend programming skills. We will evaluate your ability to critically think, create complex backends, and scale real world systems. Additionally, we will discuss your familiarity or interest in AI and Large Language models.

Offer!

job.title: OneText DevOps/DBA Engineer
job.company_description: Frictionless payments via SMS
job.description:
About OneText

We're two former leads from the PayPal Checkout team (engineering & product), we just got pre-seed funding for our new startup which we launched earlier this year, and we're looking for an engineer to join us!

Our goal is simple: to make it possible to use your phone number to pay, anywhere and everywhere, with zero friction. We have a ton of cool ways to make that work, and a bunch of brands already using our platform.

Email: hello@onetext.com

Our stack:

Front-end: JS/TS/React

API: Node/TS/Postgres/Redis

Services: Shopify/Twilio/PayPal/Stripe/Authorize.net

What we do: payments, vaulting, automated conversations, and merchant-facing dashboards. Plus a whole load of interesting things in-between.

Most important skill: be able to communicate well, and learn quickly. Doesn't matter if you haven't used every technology listed above, so long as you're a fast learner and happy to jump quickly into new things.

Experience level: any. So long as you can code, if we like you and you're a good fit, we'll find a role for you.

Expectations: it's a startup, and we just got accepted into YCombinator 2023. So it will be busy, there's no avoiding that. But we want to create a great engineering culture that fosters innovation, learning, and mentorship. We want to teach, and we want to learn from you too.

Location: we're both CA (bay area), open to remote anywhere in US, may be able to make non-US work with some kind of contracting role but priority given to US-based folk.

Salary: completely dependent on experience and skill. Equity on the table. (Apologies for being vague here. Our plan is to create the role and compensation around the candidate we think is the best fit)

https://bluepnume.medium.com/subscriptions-are-out-refills-are-in-311fd6e41e5e

https://bluepnume.medium.com/dtc-brands-have-a-huge-blind-spot-vaulting-13ea7ef5b2f

Send us an email about yourself!

Send us an email about yourself!

About the role

Job Description: Chief of Staff at OneText

  • Location: San Francisco Headquarters (Remote Optionality Available)
  • Salary: $80,000 - $120,000 + Equity
  • Benefits: Health, Vision, Dental Insurance, Untracked PTO

About OneText: Shop by Text

Sitting at the intersection of payments, AI, and marketing, OneText makes shopping as effortless as paying with your hotel room number. Shoppers literally reply and buy with one text. Fast-growing ecommerce brands use our text to buy payments and sales concierge to drive up to 30% more revenue. We replace conventional SMS marketing with two-way conversations that delight shoppers and inspire them to buy more. 

We‚Äôre backed by rockstars including Y Combinator, Coatue, Citi Ventures, Khosla Ventures, the founders of Warby Parker, Allbirds and Harry‚Äôs and Matt Bellamy, the lead singer of Muse. 

We're building a world-class team and we‚Äôre looking for part ü™Ñmagician, part üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è pirate, part üöÄ astronaut to join as our founding Chief of Staff. If that‚Äôs you, reach out!

The Role

As Chief of Staff at OneText, you'll work directly with our founders‚ÄîJonathan Fudem, CEO and Daniel Brain, CTO.

How to Apply

  • Click to apply
  • But to jump to the top of the pile, please submit our application

Key Responsibilities

  • Anything & Everything
  • Strategy & operations
  • Collaborating with CEO, CTO and entire team 
  • Financial modeling and planning
  • Investor Updates, Team memos and communication with customers, vendors and lawyers
  • Overseeing incentive-based compensation for Sales and Success team 
  • Running HR software (Gusto, Rippling, Sling, etc)
  • Making long documents shorter
  • Being the extended brain and hands of the CEO

Required Skills

  • Experience in a high-growth startup or tech company
  • Exposure to multiple functions such as strategy, operations, finance and HR. 
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to use data to drive decision-making.
  • Being able to make it up as you go. You need to be comfortable with ambiguity! 
  • Fast learning and excellent at making complicated tasks smaller and faster 
  • Extreme honesty 
  • Willingness to work the week of US Black Friday / Cyber Monday (the Super Bowl for our industry)
  • Readiness to do do whatever it takes to ensure OneText wins
  • Desire to fight for truth justice and the defeat of your enemies/our lazy, tired competitors

Why Join Us?

  • Key player at a fast-growing startup: Revenue is up 3X year/year and accelerating
  • Huge Opportunity: We have the chance to build the payment company of the future, providing a chargeable card on file for every phone number
  • Competitors You‚Äôll Love to Fight: We compete and win against spammy, conventional ‚ÄúBig SMS‚Äù companies who prefer to lock people into contracts rather than innovate. 
  • Personal Growth: We take on big battles every day and work with the best in the industry. 

How to Stand Out

  • Read this far
  • Familiarize yourself with our core values and norms
  • Visit OneText.com, enter your favorite ecommerce site and play our demo
  • Submit our Application
  • Love our mission

Join us in building the future of payments and marketing, one text at a time.

Technology

Front-end: JS/TS/React

API: Node/TS/Postgres/Redis

Services: Shopify/Twilio/PayPal/Stripe/Authorize.net

Interview Process
  1. Submit our application: https://onetext-chief-of-staff.paperform.co/
  2. Interview screening with Jonathan, Daniel, and other members of the team
  3. Follow up conversation with Jonathan
  4. Reference check

job.title: Video Animator
job.company_description: Infra for Building Conversational Voice AI
job.description:
About Retell AI

Retell AI is a powerful platform for building production ready voice AI. We recently closed a $4.5M seed round and achieved remarkable growth, reaching $3M in revenue within six months. Retell AI is proudly backed by Alt Capital, Y Combinator, and other leading investors.

Our team is composed of experts from Meta, Google, and TikTok, and we operate out of our in-person office in Redwood City.

About the role
Skills: Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere

Scope of work

In this role as a Video Animator, you will be working directly with our Chief Marketing Officer to plan, create, and update animations and dynamic effects for social marketing content. You will make a direct and meaningful impact on the quality and usability of Retell AI‚Äô inbound marketing. You may also be asked to collaborate, where needed, with our founders team to deliver outputs consistent with our product features and customer specifications.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Shoot and edit tutorial videos or marketing videos.
  • Create and integrate original animations and dynamic effects into video marketing
  • Ideate and storyboard animations and effects based on creative briefs, including selecting and applying colors and styles, creating new visual elements, and using design best practices to produce professional, appealing visuals

Qualifications

  • Fluency in business proficiency in English (written and spoken)
  • Expertise in Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro, or equivalent
  • Familiarity / experience with graphic design and both 2D & 3D animation
  • Experience with integrating animations into video content
  • Must have a portfolio or projects to present.

Compensation

  • This is a contract role and requires 20 hours work per week.
  • Compensation is at least $1000/month.

What we offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology
  • Flexibility of remote work
  • Career growth opportunities in a fast-growing tech startup
Interview Process

Our interview process is straightforward and will move quickly. Submit your portfolio first. You will have a virtual meeting over video call with our hiring manager, and be given a quick assignment (should take less than a day) to create original animations on top of an existing video (to be given as part of the assignment). This will be evaluated, and if approved, we will follow up with an offer!

job.title: Senior Data Scientist, Crypto
job.company_description: Compound compliance: the central hub for meeting SEC obligations
job.description:
About Aer

Argus lets employees who could have material nonpublic information, like bankers and consultants, trade compliantly with their employer restrictions. Today banks and consulting firms struggle over compliance restrictions and even pay fines when employees misuse their brokerages. The way Argus works is pretty simple: charge firms like Bain, partner with brokerages like Schwab, and allow employees to trade on their existing accounts.

About the role
Skills: Deep Learning

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist specialized in crypto to join our dynamic team in New York City, NY. We have a major crypto initiative we are starting and are looking for a data scientist with big data expertise who is either passionate for or has worked in crypto. This is a greenfield project so you will be driving outputs Day 1. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned data scientist eager to have product ownership, tackle complex problems and create robust, hyper-scale solutions.

Technology

We're building a trading frontend with an API and compliance backend. Our stack is React, Python.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.company_description: Compound compliance: the central hub for meeting SEC obligations
job.description:
About Aer

Argus lets employees who could have material nonpublic information, like bankers and consultants, trade compliantly with their employer restrictions. Today banks and consulting firms struggle over compliance restrictions and even pay fines when employees misuse their brokerages. The way Argus works is pretty simple: charge firms like Bain, partner with brokerages like Schwab, and allow employees to trade on their existing accounts.

About the role
Skills: Python, React

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic team in New York City, NY. This role involves full-stack development responsibilities and leading the charge on one of our rapidly growing new product offerings. You will be working across the stack using python, react, and prompt engineering with OpenAI. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer eager to have product ownership, tackle complex problems and create robust, scalable software solutions.

Technology

We're building a trading frontend with an API and compliance backend. Our stack is React, Python.

job.title: Data & Ops
job.company_description: Compound compliance: the central hub for meeting SEC obligations
job.description:
About Aer

Argus lets employees who could have material nonpublic information, like bankers and consultants, trade compliantly with their employer restrictions. Today banks and consulting firms struggle over compliance restrictions and even pay fines when employees misuse their brokerages. The way Argus works is pretty simple: charge firms like Bain, partner with brokerages like Schwab, and allow employees to trade on their existing accounts.

About the role
Skills: Python

About Us

Aer is building Rippling for compliance. Today compliance officers at funds, asset managers, and brokers have a fragmented stack across 5-10 legacy systems that don't speak to each other and don't drive best outcomes. We're unifying these disparate systems into a single whole, and have just raised a round to do so. We process millions of trades and thousands of other data types annually.

Our Values

Building: We prioritize building the company and the team, together; we embrace risks and long shots.

Caring: We care deeply about each other, from celebrating the big wins and commiserating over losses to the casual conversations. Empathy defines our interactions.

Results: We are outcome-oriented.

About You

A builder looking to manage and improve our mission-critical data. You're comfortable at the strategic level building out metrics and dashboards for us to know the state of our data, and in the weeds figuring out why a single account isn't feeding. You can script to pull and manipulate data.

What We're Looking For

  • Scripting capabilities in Python
  • Comfort with financial trading data
  • Interest in financial services, capital markets, and/or crypto
  • Willingness to learn and move fast
Technology

We're building a trading frontend with an API and compliance backend. Our stack is React, Python.

job.title: Software Engineer
job.company_description: AI tutoring for schools
job.description:
About Flint
About the role
Skills: Node.js, React, TypeScript, PostgreSQL

About Us

Founded in May 2023, Flint is a pioneering AI platform that empowers K-12 schools to create personalized AI tutors for their students. Our platform enhances learning while ensuring the utmost protection of student data. Teachers can design AI tutors to facilitate 1-1 conversations with students, tailoring the learning experience based on custom objectives and materials. This unique approach to education has been embraced by top schools in and outside of the US, providing an engaging and effective learning experience for students. Flint is backed by Y Combinator and Afore Capital, with a leadership team that includes a second-time founder as CEO and a former Google engineer as CTO.

To learn more, you can check out our website at https://www.flintk12.com/.

Job Description

As a Software Engineer at Flint, you will be expected to:

  • Understand and adapt to rapidly evolving business and user needs
  • Actively participate in product feature ideation
  • Collaboratively design, develop, and deliver features

You‚Äôll join a lean team with rapidly growing revenue and will own product alongside Jinseo, our CTO. View Jinseo‚Äôs GitHub here.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Proficiency in TypeScript
  • Hands-on experience with React and Node.js
  • Keen interest in the application of AI in both formal and informal education settings
  • No academic qualifications or minimum number of years of experience required

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong opinions on product development
  • Trendy sense of UI/UX design
  • High level of attention to detail
  • Experience with NextJS
  • Familiarity with RDBMS

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Generous equity
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Home office stipend
  • Fully remote
  • Round-trip flight tickets to San Francisco every year

How to Apply

Apply here. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to reach out to Jinseo (jinseo at flintk12.com).

job.title: üí°Software Development Engineer (Frontend) - Vue.js, Vuex, Node.js
job.company_description: Modern ERP for Operations Leaders
job.description:
About Acho

Acho helps business teams turn data into apps. Anyone can connect different databases, build complex data pipelines, and build scalable data applications - all in one place with a point-and-click interface.

About the role
Skills: Vue.js, MySQL, Node.js, React, React Native, Linux

Overview

Acho is building the next-gen cloud data platform for teams across industries to access their data assets with great functionalities and visibility. Today, hundreds of business teams use Acho to transform their processes and unlock more value from their data than ever before. Team Acho is engineering-focused and collaborative. Backed by Y Combinator, VCs, and industry leaders, we aim to solve some of the hardest problems in the data space today.

As an engineer, you'll work on a variety of products and problems all across our company. You'll generate great product ideas, as well as architect, implement, and release them.

We love engineers owning projects, from start to finish. For example, new features often start off as customer ideas. So it could be your responsibility to talk to the customer and scope out what a solution might look like, in addition to actually building it, testing it, documenting it, and releasing iterating on it with the customer.

Qualification

BS or Master degree in Computer Science

1-3 years of experience in Frontend Development

You are passionate about technology and thrive in a dynamic environment with a focus on creative innovation over absolute perfection

Architecting, building, and maintaining web applications

Proficient in modern web client-side technologies and frameworks (Experience with Vue.js is preferred)

Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English

Necessary Skills

HTML, CSS

Modern JavaScript Framework (Experience with Vue.js is preferred)

Experience with SSR is a must

SEO Optimization

Webpack

API Design

Database (MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)

Technology
  •          HTML & CSS
  •          Javascript (Vue.js, bootstrap, axios, redux, google analytics, jquery, datatables, webpack)
  •          RESTful API Design & Implementation (OpenAPI)
  •          MySQL Commands & Utilities (Mysqldump...)
  •          Elasticsearch
  •          DynamoDB
  •          Docker & Docker-compose
  •          Python3 (Requests, PyMySQL, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, multiprocessing, apscheduler, pandas, numpy...)
  •          Linux Commands & Utilities (Ubuntu, screen, crontab)
  •          Kubernetes (GKE)
  •          Load Balancer (Ingress)
  •          Compute Engine (GCE)
  •          Cloud Endpoint
  •          MySQL (Cloud SQL)
  •          Redis

What does the interview process look like?

Can I work remotely?

What‚Äôs it like working for a startup?

  • Being a small nimble team is the best way to grow fast both personally and collectively as a team. We tend to debunk some of the stereotypes about working at a startup. We rarely work overtime. What‚Äôs special about team Acho?

The bigger our goal is, the more and harder the problems become. We‚Äôd always want to be the team that solves the most, and hardest problems.
