job.title: Software Engineer
job.company_description: AI expert on any codebase in natural language, accessible via API
job.description:
About Greptile

Greptile is an AI expert on any codebase, available as an API. Developers and teams at over 300 companies use Greptile to build internal tools including AI PR review bots and automatic documentation updaters.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Hi! We‚Äôre looking for a software engineer to join us at Greptile.

About Greptile:

Greptile is building an AI expert on any codebase, which you can query using an API. Software teams use it to build custom internal AI dev tools like code reviewers and debugging assistants.

Devs can point Greptile to any GitHub/Gitlab repo, Greptile indexes it (self-updates on new commits) and lets you query it in natural language. Greptile uses a codebase-optimized version of RAG which mimics how human developers navigate codebases, resulting in much higher performance than naive RAG.

Company:

We have raised $5.2M to date from investors like YC and Initialized Capital and have very little monthly burn.

As of Aug 2024, we serve over 700 software teams and have high 6-figure annualized revenue.

We‚Äôre a team of 6, based in San Francisco.


Requirements:

  • Strong programming skills, especially in TS/JS.
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science
  • Work authorization in the US
  • Ability and willingness to relocating to work in-person in San Francisco.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • History of contributing to open source.
  • Passionate about developer tooling.
  • Ability to work relatively independently.
  • Strong side projects, ideally using LLMs.
  • Some DevOps experience, ideally with AWS.
  • Some LLM-Ops experience, working with VectorDBs/LLMs.

Tech stack:

Most of our codebase is in Typescript. Our backend infra is hosted on AWS, combination of ECS containers and Lambda functions + Postgres and DynamoDB for database. The frontend is NextJS.

Technology

Backend: Node, TypeScript, AWS ECS/Lambda, PostgresFrontend: NextJS

Interview Process
  1. We review your materials (GitHub, projects, past work)
  2. We do an intro call over Zoom.
  3. We do a second meeting (if possible, in-person in SF)
  4. We give you a decision within a week.

job.location: New York, NY, US / Boston, MA, US / Remote (US)
job.title: Founding AI Engineer
job.company_description: AI-enabled procurement software for government
job.description:
About Hazel

Our mission at Hazel is simple and powerful. We use AI to help U.S. government purchasing teams buy at the speed of need with unparalleled efficiency and cost-effectiveness. It is a $2.7T problem every single year, and Hazel is at the forefront with State, Local, and EDucation (SLED) and federal government agencies.

Government procurement has moved at a glacial pace for decades, stovepiped by complex processes, regulatory capture, and overworked civil servants. The impacts are severe. Our founders saw at Palantir and BCG how lowly procurement challenges fueled wildfires across California, compromised critical U.S. national security systems, and wasted billions of dollars.

Hazel has identified a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to solve this by deploying cutting-edge AI to the public sector and unlocking the full potential of our nation. We empower our partners to move with expediency against the most pressing challenges of this century including climate sustainability, great power competition, and more. Hazel builds AI for the public interest.The founders August and Elton saw this problem firsthand at Palantir and BCG, and they have enlisted a deep bench of investors from both tech and government to deploy one of the first real commercial applications of generative AI in the public sector.

About the role
Note: These roles are exclusively available to U.S. citizens who can obtain and maintain a U.S. government-issued Top Secret security clearance. There are no exceptions.

Who We Are: 

Our mission at Hazel is simple and powerful. We use AI to help U.S. government purchasing teams buy at the speed of need with unparalleled efficiency and cost-effectiveness. It is a $2.7T problem every single year, and Hazel is at the forefront with State, Local, and EDucation (SLED) and federal government agencies.

Government procurement has moved at a glacial pace for decades, stovepiped by complex processes, regulatory capture, and overworked civil servants. The impacts are severe. Our founders saw at Palantir and BCG how lowly procurement challenges fueled wildfires across California, compromised critical U.S. national security systems, and wasted billions of dollars.

Hazel has identified a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to solve this by deploying cutting-edge AI to the public sector and unlocking the full potential of our nation. We empower our partners to move with expediency against the most pressing challenges of this century including climate sustainability, great power competition, and more. Hazel builds AI for the public interest. 

What We Are Building: 

Hazel is transforming government procurement ‚Äì how government agencies purchase goods and services from commercial vendors. This includes everything from copy paper to wind turbines to nuclear submarines. Our platform supports the full lifecycle of government procurement from need identification through award management. Hazel‚Äôs partners include state & local governments, schools, and federal agencies with whom we develop a product with features including: 

  • AI labeling and categorization of solicitation text documents 

  • Creation of solicitation documents with generative AI 

  • Vendor discovery, labeling, and identification 

  • Purchasing decision optimization with data-driven insights 

  • Indexing and referencing of compliance documents

Why Join Hazel: 

As a Hazel founding engineer, you will gain unparalleled access and insight into how top government stakeholders manage billion-dollar purchasing decisions. You‚Äôll then turn those insights into product by owning development of one of the most innovative, consequential, and secure software solutions in government today. This includes building secure large language models, integrating and training them on unstructured text data from over 19,000 agencies, and building a responsive front-end cloud-hosted application. You will be on the ground with us as we pitch and deliver solutions to our customers across the nation. Only Hazel offers the cadence and rigor of a tech startup paired with the impact and mission of the public sector. 

You‚Äôll work side-by-side with inquisitive and driven founders who want to grow with and support you every way they can. The founders continuously promote learning (about everything) and have numerous resources available from other founders/startups/VCs.

Hazel is a mission-driven organization founded by engineers and built around delivering world-class innovation to our government partners. We strive for excellence, deliver impact, and have fun doing it.

 

How You Fit Us: 

You care about mission. Hazel partners with agencies supporting everything from public school teachers in the classroom to warfighters in the field. We believe in products which change America for the better. 

You solve problems. There‚Äôs no more time to opine on strategy and policy when our nation faces existential challenges, today. We are workhorses, not showhorses.

You are always learning. Nobody has all the answers, and the world is ever-evolving ‚Äì so we must be adaptive. We bring the best practices available from all domains to meet the challenge.

You believe in teamwork. Our team grows together, supports one another, and elevates our shared successes. We are more effective together.

 

About the Role: 

As Hazel‚Äôs founding AI engineer, you will lead Hazel‚Äôs AI efforts and establish game-changing and secure usage of large language models (LLMs) in government. You will train and implement best-in-class large language models for procurement tasks, from generating solicitation content to evaluating solicitation responses.  You will discover and implement the best use cases for LLMs for Hazel‚Äôs users. You will help define team norms, operating principles, team culture, and more. Most importantly, you join the tip of the spear in delivering effective and secure AI for the public sector. 

What You‚Äôll Do Day-to-Day: 

  • Develop and deploy LLMs across the full stack, from enriching data to generating actions in the application 

  • Establish and refine processes for implementing LLMs, including best practices for prompting, experimentation/evaluation, LLM Ops, and measuring quality and performance 

  • Collaborate with colleagues, customers, and partners to understand key tactical and strategic priorities and deliver innovative, impactful solutions 

  • Take ownership of projects, ensuring they meet rigorous standards of quality, performance, and security 

What We‚Äôre Looking For: 

  • Proven experience as an AI engineer or similar role 

  • Strong skills in data processing tools and techniques; proficiency in Python  

  • Experience with LLM Ops and tools (e.g. vector databases, RAG, prompting) 

  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) 

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure), server management, CI/CD tools, and software infrastructure fundamentals (networking, security, distributed systems) 

  • Strong technical writing abilities to support user training, product documentation, and proposal writing 

  • Excitement about bringing innovation to the public sector 

  • Continuous drive towards learning and personal development 

  • Travel 25-50% to co-locate with the team in New York/Boston or onsite to customer locations in the U.S. 

  • U.S. Citizen, with the ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret U.S. government-issued security clearance 

Nice to Have Experience: 

  • Developing and deploying LLMs in applications, with a strong intuition of what works and what doesn‚Äôt 

  • Parallel programming and design practices using GPUs 

  • Mapping business priorities to technical priorities and vice versa 

  • Working with or adjacent to the public sector 

  • Presenting to senior stakeholders (e.g., C-suite, elected official, general officer) in a professional context 

Base Salary Range: 

$120K - $200K USD | 1% - 2% Company Equity 

  • Estimate provided is dependent on a wide range of factors, including years of experience, relevant knowledge, and security clearance 

  • Generous health & 401(k) benefits 

  • Relocation Assistance 

  • Unlimited PTO 

Hazel is an Equal‚ÄØOpportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class. 

 

Hazel‚Äôs name is inspired by Hazel Ying Lee, one of the first Chinese-American women to serve in the U.S. military as a member of the Women Airforce Service Pilots in World War II. All Americans can break barriers, dare to innovate, and be the change. 

Technology

Hazel is transforming government procurement ‚Äì how government agencies purchase goods and services from commercial vendors. This includes everything from copy paper to wind turbines to nuclear submarines. Our platform supports the full lifecycle of government procurement from need identification through award management. Hazel‚Äôs partners include state & local governments, schools, and federal agencies with whom we develop a product with features including:

  • AI labeling and categorization of solicitation text documents
  • Creation of solicitation documents with generative AI
  • Vendor discovery, labeling, and identification
  • Purchasing decision optimization with data-driven insights
  • Indexing and referencing of compliance documents

Hazel has identified a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to solve this by deploying cutting-edge AI to the public sector and unlocking the full potential of our nation. We empower our partners to move with expediency against the most pressing challenges of this century including climate sustainability, great power competition, and more. Hazel builds AI for the public interest.

What We Are Building: 

Hazel is transforming government procurement ‚Äì how government agencies purchase goods and services from commercial vendors. This includes everything from copy paper to wind turbines to nuclear submarines. Our platform supports the full lifecycle of government procurement from need identification through award management. Hazel‚Äôs partners include state & local governments, schools, and federal agencies with whom we develop a product with features including: 

  • AI labeling and categorization of solicitation text documents 
  • Creation of solicitation documents with generative AI 
  • Vendor discovery, labeling, and identification 
  • Purchasing decision optimization with data-driven insights 
  • Indexing and referencing of compliance documents

 

Why Join Hazel: 

As a Hazel founding engineer, you will gain unparalleled access and insight into how top government stakeholders manage billion-dollar purchasing decisions. You‚Äôll then turn those insights into product by owning development of one of the most innovative, consequential, and secure software solutions in government today. This includes building secure large language models, integrating and training them on unstructured text data from over 19,000 agencies, and building a responsive front-end cloud-hosted application. Only Hazel offers the cadence and rigor of a tech startup paired with the impact and mission of the public sector.

You‚Äôll work side-by-side with inquisitive and driven founders who want to grow with and support you every way they can. The founders continuously promote learning (about everything) and have numerous resources available from other founders/startups/VCs.

Hazel is a mission-driven organization founded by engineers and built around delivering world-class innovation to our government partners. We strive for excellence, deliver impact, and have fun doing it.

 

How You Fit Us: 

You care about mission. Hazel partners with agencies supporting everything from public school teachers in the classroom to warfighters in the field. We believe in products which change America for the better. 

You solve problems. There‚Äôs no more time to opine on strategy and policy when our nation faces existential challenges, today. We are workhorses, not showhorses. 

You are always learning. Nobody has all the answers, and the world is ever-evolving ‚Äì so we must be adaptive. We bring the best practices available from all domains to meet the challenge. 

You believe in team. Our team grows together, supports one another, and elevates our shared successes. We are more effective together. 

  

About the Role: 

As Hazel‚Äôs founding full stack engineer, you will be at the helm of architecting and building Hazel‚Äôs platform. You will work closely with Hazel‚Äôs customers to identify pain points to prioritize the most impactful features.  You will build new features every week and be faced with many challenging technical problems. You will help define team norms, operating principles, team culture, and more. Most importantly, you join the tip of the spear in delivering effective and secure AI for the public sector. 

What You‚Äôll Do Day-to-Day: 

  • Define, iterate, and execute on projects contributing to Hazel‚Äôs product roadmap to further accelerate customer procurement workflows 

  • Identify areas for process and technical improvements, and take the initiative to enhance engineering processes and structures 

  • Collaborate with colleagues, customers, and partners to understand key tactical and strategic priorities and deliver innovative, impactful solutions 

  • Take ownership of projects, ensuring they meet rigorous standards of quality, performance, and security 

What We‚Äôre Looking For: 

  • Proven experience as a full stack engineer or similar role 

  • Proficiency in front-end languages (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and modern UI frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue) 

  • Strong knowledge of back-end languages (e.g., Python) and frameworks 

  • Experience with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) 

  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) 

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure), server management, CI/CD tools, and software infrastructure fundamentals (networking, security, distributed systems) 

  • Familiarity with industry standard monitoring, logging, and data management tools and best practices 

  • Strong technical writing abilities to support user training, product documentation, and proposal writing 

  • Excitement about bringing innovation to the public sector 

  • Continuous drive towards learning and personal development 

  • Travel 25-50% to co-locate with the team in New York/Boston or onsite to customer locations in the U.S. 

  • U.S. Citizen, with the ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret U.S. government-issued security clearance 

Nice to Have Experience: 

  • Building or contributing to ‚Äúfrom scratch‚Äù applications that had many users 

  • Mapping business priorities to technical priorities and vice versa 

  • Working with or adjacent to the public sector 

  • Presenting to senior stakeholders (e.g., C-suite, elected official, general officer) in a professional context

Base Salary Range: 

$120K - $200K USD | 1% - 2% Company Equity 

  • Estimate provided is dependent on a wide range of factors, including years of experience, relevant knowledge, and security clearance 

  • Generous health & 401(k) benefits 

  • Relocation Assistance 

  • Unlimited PTO 

Hazel is an Equal‚ÄØOpportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Hazel‚Äôs name is inspired by Hazel Ying Lee, one of the first Chinese-American women to serve in the U.S. military as a member of the Women Airforce Service Pilots in World War II. All Americans can break barriers, dare to innovate, and be the change.

Technology

Hazel is transforming government procurement ‚Äì how government agencies purchase goods and services from commercial vendors. This includes everything from copy paper to wind turbines to nuclear submarines. Our platform supports the full lifecycle of government procurement from need identification through award management. Hazel‚Äôs partners include state & local governments, schools, and federal agencies with whom we develop a product with features including:

  • AI labeling and categorization of solicitation text documents
  • Creation of solicitation documents with generative AI
  • Vendor discovery, labeling, and identification
  • Purchasing decision optimization with data-driven insights
  • Indexing and referencing of compliance documents

job.title: Software Engineer
job.company_description: AI-powered talent sourcing for recruiters
job.description:
About Juicebox

For a long time, the recruiting tech industry has been a monopoly. But AI has created an opportunity to disrupt it.

Juicebox is an AI-powered recruiting platform. We help recruiters identify the best talent across 800mm+ profiles using natural language.

Business overview:

  • 300+ paying customers
  • Customers include Fortune 500, leading AI labs, and the largest recruiting agencies
  • Revenue is growing 20%+ month on month
  • Cash-flow positive
About the role
Skills: React, Elasticsearch, Firebase

About Juicebox

For a long time, the recruiting tech industry has been a monopoly. But AI has created an opportunity to disrupt it.

Juicebox is an AI-powered recruiting platform. We help recruiters identify the best talent across 800mm+ profiles using natural language.

Business overview:

  • 300+ paying customers
  • Customers include Fortune 500, leading AI labs, and the largest recruiting agencies
  • Revenue is growing 20%+ month on month
  • Cash-flow positive

The Role: Software Engineer

As a software engineer you‚Äôll play a key role in every engineering decision. You will work closely with the founders, Ishan and David, on building Juicebox ‚Äî ranging from iterating on LLM chains to building frontend components and optimizing search performance.

While your job title will be Software Engineer, your role will be closely tied to product work, focused on questions like:

  • How can we optimize ranking of profile results?
  • What new search filters or data sources can we add to our engine?
  • How can we delight our users in the first 5 minutes of signing up to Juicebox?

You will design, build, and execute product features from end to end ‚Äî many of which will be built upon LLMs. For example, recent projects have included integrating Google Scholar as a new data source and revamping the AI query pipeline that powers our search.

You will build out core analytics functions across user workflows, search engine performance, and LLM performance, helping shape the direction of the product.

You will engage with customers, investors, and the founding team to develop your own theses on product improvements, directions, and initiatives. You will implement improvements based on your customer conversations.

Our current tech stack includes:

  • Next.js + React in the frontend
  • Node.js in the backend
  • Firebase, OpenSearch, Kubernetes
  • AWS SQS, Glue, etc.
  • Open Source + OpenAI LLM Models

About You

  • You‚Äôre hungry to build something huge.
  • You‚Äôve built features with LLMs or launched a project in space.
  • You‚Äôve shown excellence: be it in your education, work experiences, projects, or anything else you can share.
  • You take asymmetric bets.
  • You want to take on a leadership role in the future.
  • You are hands-on, fast and learn best by building.
  • You have experience with the core of our stack: Next.js, React, Firebase, AWS, GCP
  • You are keen to become an expert in search, vector embeddings and ML.

Our Values

  1. Hyper focused on the customer.
  2. Speed wins: ship fast.
  3. Small teams enable outsized impact.
  4. Presence matters. In office, 5 days a week.
  5. You own the business. We are generous with equity grants.
  6. Transparency. We share what is going well, and what isn‚Äôt.
  7. Iteration. Things rarely work on the first try. We keep shipping.
Technology

Our current tech stack includes:

  • Next.js + React in the frontend
  • Node.js in the backend
  • Firebase, OpenSearch, Kubernetes, and several AWS + GCP services
  • Fine-tuned open source + OpenAI LLM Models
Interview Process

First Interview: with David Paffenholz or Ishan Gupta. You'll speak about your motivations, experience, and have the opportunity to ask questions about the role. Expect 15-20 mins.

Second Interview: with Ishan Gupta. You'll dive deeper into your experience with Juicebox's tech stack (15 mins) followed by a technical section (30 mins). The technical section involves questions around fundamental programming concepts, your experience around building large-scale / distributed systems, and some of the relevant frameworks you already have experience with. Expect 45-60 mins.

Third Interview: with Ishan Gupta, on-site in San Francisco. This interview has two sections: a technical assessment (45 mins) followed by a system design section (45 mins). For the technical assessment, you will focus on data structures, algorithms, graphs, and hands-on skills with JS web frameworks. The system design section will assess your ability to design large-scale systems. It will not involve a coding task. Expect 90 mins.

Fourth Interview: with David Paffenholz. You'll discuss potential user pain points and iterate on solutions to them (20-30 mins). Next, you will talk about your future goals and ambitions. Expect 30-45 mins.

job.title: Founding Frontend Engineer
job.company_description: AI-powered investment due diligence
job.description:
About Clarum

Clarum helps private equity firms conduct faster, more reliable, and cost-efficient due diligence with AI. Using Clarum, firms can upload documents from their data rooms to extract information, identify red flags and answer due diligence questionnaires.

We will be the platform that structures billions of data points changing how the private capital markets operate. Joining us will not only be fun but will have real impact on the future financial transactions.

About the role
Skills: React, TypeScript

We're searching for a Frontend Founding Engineer to be our first engineering hire and play a pivotal role in our future. Some problems you will work on include:

  • Developing and designing intuitive interfaces that simplify navigating through complex, high-volume data
  • Creating beautiful dashboards and fluid interactions for professionals at multi-billion-dollar funds

Location: If you're not in San Francisco, we'll cover your relocation. You must be down to be in SF and grind with us.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

Everything here is required.

  • 3+ years as a Frontend Engineer.
  • Expertise in Next.js and Tailwind.
  • Expertise in designing fluid interactions.
  • Very strong UI/UX design skills.
  • Experience in fast-paced environments with long hours.
  • Attributes: hard-working, ownership-driven, proactive, honest, accountable, adaptable, and a passion for learning.

Nice-to-have skills:

  • Familiarity with backend web servers and ML / LLMs
  • Understand of the finance industry
  • Experience architecting systems from the ground up and ownership of product

What you can expect:

  • Work closely with co-founders to shape product, technical, and cultural directions.
  • Challenging tasks and very long hours.
  • Personal and professional growth.
  • Ownership of the product.
  • Critical technical and design decisions.
  • Real impact on the future of the private capital markets.

Culture at Clarum

  • Our team values hard work and learning. We love working.
  • We're committed to helping you grow both personally and professionally.
  • Whether you‚Äôre aiming to be a top engineer or start your own company, we grow and win together.

Clarum Team

  • Anton Otaner, CEO: Former blockchain engineer and AR developer. Advocate for doing things because they are hard.

Hardest working person I know.

-Tommy He

  • Tommy He, CTO: Expert in low-latency trading systems and cryptography.

Best engineer I know.

-Anton Otaner

Technology
  • Next.js 14 (App router with SSR)
  • React
  • Tailwind
  • Python FastAPI
  • Postgres
  • GCP
  • Nix

We use LLMs for analyzing large amounts of text. We place a heavy emphasis on interpretability and the best UX for auditable and transparent results due to the nature of the financial industry. Due to industry requirements, we also are large proponents in open source and creative solutions for on-prem deployments.

job.title: Registered Dietitian at Fella Health ‚Äî Remote, US hours, $40/hr
job.company_description: The telehealth clinic for men with obesity
job.description:
About Fella Health

Fella Health is the telemedicine clinic for men with obesity, backed by Y Combinator.With Fella, patients meet an obesity specialist to prescribe FDA-approved medications, while they undertake personalized health coaching through our app.

Obesity is the largest chronic disease in the US (>$100bn spent each year) and the traditional solution ("move more, eat less") only works long-term for ~10% of people. But obesity treatment is radically changing due to a new wave of medication options which are 3x more effective than previous options. In addition, only 10% of those using weight management services are men: all programs market to women, not tackling the stigma men feel around this.

Fella's founder is Richie Cartwright (https://www.linkedin.com/in/richard-cartwright). Richie personally struggled with binge eating for 6 years. After studying at Cambridge University, he built and sold an AI company working with the UK government. He built a 10k-follower Instagram community around men's binge eating.

You can read more about working at Fella here:https://fella.notion.site/Working-at-Fella-14a2ac8575d34d148d009bb410387af4

Fella Health is live in 7 US states and has raised a Seed round to scale up. We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:

  • Y Combinator
  • Global Founders Capital ‚Äî backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet
  • AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)
  • BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)
  • The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)
About the role

About Fella Health

Fella Health helps middle-aged men live 10 years longer.

We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we‚Äôll become the world‚Äôs leading men‚Äôs health brand.

We‚Äôve grown >150x since Sept 2022, grown >10x since Nov 2023, and are strongly cashflow positive. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a long way to go. This is still Day 1.

You can read more about working at Fella here: https://fella.notion.site/Working-at-Fella-14a2ac8575d34d148d009bb410387af4

We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:

  • Y Combinator

  • Global Founders Capital ‚Äî backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet

  • AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)

  • BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)

  • The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)

The opportunity as Registered Dietitian

Fella is building a world-class team.

As a Registered Dietitian at Fella Health you‚Äôll work closely with our Clinical Ops Lead and Medical Team to provide high-quality nutrition advice and support for our Fellas during their weight loss journey. You‚Äôll meet with our Fellas synchronously and create an eating plan tailored to their needs, goals, and dietary preferences‚Äîall in a judgment-free zone. You‚Äôll also continuously provide feedback that will help improve our protocols & systems to ensure the best experience for our Fellas.

This is a part-time, fully remote role, and you‚Äôll work in the US timezone of your choice.

You'll work closely with our Clinical Ops Lead (Arvee Sese), Physician President (Rafid Fadul, MD), and our CEO (Richie Cartwright).

Key Responsibilities

Primary:

  • Individual Coaching: You'll be in charge of the nutrition coaching of our fellas. You'll triage fellas based on their health conditions, what type of problems they're facing, & their meal preferences, then develop an eating plan that will supplement their medication usage.

  • CX Concerns: You‚Äôll help fellas with any of their issues with the broader program by endorsing them to the careteam and monitoring their case until it is resolved.

Secondary:

  • RD Protocol Improvement: You'll work with our Clinical Ops Lead to improve the protocol. You'll gather important feedback from your fellas and proactively suggest improvements.

  • Improve our clinical systems : You‚Äôll work closely with our Ops Lead to provide feedback for our systems to improve your workflow.

Need to Have

  • Hours: you're able to work ‚â•10 hours/week.

  • License: you are licensed in either Michigan or Georgia.

  • Communication: you are a compelling and caring communicator over video & text, with sufficient tech literacy.

  • Empathy: you have a deep understanding of your fellas, knowing how to triage them and how best to keep them engaged.

  • Friend: many fellas have never opened up about this before, so you'll make the fella feel comfortable by being personable. You'll know when and how to joke around with the fella.

  • Resilience: this will be some of the most rewarding work you do, but it won't be easy and there will be resistance. You'll need to stay with each of your fellas.

Nice to Have

  • Experience: you have 1+ years of experience as a registered dietitian working in high-paced, consumer-centric telemedicine.

  • Obesity: ideally you have 1+ years working with patients with obesity taking GLP-1s (and maybe other medications).

  • Hours: you have a flexible schedule, being able to speak with fellas in mornings, afternoons, and evenings.

  • Education: maybe you have an advanced degree which gives you a powerful clinical understanding.

Our cultural standards

These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:

  • Belief in the mission ‚Äî we will have served 10 million fellas by the end of 2028 (1 million fellas by end of 2026) and we transform the life of most fellas who join. We have a lot of work to do. We are obsessed with our fellas and are dedicated to the mission.

  • Bulldozing barriers ‚Äî the world is malleable and we shape it. We truly believe this and act accordingly. We are relentlessly resourceful and are at the mercy of no-one but ourselves.

  • Unwavering integrity ‚Äî we are at the frontier, so we often live in ambiguity with no trodden path. When we can‚Äôt look to others for guidance, we must maintain impeccable ethics and unwavering integrity.

  • Enduring frugality ‚Äî we are frugal. We hate being wasteful and we are anti-luxury. We spend our cash wisely & carefully - in a way that would make our grandmas proud.

  • Do what is needed ‚Äî speed is critical and often the solutions we need are messy. We are comfortable moving quickly, taking on gritty work, and owning projects from noticing the problem to delivering the outcome.

  • Distaste for incompetence ‚Äî we‚Äôre highly capable. We have a dedication to excellence and reject incompetence. We‚Äôre obsessed with our role, with a commitment to compounding self-improvement.

  • Commitment to candor ‚Äî we believe in open communication and transparency. We are clear & caring communicators, welcoming feedback.

  • Only the paranoid survive ‚Äî the road of expansion is bumpy. We are not fair weather sailers; we embrace the storms. However much we‚Äôve already done, however far we‚Äôve already come ‚Äî all our work is still ahead of us.

  • Keep your head down ‚Äî we‚Äôre boring people doing exciting work. We don‚Äôt chase short-term status: we ignore short-term dopamine hits and focus on what matters. Outsiders will underestimate us and we revel in that.

üéØ ‚ÄúYou just build an amazing experience. Make each step amazing. Make every decision in the long term interest of the fella. Give the fella massively more value than you take.‚Äù ‚Äî a poetic extract from one of our advisors

Compensation & Benefits

  • Compensation: $40/hr (Salary + Equity)

  • Healthcare: comprehensive medical insurance (if appropriate)

  • Vacation: PTO with a yearly minimum (‚â•2wks/yr + local national holidays)

  • Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely

  • Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching

  • Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps

  • Coaching: free biweekly health coaching

  • Equipment: Macbook & work-from-home equipment provided as needed

  • What are we missing? We're still early so you get to shape our culture.

Technology

Our tech stack

  • React Native (Typescript) mobile app
  • React and Next.js web app
  • Node.js and Google Cloud Storage for data storage
  • Hosted on Google Cloud
  • Webflow landing pages

job.title: Software Engineer (Full-Stack)
job.company_description: Siting and Due Diligence of Green Projects
job.description:
About Paces

Paces is software for green infrastructure developers to identify the best places to build and manage their projects.

üõ†Ô∏è If you‚Äôre a builder who wants to actively construct a more climate positive future, join us!

üó∫Ô∏è We are enabling the climate optimum use for all the world‚Äôs land.

üåû We have paying renewable energy customers and are growing revenue each month, our software supports renewable energy, EV charging, carbon sequestration and data center customers with interconnection, permitting and siting of their projects.

üì¢ We raised $2.8M in a seed round, led by Resolute Ventures and Y Combinator.

About the role

In the next 30 years, the world will transform every part of the built environment to be climate positive green infrastructure. Knowing what, where, and how to build infrastructure like solar farms is one of the great opportunities of our time.

Paces is software for green infrastructure developers to identify the best places to build and manage their projects. Our software supports renewable energy, EV charging, carbon sequestration and data center customers with interconnection, permitting and siting of their projects. We are venture backed from Navitas Capital, Resolute Ventures, Y Combinator, and other top tier VCs.

üå≥ TL;DR

We are looking for a scrappy and customer centric full-stack engineer to join us as we scale up. You will have the chance to build things from ground up and own a large portion of the tech stack.

üèÜ What You‚Äôll Achieve

  • Lead development on large scale projects, collaborate closely with the product and engineering team
  • Optimize speed and scalability of our data heavy platform
  • Conduct user researches, iterate with users, improve user experience and identify new opportunities
  • Collaborate closely with our CTO and team to directly impact product roadmap

üìà Requirements

  • Proficient with React, JavaScript / TypesScript
  • Proficient with Python
  • You are a proactive and fast learner and able to pick up new things quickly
  • You genuinely want to build something people want, enjoy talking to users and learning their needs

‚ú® About You

You will thrive in our culture if you:

  • Have a strong bias towards action and prioritize execution
  • Share our passion to build something that fights climate change
  • Easily handle the unstructured environment of fast moving startups
  • Have the hunger to grow together with Paces as we scale up

üöÄ Bonus Points

  • Previous experience at a high-growth, fast-paced startup
  • Previous experience with map frameworks, such as Leaflet.js, Mapbox, and Google Maps
  • Previous experience scaling up data intensive, AI and analytics heavy solutions
  • Previous experience building and deploying on AWS

üí∞ Compensation and Benefits

  • 130K - 200K annual compensation
  • Competitive equity compensation
  • 401(k) matching
  • Health, Dental and Vision insurance
  • Hybrid working in the office 2-4 times per week
Technology

Javascript, Python

job.title: Full-time React Frontend Engineer Position at a Fast-growing Health Tech Startup
job.company_description: Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips
job.description:
About SiPhox Health

Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips

About the role
Skills: CSS, HTML, Node.js, React

About the Company

SiPhox Health is a hardware-first health-tech company.

Backed by Y Combinator, Intel, and Khosla Ventures we've spent 4 years building a hardware platform for at-home consumer blood diagnostics. In parallel, we launched (October 2022) a B2C + B2B2C platform that fuses mail-in blood biomarker testing with wearables data for personalized health insights.

We are the only D2C diagnostics or DaaS (Diagnostics as a Service) company that builds blood testing hardware.

Some links for reference:

  • SiPhoxhealth.com (note product offering, and about pages)
  • https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/19/intel-khosla-27m-siphox-health-at-home-blood-test-healthcare/
  • How our core technology works: https://medium.com/siphox-blog/trapping-light-a-brief-overview-of-silicon-micro-ring-optical-biosensors-4f05befd0711
  • A somewhat dated (2022) lab tour: https://youtu.be/u6oF_lyUsII

 

Company Mission

SiPhox Health is focused on increasing human healthspan by:

  • Deploying a consumer blood testing platform that delivers lab-quality results in the home
  • Building an ecosystem around this platform to enable data-driven healthcare
  • Democratizing access through chip-scale integration/Moore‚Äôs law (cost ‚¨áÔ∏è scalability ‚¨ÜÔ∏è performance ‚¨ÜÔ∏è)

 

Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a React developer with some Node.js tasks. The engineer will be responsible for the development and maintenance of web applications. Day-to-day tasks include designing user interactions on web pages, developing server-side APIs, and working with cross-functional teams to develop features that meet customer needs.

 

Qualifications

  • Javascript (Node.js) knowledge
  • Front-end development skills, including proficiency with HTML, CSS
  • Interest in learning back-end of the web-app
  • Proficiency with RESTful APIs, curl
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  • Familiarity with Git and agile development methodologies
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field is a plus
  • Experience with Healthcare IT, Electronic Health Records (EHR) and Health Information Exchange (HIE) is a plus.

 

Additional Requirements

  • Conversational English is a must
  • At least 2 years of experience in react
  • Must not work in an agency

 

Note:

  • All applicants must complete a short Javascript or React task to be considered.
Technology

We are developing a new paradigm for consumer health tech wearables by replacing a 100lb optical instrument with an area of silicon smaller than a postage stamp.

Interview Process

The first stage will consist of a technical assignment.

If the first stage is completed successfully, the second stage will be a quick non-technical interview with the PM.

The third stage will be a technical interview with the lead developer.

The fourth and final stage will be one final meeting with the PM and relevant managers.

All non-technical meetings will be short (15-30 minutes). The technical assignment should not take a significant amount of time.

job.title: Silicon Photonics Engineer / Associate Silicon Photonics Engineer
job.company_description: Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips
job.description:
About SiPhox Health

Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips

About the role
Skills: MATLAB, Python

SiPhox Health is developing a revolutionary home testing platform for biomarkers linked with inflammation, hormones, and metabolic/cardiovascular health. 6 out of 10 Americans have a chronic disease, and our mission is to enable new direct-to-consumer health and wellness paradigms to address this crisis. Our chip-based solution combines biochemistry with state-of-the-art integrated photonics, electronics, and microfluidics.

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Silicon Photonics Engineer to join our team as we scale up and advance the photonics capabilities that power our system.

Key responsibilities:

  • Design and verification of novel photonic devices and circuits
  • Build and refine experimental setups for effectively coupling light into optical chips
  • Conduct detailed optical measurements and functional biosensing experiments to characterize the performance of photonic devices
  • Analyze data from wafer and chip characterization to assess and improve device performance
  • Document results and clearly present findings and insights to the team

Qualifications and Skills:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in integrated photonics (Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, Optics, or related field)
  • Experience participating in or leading design/layout/characterization cycles of photonic devices with commercial foundries
  • Demonstrated track record of creative multidisciplinary design and hands-on problem solving to bring those designs to fruition
  • Expert with photonic characterization tools such as lasers, photodetectors, and data acquisition systems
  • Experience in photonics simulation software such as Tidy3D, Lumerical, or COMSOL Multiphysics
  • Experience in photonics layout software such as Luceda IPKISS, KLayout, gdsfactory, Cadence, or Synopsys
  • Proficient in Python or MATLAB
  • Familiarity with one or more is a plus: biosensors, microfluidics, optical chip packaging
Technology

We are developing a new paradigm for consumer health tech wearables by replacing a 100lb optical instrument with an area of silicon smaller than a postage stamp.

job.title: Lab Automation Engineer
job.company_description: Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips
job.description:
About SiPhox Health

Wearable and At-Home protein monitoring with silicon photonic chips

About the role
Skills: Git, Python, CAD Design

SiPhox Health is developing a revolutionary home testing platform for biomarkers linked with inflammation, hormones, and metabolic/cardiovascular health. 6 out of 10 Americans have a chronic disease, and our mission is to enable new direct-to-consumer health and wellness paradigms to address this crisis. Our chip-based solution combines biochemistry with state-of-the-art integrated photonics, electronics, and microfluidics.

 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled Lab Automation Engineer to join our team. The primary responsibility of this role is to manage the setup, maintenance, troubleshooting, and improvement of hardware stations used for biomedical assay development which are based on liquid handling robots such as the Opentrons OT-2 automation platform. The ideal candidate will have experience in both mechanical and software troubleshooting and will be responsible for operating the systems efficiently.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Configure and maintain assay development hardware stations.
  • Contribute to the development of calibration protocols and perform routine maintenance and repairs.
  • Diagnose mechanical and software issues and drive issues to resolution.
  • Collaborate with engineering and software teams on system improvements that minimize downtime and improve performance.
  • Operate assay development hardware stations efficiently and accurately as per standard operating procedures.
  • Train and support scientists and research associates in preparing and conducting automation runs.
  • Document and report any operational issues or anomalies.
  • Evaluate and recommend opportunities for process improvements and automation enhancements.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of new automation protocols.

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Biomedical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or a related field.
  • Experience controlling robotic equipment in a research lab environment.
  • Strong mechanical and software troubleshooting skills.
  • Familiarity with using software languages such as Python for instrument control.
  • Familiarity with assay development and biology laboratory protocols in a BSL-2 lab environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in a medtech or biotech startup environment.
  • Proven experience in operating and troubleshooting automation platforms from vendors such as Opentrons, Tecan, and Hamilton.
  • Proficient in writing and optimizing Python scripts for instrument control.
  • Familiarity using Git for software version control.
  • Hands-on experience with 3D printing technology and CAD design for prototyping and custom part fabrication.
Technology

We are developing a new paradigm for consumer health tech wearables by replacing a 100lb optical instrument with an area of silicon smaller than a postage stamp.

SiPhox Health is looking for a highly driven photonics packaging automation engineer with CAD and Python experience.

job.title: Founding Software Engineer
job.company_description: Pricing for grocers with competitive data
job.description:
About BetterBasket

We help food and beverage businesses increase margin and sell-through with an end to end approach to merchandising, using AI to recommend pricing and assortment changes.

BetterBasket is supported by advisors doing industry-leading research at Wharton (UPenn), combining theoretical foundations with our founders' on-the-ground experience launching the grocery platform at Uber Eats.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, Python, SQL

Why not BetterBasket?

We don‚Äôt believe in wasting your time. Here are some reasons you should not apply:

  • You are looking for a manager to be told what to do - how to fix a bug, the right approach for a problem, what‚Äôs next for your career. You will be accountable for your own work, but what is possible will be bound only by your ambition, ideas, and the $800bn grocery industry.
  • You want a job with work-life balance. Recharging is essential, but we‚Äôre working on such exciting projects at the frontier of retail and AI (which our customers can‚Äôt wait to use!) that we can‚Äôt stop thinking about our next sprint.
  • You question if things are ‚Äúworth it‚Äù - if this job is worth the ‚Äúopportunity cost‚Äù of a Big Tech salary, if grinding out a feature was worth a late night. You will be given everything needed to be comfortable and the upside of a founder, but we know exceptional things are only done with great sacrifice that compound over time.

What are you working on?

  • BetterBasket is developing the first fully integrated pricing solution for grocers, coming from our founders‚Äô experience launching Uber Eats‚Äô global grocery delivery platform. We‚Äôre working on everything from pricing algorithms to custom digital price tags in order to create a revolutionary product to transform the $800bn grocery industry.
  • We‚Äôre already working with top 100 international grocers in North America and LatAm on dynamic pricing and market data, and from day one you‚Äôll be working closely with leaders and subject matter experts at our customers on their top priorities.
  • BetterBasket is backed by top investors like Y Combinator and Aito Capital as well as founders and C-suite executives at YouTube, Uber, Amazon, Tesco, and GoodRx.
  • Our work environment is collaborative and inclusive, fostering growth and learning. If you‚Äôre eager to be part of a fast-moving, innovative team that values your development, we want you on our team.

What technologies do you use?

Core Competencies

  • Python (ML libraries, concurrency)
  • HTTP/REST API
  • Javascript (Typescript, React, Node)
  • SQL (Locks, Stored Procedures)
  • Cloud / DevOps (Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis)

Nice to Have

  • Product design (Figma)
  • Inference at scale
  • Scraping (Scrapy, Selenium)
  • Wireless Communication Protocols

What can I work on?

BetterBasket is developing the first fully integrated pricing solution for grocers. Problems that you could work on as a hands-on founding engineer include but are not limited to:

  • How can we extract and classify data at scale from online stores towards a centralized product knowledge graph?
  • How can we maximize profits for a grocer by modeling competitive prices, historical sales data, elasticity estimates, and external variables?
  • How can price changes be triggered and performed automatically?
  • What‚Äôs the best way to summarize and present the results of our actions?

What‚Äôs in it for me?

  • Take ownership of products that will revolutionize the grocery industry
  • Collaborate with a tight-knit team of talented builders
  • Work closely with customers from day 1 and see the results of your work
  • Launch products that directly impact people‚Äôs lives
  • Work with the co-founders daily in-person in SF
  • Competitive salary, equity, health insurance

 

If you‚Äôve gotten this far and our culture and tech resonate with you, we want you to apply.

Technology
  • OCR: Build efficient OCR algorithms to efficiently extract information from photos of grocery items.
  • NLP: Utilise NLP in item matching, popularity and reviews understanding and classification.
  • Machine Learning: Develop and implement machine learning models for pricing and item matching, working with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights.
  • Cloud and Containerization: While not mandatory, knowledge of Azure cloud and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes) is a plus.

job.title: Lead Designer
job.company_description: We're Robinhood for pre-IPO startups. Everyone can invest $100.
job.description:
About Wefunder

We're the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups. We allow everyone to invest $100 in a startup they love.

Over the past five years, we've helped fund over 900 startups with $500m ‚Äì including flying cars, space rockets, breweries, Hollywood studios, and potential Ebola cures.

We‚Äôre now doubling the size of our team to handle the growth. Trying to keep up!

We‚Äôre also a public benefit corporation with a mission of saving the American Dream (https://wefunder.com/charter). Our aim is to sprinkle the Silicon Valley fairy dust across the rest of the country, which often don‚Äôt have the same opportunities we take for granted.

About the role
Skills: Figma, CSS, HTML

You‚Äôll report directly to the CEO and lead product across the entire company.

Good design is incredibly important to us. We believe beautiful software is the sum of thousands of small details, done just right, guided by good taste.

We're looking for someone obsessed with nailing those details. Someone that will not only "make it pretty", but who is excited to figure out what our users (both founders and investors) want.

You will help guard the "soul" of our product. It's an important job.

Dream Candidate

Our ideal candidate has a head start on understanding our users: they've either founded a company, worked with a founding team, or invested in a startup.

You are also very good at simplifying complexity. The law is complicated: often, a web page might have a dozen variations for legal reasons. You'll need an engineering-like brain to keep track of these details. But you'll also need to be an empath to understand our users.

Finally, you thrive in the chaos of working in a small team in a fast moving startup. You love ambiguity. You love taking initiative and not being told what to do. You want to work hard because that‚Äôs how to maximize your learning and impact.

Requirements

  • You thrive in in-person work cultures and will show up to our San Francisco office.
  • Your portfolio is beautiful. You bleed minimalism and simplicity.
  • You have a critical eye for detail. If it's not pixel-perfect, it drives you crazy.
  • You can code up some CSS and HTML in a pinch and submit to a git repository. We don't expect full-fledged engineering skills, but believe that designers who understand the medium are better at their jobs.
  • You are excited to talk and learn from our users: both founders and investors.
  • You have good judgement on when to A/B test and use data... and when to lead with taste.
  • You are good at understanding complexity and then simplifying it.

Responsibilities

  • Redesign Wefunder with a new, more modern design system. We have a lot of design debt.
  • Lead new projects. Create detailed Figma mockups and then work with engineers iteratively until deployed to production. (Brownie points if you prefer HTML mockups). Monitor in production, talk to users, measure data, and iterate again.
  • Work with our support team to prioritize and solve common investor problems
  • Be a resource to engineers when they need design help with whatever they are working on. (Every engineer also has the autonomy to contribute to product).
  • Screen product suggestions from the team and suggest improvements.

Some Projects You Could be Working On

While you are onboarding, you‚Äôll help modernize Wefunder with a new design system, incrementally improving what already exists. This is one of the best ways to get context.

Once you are ready, you‚Äôll help us reach the next level of product-market fit.

The vision of Wefunder has always been community. Right now, we're pretty good at transferring money from Point A to Point B. But what happens after the company is funded? Can we connect founders with more help and mentorship when they need it? Can investors feel more "behind the scenes" and emotionally invested? Can investing in ideas they support be part of their identity, like it is in Silicon Valley? Can we educate the hundreds of thousands of new investors better? Can investors talk to each other and collaborate, and make better investing decisions? These are some of the challenges we'll have.

Benefits

  • $180k to $250k plus equity depending on experience
  • Unlimited vacation days (mandatory 3 weeks off)
  • Medical, dental, & vision insurance
  • 401K
  • Apple equipment. Whatever you want.
  • Lots of free food and drinks
  • Reimbursement for classes and conferences

To Apply

Email dinkiÔº†wefunder.com with why you'd like to work for us, and provide links to your work.

About Wefunder

We help anyone angel invest as little as $100 in the startups they love.

We've helped thousands of startups and small businesses ‚Äì including flying cars, space rockets, breweries, Hollywood studios, and potential Ebola cures ‚Äì raise almost a billion dollars.

We're a Public Benefit Corporation with a mission to revitalize capitalism and keep the American dream alive. GDP growth is slowing. Wealth inequality is increasing. Entrepreneurship is dying across America; falling from 10.6% to 3.6% among those under 30 since 1989. We're reversing these trends by funding more deserving businesses across all of America, not solely tech startups in Silicon Valley.

Want to help? Join us! We're a team of founder types: enjoy autonomy, responsibility, the opportunity to learn, and no red tape. Just make it happen.

Wefunder's story:https://wefunder.com/wefunder

Our Public Benefit Corp mission: https://wefunder.com/charter

Technology

Heroku, Rails, React

job.title: Fundraising Lead
job.company_description: We're Robinhood for pre-IPO startups. Everyone can invest $100.
job.description:
About Wefunder

We're the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups. We allow everyone to invest $100 in a startup they love.

Over the past five years, we've helped fund over 900 startups with $500m ‚Äì including flying cars, space rockets, breweries, Hollywood studios, and potential Ebola cures.

We‚Äôre now doubling the size of our team to handle the growth. Trying to keep up!

We‚Äôre also a public benefit corporation with a mission of saving the American Dream (https://wefunder.com/charter). Our aim is to sprinkle the Silicon Valley fairy dust across the rest of the country, which often don‚Äôt have the same opportunities we take for granted.

About the role

We help everyday people to invest in the startups they love.

Wefunder is the largest funding platform connecting founders with their community to invest. Over the past few years, we've helped fund over 1,000 pre-IPO startups with $500M+ of capital, from early-stage moonshots to unicorns.

Wefunder's Story üí°  https://wefunder.com/wefunder

Our Public Benefit Corp Mission üéô https://wefunder.com/charter

Why Wefunder

Note: This position is based in San Francisco.

We‚Äôre a team of founder types. Your potential matters more than your background or experience; we‚Äôre the company where you can take your shot. Everyone is here to learn and grow, to work on a meaningful product, and to fix capitalism. We‚Äôve spent years lobbying congress to fix the law, and in turn, created this industry.

  • üí∞ Salary Range: $75k - $90k
  • üöÄ Generous stock options package.
  • üèù Unlimited vacation days with no less than 3 weeks off.
  • üöû All-expense-paid Wefunder vacation once a year.
  • üò∑ Medical, dental, & vision insurance.
  • üíª Apple equipment. Whatever you want.
  • üßá Lots of free food and drinks. That includes daily lunch and weekly team dinners.
  • üìö Classes & conferences. If you can learn something useful, we'll pay for it.

Your Role

Manage a Community Round. Work one on one with founders to help them raise money. You‚Äôll work with companies at every stage, across all types of industries, raising anything from a pre-seed round to a Series B. You‚Äôre the nerve center that makes the rest of the body work; coordinate with the founder and their team, the internal Wefunder marketing team, and external partners to ensure the Community Round is a success.

Source paying clients. Work with the Business Development team to find and onboard founders looking to do a Community Round. You‚Äôre selling a service, but you‚Äôre also selling your own competence and expertise - you need to be able to convince the people around you of your ability to execute.

Be a creative marketing genius. ****The traditional marketing playbook doesn't always work for Community Rounds. You‚Äôre the evil genius behind QR codes on physical products, fliers to put in shipping boxes, webinars with interesting speakers, and so much more.

Manage multiple fundraises at once. You‚Äôll juggle multiple campaigns at once. That means ruthlessly prioritizing your to-do list, and being flexible enough to change it on the fly. Founders will come to rely on you as much as someone on their own team.

Skills & Experience

  • Strong people skills. You‚Äôll be working with founders and their team. You‚Äôre empathetic and opinionated. You‚Äôre creative in finding solutions, and think like a founder.
  • Honest and good communicator. You should have a talent for making people feel comfortable so you can tell them the truth which can be different from what they believe. You are an excellent writer championing engaging and authentic writing.
  • You have incredible organizational skills. You can stay on top of managing internal operations, calls, and debugging all while make sure that balls do not get dropped when dealing with multiple stakeholders.
  • Creative. You will need to come up with different ways to sell a myriad of products and services from SAAS to bakeries. You have a good eye for visual storytelling. We think stories have more emotional impact if they are designed well.
  • You‚Äôre extremely accountable and reliable. If you say you‚Äôll do something, you‚Äôll get it done.

*If you feel like you don't meet all of the points above, but love this role, we encourage you to apply anyways. We don't want a confidence gap and imposter syndrome to get in the way of meeting incredible candidates.*ü¶Ñ

To Apply

To apply, email Suzanna [suzanna[AT]wefunder.com] with your CV or LinkedIn and why you'd like to work with us.

Technology

Heroku, Rails, React

job.title: Software Engineer (Back-End)
job.company_description: Modern data platform for battery science
job.description:
About Byterat

Byterat is a modern data platform for battery science. We provide battery teams at companies like Panasonic or Tesla with the core data platform they need to innovate, securely at scale. Byterat runs in the background of a battery lab, and enables scientists to analyze thousands of parallel experiments at once to connect the dots between battery design and performance.

About the role
Skills: Machine learning, Git, Data Modeling, Python, Elasticsearch, ETL, PostgreSQL

About Byterat

Byterat is the modern data platform for battery science. We give battery teams at companies like Panasonic or Tesla the core data platform they need to innovate, securely at scale.

We‚Äôre a well-funded, VC-backed start-up with customers and recurring revenue. We‚Äôre backed by world-class investors like Y Combinator, Giant Ventures and Collaborative Fund, and angels such as founders of Zendesk and Voi, and executives from Google, Meta and Figma. 

We‚Äôre growing rapidly, which presents career-defining opportunities for ambitious engineers to accelerate their growth and contribute to a quickly evolving startup in SF. You‚Äôll be joining our in-person team of engineers and physicists with backgrounds from Rivian, Carnegie Mellon, Georgia Tech, Shopify, U. Cambridge and other YC start-ups.

Our Mission

  • Batteries play a key role in tackling climate change. $73B was invested in US battery plants in 2022, and battery company revenue is expected to grow >5x over the next decade.
  • Global carmakers alone are forecast to spend $515B on electric vehicle and battery R&D by 2030. But battery engineers are woefully underserved by software, relying on broken legacy products to analyze their data. Most data is never analyzed or used meaningfully.
  • Byterat is the first platform to provide battery teams with the infrastructure they need to unlock business value from their battery data. Byterat is live in battery labs across three continents today, allowing teams to analyze data from thousands of parallel experiments and unlock previously hidden insights connecting battery design to performance.

We might be a fit for you if‚Ä¶

  • You‚Äôre ambitious and you want to move fast. You want to accelerate your trajectory and have an outsized impact on a rapidly growing VC-backed startup in SF.
  • You‚Äôre hard-working. You‚Äôre a team player. You can communicate effectively and respectfully. You pay attention to details. You like to solve the most important problems and you‚Äôre good at doing that. You adapt quickly.
  • You want to join a strong, supportive, high-performance team, and work in-person in SF. You set an exceptionally high performance bar for yourself and everyone on the team.
  • You are not afraid to communicate what is working and what needs to improve.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you‚Äôre given autonomy to build core features.

Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Experience: 1-4 years of experience in data engineering and visualization, focusing on actionable insights.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, Python, and experience with DBT, Airflow, Mage, and Git.
  • Cloud Technologies: Experience with cloud services like S3, ECS, EMR, Lambdas, and Glue.
  • ETL & Data Engineering: Background in ETL processes, data modeling, and data engineering best practices.
  • Elasticsearch: Exposure to Elasticsearch for indexing, querying, and managing large datasets.
  • Time Series Data: Familiarity with time series data and tools such as PostgreSQL, Druid, TimescaleDB, and InfluxDB is a plus.
  • Machine Learning: Understanding of integrating machine learning models into data workflows to extract meaningful insights.
  • Visualization Expertise: Skills in creating impactful visualizations.
  • Communication: Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a focus on meeting client needs.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines, transforming data from multiple sources into our data lakes.
  • Contribute to the design, implementation, and management of data models and workflows, ensuring scalability and performance.
  • Help integrate data from diverse sources, including both structured and unstructured data, into cohesive datasets.
  • Use tools like DBT, Airflow, and Mage to transform and load data into analytics platforms.
  • Support the automation of data processing and visualization updates using Managed Airflow or similar tools.
  • Data Quality Assurance: Implement monitoring tools like DataDog, CloudWatch, Monte Carlo, and the ELK stack to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
  • Assist in developing and managing Elasticsearch clusters for data indexing and search capabilities.
  • Work closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored data solutions.
  • Contribute to the design of advanced data tools and visualizations to help clients understand and optimize their battery technologies.
  • Collaborate with data scientists to integrate machine learning models and predictive analytics into our data ecosystem, providing actionable insights into battery performance and longevity.

Our tech stack

  • Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearch
  • Modern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layer 
  • React TypeScript front-end
  • Hosted in AWS with Kubernetes
Technology

Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearchModern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layerReact TypeScript Front-endHosted in AWS with Kubernetes

Interview Process
  • 15 minute intro call with our founder
  • Take-home challenge: we've distilled our platform to ~1k loc. The challenge is to tell us what the mini platform does and implement a new feature.
  • 30 minute live coding challenge 
  • Meet our team in SF:
    • Present a 5 minute presentation on a recent engineering challenge you found interesting to solve
    • Whiteboarding session with our engineering team
    • Chat with our leadership team to get to know each other in depth.
  • Reference check

We run a 1 month fully paid trial with every new member of our team so we can mutually assess whether we are a long term fit for each other.

The role

  • Develop and ship ambitious product features, collaborating with back-end developers to integrate front-end components with server-side logic.
  • Develop and maintain responsive and high-performance user interfaces using React and TypeScript.
  • Collaborate with back-end developers to integrate front-end components with server-side logic.
  • Implement and optimize GraphQL queries and mutations.

Our tech stack

  • Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearch
  • Modern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layer 
  • React TypeScript front-end
  • Hosted in AWS with Kubernetes
