Skills: Design systems, CSS, Git, GraphQL, Node.js, React, TypeScript

About Byterat

Byterat is the modern data platform for battery science. We give battery teams at companies like Panasonic or Tesla the core data platform they need to innovate, securely at scale.

We‚Äôre a well-funded, VC-backed start-up with customers and recurring revenue. We‚Äôre backed by world-class investors like Y Combinator, Giant Ventures and Collaborative Fund, and angels such as founders of Zendesk and Voi, and executives from Google, Meta and Figma. 

We‚Äôre growing rapidly, which presents career-defining opportunities for ambitious engineers to accelerate their growth and contribute to a quickly evolving startup in SF. You‚Äôll be joining our in-person team of engineers and physicists with backgrounds from Rivian, Carnegie Mellon, Georgia Tech, Shopify, U. Cambridge and other YC start-ups.

Our mission

  • Batteries play a key role in tackling climate change. $73B was invested in US battery plants in 2022, and battery company revenue is expected to grow >5x over the next decade.
  • Global carmakers alone are forecast to spend $515B on electric vehicle and battery R&D by 2030. But battery engineers are woefully underserved by software, relying on broken legacy products to analyze their data. Most data is never analyzed or used meaningfully.
  • Byterat is the first platform to provide battery teams with the infrastructure they need to unlock business value from their battery data. Byterat is live in battery labs across three continents today, allowing teams to analyze data from thousands of parallel experiments and unlock previously hidden insights connecting battery design to performance.

We might be a fit for you if‚Ä¶

  • You‚Äôre ambitious and you want to move fast. You want to accelerate your trajectory and have an outsized impact on a rapidly growing VC-backed startup in SF.
  • You‚Äôre hard-working. You‚Äôre a team player. You can communicate effectively and respectfully. You pay attention to details. You like to solve the most important problems and you‚Äôre good at doing that. You adapt quickly.
  • You want to join a strong, supportive, high-performance team, and work in-person in SF. You set an exceptionally high performance bar for yourself and everyone on the team. You are not afraid to communicate what is working and what needs to improve.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of professional experience in front-end development with a strong portfolio showcasing complex web applications.
  • Proficient in TypeScript, JavaScript frameworks (React.js, Redux, GraphQL), and related technologies.
  • Deep understanding of the presentation layer, including CSS pre-processors (Sass, LESS), CSS-in-JS (Styled Components, Emotion), and design systems.
  • Ability to work closely with designers and apply principles of responsive design, accessibility (WCAG standards), and user-centered design.
  • Experienced in front-end performance optimization techniques, such as lazy loading, code splitting, and minimizing render times.
  • Strong experience with front-end testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library) and debugging tools (Chrome DevTools).
  • Proficient in using Git and Git workflows, with experience in REST and GraphQL APIs and asynchronous code.
  • Skilled in systematic troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis.

Preferred qualifications

  • CI/CD & Deployment: Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes.
  • Experience with Event/Data Streams
  • Familiarity with Amazon Web Services, Docker, and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with authentication and identity management.
  • Bonus: Exposure to manufacturing processes.
  • BONUS: You have experience building front-end components for data visualization, analytics and modeling web applications.

The role

  • Lead the development of next-generation features from prototype to end-of-life, creating reactive user interfaces tailored for multiple personas.
  • Design and optimize highly reliable, scalable, and distributed micro-services.
  • Utilize automation to streamline processes and meet project milestones efficiently.
  • Build and refine design mocks and wireframes, ensuring user-friendly and visually appealing interfaces.
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and optimize applications for performance and scalability.
  • Implement best practices for front-end development, including code reviews, testing, and performance optimization.

Our tech stack

  • Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearch
  • Modern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layer 
  • React TypeScript front-end
  • Hosted in AWS with Kubernetes
Technology

Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearchModern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layerReact TypeScript Front-endHosted in AWS with Kubernetes

Interview Process
  • 15 minute intro call with our founder
  • Take-home challenge: we've distilled our platform to ~1k loc. The challenge is to tell us what the mini platform does and implement a new feature.
  • 30 minute live coding challenge 
  • Meet our team in SF:
    • Present a 5 minute presentation on a recent engineering challenge you found interesting to solve
    • Whiteboarding session with our engineering team
    • Chat with our leadership team to get to know each other in depth
  • Reference check

We run a 1 month fully paid trial with every new member of our team so we can mutually assess whether we are a long term fit for each other.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps)
job.company_description: Modern data platform for battery science
job.description:
About Byterat

Byterat is a modern data platform for battery science. We provide battery teams at companies like Panasonic or Tesla with the core data platform they need to innovate, securely at scale. Byterat runs in the background of a battery lab, and enables scientists to analyze thousands of parallel experiments at once to connect the dots between battery design and performance.

About the role
Skills: Git, Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

About Byterat

Byterat is the modern data platform for battery science. We give battery teams at companies like Panasonic or Tesla the core data platform they need to innovate, securely at scale.

We‚Äôre a well-funded, VC-backed start-up with customers and recurring revenue. We‚Äôre backed by world-class investors like Y Combinator, Giant Ventures and Collaborative Fund, and angels such as founders of Zendesk and Voi, and executives from Google, Meta and Figma. 

We‚Äôre growing rapidly, which presents career-defining opportunities for ambitious engineers to accelerate their growth and contribute to a quickly evolving startup in SF. You‚Äôll be joining our in-person team of engineers and physicists with backgrounds from Rivian, Carnegie Mellon, Georgia Tech, Shopify, U. Cambridge and other YC start-ups.

Our Mission

  • Batteries play a key role in tackling climate change. $73B was invested in US battery plants in 2022, and battery company revenue is expected to grow >5x over the next decade.
  • Global carmakers alone are forecast to spend $515B on electric vehicle and battery R&D by 2030. But battery engineers are woefully underserved by software, relying on broken legacy products to analyze their data. Most data is never analyzed or used meaningfully.
  • Byterat is the first platform to provide battery teams with the infrastructure they need to unlock business value from their battery data. Byterat is live in battery labs across three continents today, allowing teams to analyze data from thousands of parallel experiments and unlock previously hidden insights connecting battery design to performance.

We might be a fit for you if‚Ä¶

  • You‚Äôre ambitious and you want to move fast. You want to accelerate your trajectory and have an outsized impact on a rapidly growing VC-backed startup.
  • You‚Äôre hard-working. You‚Äôre a team player. You can communicate effectively and respectfully. You pay attention to details. You like to solve the most important problems and you‚Äôre good at doing that. You adapt quickly.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you‚Äôre given a lot of autonomy.
  • You want to join a strong, supportive, high-performance team. You set an exceptionally high performance bar for yourself and everyone on the team.
  • You are not afraid to communicate what is working and what needs to improve.

Qualifications

  • Education: BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: 4+ years in a DevOps role, with a strong background in build tools like GNU Make, CMake, Soong, Ninja, Gradle, and Bazel.
  • Technical Skills: Proficient in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), CI/CD tools (GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, CircleCI), and infrastructure as code (Helm, Terraform, CloudFormation).
  • Containerization & Orchestration: Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Monitoring & Scripting: Expertise in monitoring tools (Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, ELK Stack) and strong scripting skills in Bash or Python.

The role

  • Manage our AWS and Elasticsearch cloud infrastructure through code and automated systems, including Kubernetes.
  • Build, test and ship software to manage, operate and improve our high-throughput web application and data pipelines and associated cloud infrastructure.
  • Build the operational framework for the monitoring, deployment, and maintenance of our web services and data pipelines.
  • Architect, build, test, and ship highly-available and secure services that process and serve data at scale. 
  • Work closely with our product team to create the best system architecture for delivering key features that drive value for customers.

Our tech stack

  • Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearch
  • Modern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layer 
  • React TypeScript front-end
  • Hosted in AWS with Kubernetes
Technology

Postgres database with data indexing using ElasticSearchModern python based ETL with a node.js / next.js GraphQL layerReact TypeScript Front-endHosted in AWS with Kubernetes

Interview Process
  • 15 minute intro call with our founder
  • Take-home challenge: we've distilled our platform to ~1k loc. The challenge is to tell us what the mini platform does and implement a new feature.
  • 30 minute live coding challenge 
  • Meet our team:
    • Present a 5 minute presentation on a recent engineering challenge you found interesting to solve
    • Whiteboarding session
    • Chat with our leadership team to get to know each other in depth.
  • Reference check

We run a 1 month fully paid trial with every new member of our team so we can mutually assess whether we are a long term fit for each other.

job.title: Software Engineer, Implementations (Remote)
job.company_description: Software for banks to open bank accounts
job.description:
About Prelim

At Prelim, we are on a mission to revolutionize the way financial institutions onboard new customers. We believe that the customer onboarding process should be fast, efficient, and user-friendly. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a real impact on the financial industry.

Our no-code platform allows banks and financial institutions to digitalize their services, streamline account opening processes, and improve customer experience. By joining our team, you will be a part of a fast-paced, innovative, and dynamic work environment where you can learn and grow your skills.

Our team is made up of a diverse group of individuals with a wide range of experience and expertise. We value collaboration, creativity, and a passion for problem-solving. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with experts in the field, and be challenged to think outside the box.

In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, flexible working hours, and a great work-life balance. We are constantly evolving and growing, and we are looking for talented individuals who share our vision and are excited to be a part of our journey. If you're passionate about fintech and want to be a part of a team that is making a real impact in the industry, then Prelim is the place for you.

About the role

Implement and deploy the product that powers better access to banking

The Prelim team is seeking a Software Engineer, Implementations join our (small, but growing!) team. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to help increase access to banking for millions of people. If you're passionate about engineering and eager to be part of a fast-paced remote startup culture, we encourage you to apply to join our team today!

As a Software Engineer on the Implementations team at Prelim, you will be responsible for implementing, deploying and supporting the platform that powers digital account opening for banks across the world. You will work closely with Prelim's customers and customer success, helping big and small banks deploy our product by configuring our platform, debugging integration issues and shipping small fixes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Own the onboarding of customers and ensuring their success using Prelim
  • Be a thought partner to Prelim customers to help them build out complex forms for new teams and use cases 
  • Tackle technical limitations or opportunities in Prelim that need solving via code (e.g. a bug, a missing feature, etc.) or partner with our product engineering teams to tackle the problem  
  • Be the voice of our customers and represent their needs to the rest of the organization
  • Present the results of our work to a wide ranging audience from engineers to C-suite executives
  • Demo Prelim and answer questions about how to make the best use of the product 
  • Create technical content to demonstrate best practices
  • Suss out the blockers for a customer in adopting Prelim ‚Äî and overcome them through content, education, product improvements, and training 
  • Serve as the primary, ongoing technical point of contact for our users
  • Help interview and grow the implementation engineering team

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Strong experience with REST & SOAP integrations
  • Experience with back-end technologies such as Node.js, Python, or Ruby
  • Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

About Prelim:

Prelim is a cutting-edge software provider that specializes in customer onboarding for banks. Our platform is designed to streamline the account opening process for both consumers and businesses, increasing speed-to-market and improving the customer experience.

We pride ourselves on being a forward-thinking and innovative company, always on the lookout for new ways to improve our offerings and stay ahead of the curve in the banking industry. Our small team is made up of passionate and dedicated individuals who are committed to delivering exceptional results for our clients.

As a member of the Prelim team, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and be at the forefront of the digital account opening industry. You will have the chance to work with a diverse range of clients, including some of the biggest names in the banking industry, and have an outsized impact.

We offer a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, with ample opportunities for growth and advancement. If you're excited to be part of a team that is shaping the future of the banking industry, then we encourage you to apply to join us at Prelim. We are looking for individuals who are driven, ambitious, and excited about the opportunity to make a real impact in the digital account opening industry.

#LI-Remote

Technology

We primarily use React, Node.js, and Postgres.

job.title: Growth
job.company_description: Faire for specialty food stores
job.description:
About Airgoods

Airgoods is a fast-growing wholesale marketplace for the specialty food and beverage industry. We help specialty stores (like Tiny Grocer, Eastern District, Soberish, and Union Market) centralize their wholesale supply chain by making it easy for them to order all of their inventory in one place. Today, we focus on connecting these stores with over 3,000 specialty beverage products.

Our mission is to radically improve wholesale for all stakeholders in the specialty food world.We started in January 2023, and have raised $3M+ from top investors like YC (S23).

About the role

üü£ About Airgoods

Airgoods is a fast growing wholesale marketplace for the specialty food and beverage industry. We help specialty stores centralize their wholesale buying to make it easy for them to order all of their inventory in one place. Our users are businesses like Tiny Grocer in Austin, The Epicurean Trader in SF, Eastern District in NYC, Soberish in Atlanta and Dray Drinks in Boston.

Our mission is to make wholesale radically better for all stakeholders in the specialty grocery industry.

We started in January 2023, and have raised $3.4M from top investors like Y Combinator (S23) and Initialized Capital. We currently process ~$1M in transactions per month.

üëã Who you‚Äôll work with

Elian (co-founder and COO): Elian studied Economics at Yale, played on the soccer team alongside Paolo and captained the team for two years. He also worked with Aaron at an emerging VC fund for 1.5 years during his time at Yale. Grew up in Asia and Europe before moving to Milwaukee before college.

Aaron (co-founder and CEO): Aaron studied Economics at Yale, where he met Elian and Paolo. After Yale, he worked at an emerging VC fund in New York with Elian; that fund would later write the first check into Airgoods. He grew up helping his dad run the wholesale side of a brick & mortar store in Portland, Maine.

Paolo (co-founder and CTO): Paolo studied Computer Science and Economics at Yale. Previously worked as a software engineer at his brother‚Äôs startup Momence (YC S20). Grew up in Brazil before coming to the US for college. Played soccer at Yale and loves sports.

You‚Äôll also be working alongside our two fantastic engineers, Emilio and Sergio!

üèóÔ∏è About the role

We are looking for an entrepreneurial and ambitious individual to join Airgoods as our first growth hire. We are on a high-growth trajectory and looking for someone who wants to be a key player on the journey to building a billion-dollar company.

This position will involve:

  • Being a ‚ÄòGeneralist Athlete‚Äô ‚Äì your role will evolve over time and require doing whatever it takes to make sure we are growing quickly.
  • Talking with users ‚Äì over the phone, in-person, and on Zoom ‚Äì every day to deeply understand their business and pain points.
  • Developing our playbook for repeatable growth as we scale across categories and markets.
  • Establishing the operational excellence required for Airgoods to accelerate into our next stage of growth.
  • Living in NYC. We have an office in Manhattan by Madison Square Park and work in-person 5 days a week.

Our ideal candidate has the ambition and work ethic to grow with the company and develop a world class B2B growth engine.

üöÄ Who you are

We are a young company of highly driven and passionate individuals building a billion-dollar business. To thrive in this environment, you‚Äôll have the following characteristics:

  • You are driven with a strong work ethic - our team is committed to going the extra mile, even if it means working long nights and weekends to achieve our goals. We are in the office 9-9 during the week and work on weekends.
  • You prioritize speed and have a bias for action.
  • You strive for excellence in every aspect of your work - you take ownership of your outcomes and overdeliver on your goals.
  • You‚Äôre humble and eager to learn whatever it takes to help our team and our customers succeed.
  • You play for the front of the jersey.

üõ†Ô∏è What you‚Äôll need

Must-haves

  • An eagerness to roll up your sleeves and get into the details of growth.
  • The ambition to become an expert in our industry and the hunger to learn as fast as possible.
  • Exceptional communication skills and an ability to thrive in fast-paced environments under pressure.
  • High EQ and a resilient mentality that allows you to quickly overcome challenges and setbacks.
  • Excellent organization, time management, and prioritization skills.
  • Living in NYC and excited about working with a fully in-person team.

Bonus points

  • Experience at a high growth start-up or with marketplaces.
  • Experience working with product/engineering teams.
  • Familiar with SQL and/or other data analytics tools.
  • Experience building growth & distribution channels for projects / apps from scratch.

üéÅ What we offer

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance.
  • Expensed dinners and tier 1 office snacks (all from brands that sell with Airgoods).
  • Dedicated founders who are committed to building an amazing team and supporting you.
Technology

Must-haves

  • Expertise in full-stack web development and system design.
  • Proficient in Typescript to power our frontend React app, NodeJS, and Express backend.
  • Expertise in relational databases; preferably PostgreSQL.
  • Attention to detail and passion for building beautiful software.
  • Previous experience shipping production-level code using our tech stack or similar technologies.

Bonus points

  • Experience in a start-up or building 0 to 1 products and bringing them to market.
  • Experience with advanced front-end technologies such as Redux for state management, or modern CSS frameworks like Tailwind CSS.
  • Experience in mobile app development, either through native development (iOS/Android) or cross-platform frameworks like React Native.
  • Expertise in NextJS or other server-side JS frameworks.

job.title: Frontend Engineer
job.company_description: AI-native operating system for analytics teams
job.description:
About Turntable

What we do

Turntable (YC W23) enables less technical analysts to build their own data pipelines. Companies use our AI-native workspace to scale their analytics stack without hiring more engineers.

The founding team has experience building data and ML products at Stripe, Pinterest, Twitter, and Cruise. Justin led the commercial data science team at Cruise, Ian built ML and data tools at Pinterest and Stripe, and Wally led product for Twitter‚Äôs largest ML team, the Home Timeline.

At all of these companies, we encountered the same problem: data pipelines are too hard to build and maintain. Often business stakeholders who know SQL can unblock themselves if only the tooling was better.

Our vision

The jobs of the last million data professionals will look different than the next million. Data is more vital to an organization than ever before but the majority of data tools are still too complex and hard to use.

We combine modern data warehousing technology, large language models and a delightful user experience to craft a category defining product.

We believe that if we are successful in our mission, we will change how organizations use data to develop products, run daily operations and plan for the future.

About the role
Skills: Python, React, TypeScript, Data Warehousing, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • üìç New York, NY or Remote
  • üìä Generous equity
  • ü§ù 4 person team
  • ‚è±Ô∏è Full-time
  • üí∞ $150K-$225K
  • ü©∫ Benefits (health, dental, vision, new equipment, etc)

üíΩ What we do

We‚Äôre on a mission to build the future of analytics infrastructure. Data teams use Turntable to build and maintain data pipelines that power every aspect of their organization from the finance department to operations.

The founding team has experience running data teams and building products at companies like Stripe, Pinterest, Twitter, Cruise, Reddit and Coinbase.

We‚Äôve raised $3M from world-class investors.

üîÆ Our vision

The jobs of the last million data professionals will look different than the next million. Data is more vital to an organization than ever before but the majority of data tools are still too complex and hard to use.

We combine modern data warehousing technology, AI and a delightful user experience to craft what we believe will be a category-defining product.

If we are successful in our mission, we will change how organizations use data to develop products, run daily operations and plan for the future.

üë©‚Äçüíª About the role

We are looking for a stellar full-stack engineer to join our engineering team. You‚Äôll work directly with the co-founders and our early customers to help data teams around the world be more effective at working with their data.

This is a role that is strongly focused on product and you will often be designing new features from scratch that are brand new to the industry. Customer-facing product development experience is a big plus.

We offer competitive salary and equity as well as a slate of other benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • New equipment (new Macbooks, monitor, etc)
  • Quarterly offsites

üèóÔ∏è Interesting Problems We are Solving

There is no shortage of interesting technical problems to solve in our space. We have years of work ahead of us and your time spent working with us will be on high-impact, customer-facing products.

Here‚Äôs a preview of some of the types of projects you can expect to work on:

  • Developing AI models that can generate SQL, write documentation and understand an organization‚Äôs data models in their warehouse
  • Hacking up SQL compilers, network libraries and abstract syntax tree parsers to generate a column-level data lineage view of an entire data warehouse
  • Building large canvas, Figma-like frontend experiences
  • Architecting large scale workflow systems
  • Designing realtime, multiplayer infrastructure

üõ†Ô∏è Our Engineering Culture

At Turntable, we take inspiration from how some of the best engineering teams in the industry operate. We don‚Äôt shy away from adding in our own remixes as well.

Some examples of how we work

  • We dogfood our own product every day. We build data pipelines for our business in Turntable and we often hop into our product to help customers be successful.
  • We prioritize speed and rapid iteration. We believe that done is better than perfect and that most of the learning of a feature happens after launch.
  • We are low ego and high empathy. We believe good software is not enough to build a category-defining product - we also need a highly functional team.
  • We all wear the customer hat. Engineers at Turntable will often interact with customers and the customer are at the center of what we build.
  • We celebrate wins, ships, and learnings. We host Friday happy hours to demo what was built during the week and to share what we learned.
  • Slope > intercept. We believe a good engineering culture should be focused on providing interesting opportunities to engineers to grow and level up their careers.

üíª Our Tech stack

Our tech stack is always evolving. We don‚Äôt expect candidates be an expert at every part of our stack. Here are the highlights:

Artificial Intelligence

  • Pytorch
  • The OpenAI platform
  • PGvector
  • Local model development (ex: llama2)
  • New LLM patterns (ex: fine-tuning, retrieval augmented operation (RAGs)

Backend

  • Python
  • dbt-core
  • Fastapi
  • Docker
  • Postgres
  • AWS

Frontend

  • React
  • Typescript
  • Tailwindcss
  • Vercel
Technology

Interesting Problems We are Solving

There is no shortage of interesting technical and product problems to solve at Turntable. We have years of development work ahead of us and your time spent working with us will be on high-impact, customer-facing product features.

  • Developing AI models that can generate SQL, write documentation and understand an organization‚Äôs data models in their warehouse
  • Hacking up SQL compilers, network libraries and abstract syntax tree parsers to generate a column-level data lineage view of an entire warehouse
  • Building large canvas, Figma-like frontend experiences
  • Designing realtime, multiplayer infrastructure

Our Tech stack

Our tech stack is always evolving. We don‚Äôt expect candidates be an expert at every part of our stack. Here are the highlights:

Artificial Intelligence

  • Pytorch
  • The OpenAI platform (fine tuning, gpt4, gpt3.5, embeddings)
  • PGvector

Backend

  • Python
  • Fastapi
  • Docker
  • Postgres
  • AWS

Frontend

  • React
  • Typescript
  • Tailwindcss
  • Vercel

job.title: Backend Engineer
job.company_description: AI-native operating system for analytics teams
job.description:
About Turntable

What we do

Turntable (YC W23) enables less technical analysts to build their own data pipelines. Companies use our AI-native workspace to scale their analytics stack without hiring more engineers.

The founding team has experience building data and ML products at Stripe, Pinterest, Twitter, and Cruise. Justin led the commercial data science team at Cruise, Ian built ML and data tools at Pinterest and Stripe, and Wally led product for Twitter‚Äôs largest ML team, the Home Timeline.

At all of these companies, we encountered the same problem: data pipelines are too hard to build and maintain. Often business stakeholders who know SQL can unblock themselves if only the tooling was better.

Our vision

The jobs of the last million data professionals will look different than the next million. Data is more vital to an organization than ever before but the majority of data tools are still too complex and hard to use.

We combine modern data warehousing technology, large language models and a delightful user experience to craft a category defining product.

We believe that if we are successful in our mission, we will change how organizations use data to develop products, run daily operations and plan for the future.

About the role
Skills: Python, React, TypeScript, Data Warehousing, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • üìç New York, NY or Remote
  • üìä Generous equity
  • ü§ù 4 person team
  • ‚è±Ô∏è Full-time
  • üí∞ $150K-$225K
  • ü©∫ Benefits (health, dental, vision, new equipment, etc)

üíΩ What we do

We‚Äôre on a mission to build the future of analytics infrastructure. Data teams use Turntable to build and maintain data pipelines that power every aspect of their organization from the finance department to operations.

The founding team has experience running data teams and building products at companies like Stripe, Pinterest, Twitter, Cruise, Reddit and Coinbase.

We‚Äôve raised $3.2M from world-class investors.

üîÆ Our vision

The jobs of the last million data professionals will look different than the next million. Data is more vital to an organization than ever before but the majority of data tools are still too complex and hard to use.

We combine modern data warehousing technology, AI and a delightful user experience to craft what we believe will be a category-defining product.

If we are successful in our mission, we will change how organizations use data to develop products, run daily operations and plan for the future.

üë©‚Äçüíª About the role

We are looking for a stellar full-stack engineer to join our engineering team. You‚Äôll work directly with the co-founders and our early customers to help data teams around the world be more effective at working with their data.

This is a role that is strongly focused on product and you will often be designing new features from scratch that are brand new to the industry. Customer-facing product development experience is a big plus.

We offer competitive salary and equity as well as a slate of other benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • New equipment (new Macbooks, monitor, etc)
  • Quarterly offsites

üèóÔ∏è Interesting Problems We are Solving

There is no shortage of interesting technical problems to solve in our space. We have years of work ahead of us and your time spent working with us will be on high-impact, customer-facing products.

Here‚Äôs a preview of some of the types of projects you can expect to work on:

  • Developing AI models that can generate SQL, write documentation and understand an organization‚Äôs data models in their warehouse
  • Hacking up SQL compilers, network libraries and abstract syntax tree parsers to generate a column-level data lineage view of an entire data warehouse
  • Building large canvas, Figma-like frontend experiences
  • Architecting large scale workflow systems
  • Designing realtime, multiplayer infrastructure

üõ†Ô∏è Our Engineering Culture

At Turntable, we take inspiration from how some of the best engineering teams in the industry operate. We don‚Äôt shy away from adding in our own remixes as well.

Some examples of how we work

  • We dogfood our own product every day. We build data pipelines for our business in Turntable and we often hop into our product to help customers be successful.
  • We prioritize speed and rapid iteration. We believe that done is better than perfect and that most of the learning of a feature happens after launch.
  • We are low ego and high empathy. We believe good software is not enough to build a category-defining product - we also need a highly functional team.
  • We all wear the customer hat. Engineers at Turntable will often interact with customers and the customer are at the center of what we build.
  • We celebrate wins, ships, and learnings. We host Friday happy hours to demo what was built during the week and to share what we learned.
  • Slope > intercept. We believe a good engineering culture should be focused on providing interesting opportunities to engineers to grow and level up their careers.

üíª Our Tech stack

Our tech stack is always evolving. We don‚Äôt expect candidates be an expert at every part of our stack. Here are the highlights:

Artificial Intelligence

  • Pytorch
  • The OpenAI platform
  • PGvector
  • Local model development (ex: llama2)
  • New LLM patterns (ex: fine-tuning, retrieval augmented operation (RAGs)

Backend

  • Python
  • dbt-core
  • Fastapi
  • Docker
  • Postgres
  • AWS

Frontend

  • Typescript
  • Tailwindcss
  • Vercel

There is no shortage of interesting technical and product problems to solve at Turntable. We have years of development work ahead of us and your time spent working with us will be on high-impact, customer-facing product features.

  • Developing AI models that can generate SQL, write documentation and understand an organization‚Äôs data models in their warehouse

job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.company_description: AI Employees Called Artisans, Starting With An AI BDR
job.description:
About Artisan

At Artisan, we're on a mission to create the most advanced human-like digital workers, called Artisans, and the software operating system for startups across verticals. We're starting with sales through our Artisan Sales platform and Ava, The Sales Rep Artisan.

Our first Artisan, Ava, is a BDR who automates the entire outbound sales process and can be set up with a 10-minute conversation. Ava creates the user's ICP, prospects with her database of over 270M contacts, does lead research, crafts & sends highly bespoke email sequences, and books meetings into sales reps' calendars.

We recently launched Artisan Labs, our research lab where we're pioneering the foundational technologies required to create human-like digital workers.

This is the next Industrial Revolution.

About the role
Skills: Python, Machine Learning, Reinforcement learning (RL), Natural Language Processing

At Artisan, we're creating AI Employees, called Artisans, and software which is beautiful, easy to use, and replaces the endless stack of point solutions. We're starting with outbound sales and our AI BDR, Ava. Our platform contains every tool needed for outbound sales - B2B data, AI email sequences, deliverability optimization tools and so much more.

We're growing very rapidly and are building our sales org from the ground up. We recently raised a $11M seed round from top investors, and are looking for talented engineers to join us on our rocketship growth as we relentlessly work towards building a multi-billion dollar company ü¶Ñ

Key Responsibilities:

  • Fine-tuning and prompt engineering LLMs for our Artisans, helping us to create the most advanced AI Employees (primarily Google's Gemini, OpenAI's GPT 3.5, GPT 4 & GPT-4o, and Anthropic's Claude).
  • Developing systems to allow users to interact with platform features through chat (e.g. our onboarding flow and platform setup is currently done by Ava, our AI BDR).
  • Architect LLM systems which integrate with third-party tools for a plethora of Artisan use cases (think email conversations, the user chat interface, etc.)
  • Minimize hallucinations and strange tone of voice.
  • Reduce latency of our LLM systems.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest LLM technologies so we stay on the bleeding edge of what's possible.

Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Industry experience with LLM fine tuning and prompt engineering.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Extensive experience in Python and MLOps tools like MLFlow and cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
  • Expertise in Python back-end development.

Benefits:

  • Generous equity.
  • Great health + vision + dental.

We're growing very rapidly and are building our sales org from the ground up. We recently raised an $11M seed round from top investors, and are looking for superstar employees to join us on our rocketship growth as we relentlessly work towards building a multi-billion dollar company ü¶Ñ

Job Description

We‚Äôre seeking a hacky, ambitious and results-oriented Growth Marketer to join our team. Your role will span the entire marketing mix, testing as many potentially scalable channels as possible and taking a data-driven attitude to figure out what works. We have a highly ambitious growth plan and are targeting $5-10M ARR by the end of the year. You will play a pivotal role in getting us there.

Key Responsibilities

  • Optimize our entire growth funnel: brand > awareness > acquisition > trust > revenue expansion > virality.
  • Managing our outbound demand generation efforts with Ava.
  • Creating and executing an email marketing strategy that nurtures and engages our audience of over 10k leads.
  • Help manage our full website and content strategy.
  • Manage our events strategy.
  • Set up and manage paid ads campaigns across Google, LinkedIn, Meta, X and Reddit.
  • Manage our G2 profile.

Requirements

  • Proven experience in hacky growth marketing results.
  • Excellent written English - you need to be able to write content that hooks the reader.
  • Willingness to work hard and do what needs to be done to achieve our goals!
  • Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
  • Strong proficiency in the full marketing mix.
  • A figure-it-outer attitude. You can do anything.
  • Comfortable filming long-form and short-form videos for YouTube and other social platforms.
  • Comfortable running webinars.

Benefits

  • Full coverage health + medical + dental.
  • Generous equity.
  • Join a rocketship at the launchpad.

Job Description:

Artisan is seeking a dynamic and creative Social Media Manager to lead the strategy and execution of content across all company social media channels as well as the founders' personal social media channels. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating viral content and a deep understanding of various social media platforms, including YouTube, X, LinkedIn, TikTok, and Instagram Reels.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy focused on virality and engagement.
  • Create and manage content for all company social media channels and founders' personal social media accounts. Content will be multi-modal, including text, video, graphics & more.
  • Plan, write, and produce high-quality, engaging, and viral content, ensuring every piece has a clear hook designed to capture attention.
  • Utilize various tactics, such as shock and other hooks, to capture and retain audience attention, always aiming for maximum virality.
  • Monitor, analyze, and report on social media performance metrics, using insights to refine strategies and tactics.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends, tools, and best practices.
  • Collaborate with other team members to ensure brand consistency and alignment with company goals.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role, with a portfolio demonstrating viral content creation.
  • Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills.
  • Proficiency in social media platforms, including YouTube, LinkedIn, TikTok, Instagram Reels, and Shorts.
  • Strong understanding of social media metrics and the ability to analyze and interpret data.
  • Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative content ideas.
  • Comfortable being featured in video content.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Benefits:

  • Equity in the company.
  • Full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance.
  • Opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing, innovative company shaping the future of work and software.

job.title: Chief of Staff
job.company_description: Advanced FP&A and consolidation for QuickBooks Online
job.description:
About LiveFlow

We're building LiveFlow to help millions of people build better businesses by helping them manage their finances easily.

Every company has to manage its P&L and its cash. Still, too many companies drown because of manual financial work, the absence of understanding of how their numbers work, and too many other day-to-day priorities.

We want to fix that.

We are backed by world-class investors like YC, Seedcamp, WndrCo, Moonfire, Bradley Horowitz (VP Product, Google), Tomer London (Co-Founder, Gusto), and more.

About the role

Join our mission to enable _ anyone _ to manage and understand their business financials with ease üåç

... and work with hungry, smart, and friendly people from our New York office right by Madison Square Park üëáüëá

About LiveFlow

We started LiveFlow in 2021 and today we help thousands of businesses to automate financial reporting. We‚Äôre a team of 34 people, mostly based in New York, London, and Sao Paulo.

We are backed by world-class investors like YC, YC Continuity, Seedcamp, WndrCo, Moonfire, Bradley Horowitz (VP Product, Google), Tomer London (Co-Founder, Gusto), and more.

About The Role

As Chief of Staff to Lasse, our CEO , you‚Äôll work directly with him to solve critical problems within the business. This role is ideal if you aspire to become a Founder, CEO, COO, or general executive one day.

Important: Do not apply if the only thing that excites you about this role is the title. The Chief of Staff title has been overused and can often sound too fancy relative to what the job actually entails.

That said, you will work on some of the most interesting challenges within the business, and your learning curve will grow exponentially.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the CEO: Any project or problem on Lasse‚Äôs plate is automatically on your plate. This means you‚Äôll solve some of the highest-impact problems for the business.

  • Run a function: If a business area needs attention (e.g., customer success, product, or recruitment), you‚Äôll step in and tackle it.

  • Drive accountability and oversee projects: You‚Äôll lead internal meetings, oversee projects, and hold people accountable to their goals, ensuring we achieve the highest level of quality.

  • Assist with fundraising: You‚Äôll help develop fundraising materials, manage investor databases, and refine our pitch.

Requirements

  • At least 4 years of work experience, preferably in a high-accountability/high-work-ethic environment.

  • Extremely organized.

  • Ability to learn new business areas quickly ; for instance, if you need to lead a department, you should be able to quickly learn its ins and outs.

  • Very analytical and able to break down complex problems into manageable chunks.

  • Capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously and executing them successfully.

  • Strong business acumen with an understanding of the drivers of a business.

  • Excellent financial modeling skills (Excel/Google Sheets).

Major plus if you come from Investment Banking, Consulting, Private Equity, or any similar work environment.

Apply today!

Technology

Backend: an Elixir/Phoenix application, deployed on AWS via Terraform

Frontend: a React application using NextJS, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS, hosted on Vercel

As our first dedicated RevOps hire, you‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to create and scale an advanced RevOps program from the ground up. You'll be the architect of a powerful revenue machine that will propel LiveFlow to new heights.

You will work hand-in-hand with Dan Park, our Head of Sales, and play a pivotal role in crafting and executing a best-in-class RevOps strategy.

You will love this role if you thrive on end-to-end ownership, enjoy having lots of autonomy, and get excited about building RevOps from the ground up.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, report, and automate key performance metrics.

  • Lead operational and strategic initiatives, translating data into actionable recommendations.

  • Conduct in-depth analysis to optimize sales productivity, customer segmentation, and unit economics.

  • Build and scale data models to support go-to-market planning and execution.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally to identify growth opportunities and develop business cases.

Ideal candidates will be:

  • Growth-oriented with a strong analytical mindset.

  • Experienced in CRM management and data analysis.

  • Proven ability to structure complex problems and deliver actionable insights.

  • Effective communicators capable of influencing stakeholders at all levels.

üß≥ WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

  • Proven experience: Minimum 3 years in high-growth tech or fintech environments, ideally scaling startups from $5M to $50M ARR.

  • Analytical expertise: Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and attention to detail. Deep understanding of the entire sales funnel.

  • Data-driven decision-making: Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and influence key stakeholders.

  • Salesforce mastery: Advanced Salesforce reporting and utilization.

  • Modeling proficiency: Expert-level Excel skills and experience building complex models.

  • Business acumen: Fluency in analyzing key metrics (e.g., unit economics, churn, LTV, customer satisfaction) to drive growth and optimization.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive base salary

  • Substantial equity package

  • Health and dental insurance

  • 401(k)

  • All the latest tech you need; MacBooks, monitors, etc.

  • Monthly budget to spend on books and conferences to keep learning

  • 28 days paid vacation + 9 US holidays

  2. Take home exercise

  3. Skills interview

  4. Career History Interview

  5. Final interview

Sounds like something for you? Then, we would love to hear from you.

Work from our sunny office in Madison Square Park in New York!

job.title: Customer Success Engineer
job.company_description: Open-source secrets manager for developers
job.description:
About Infisical

Infisical is the #1 open source secret management platform ‚Äì used by tens of thousands of developers.

We raised $3M from Y Combinator, Gradient Ventures (Google's VC fund), and awesome angel investors like Elad Gil, Arash Ferdowsi (founder/ex-CTO of Dropbox), Paul Copplestone (founder/CEO of Supabase), James Hawkins (founder/CEO of PostHog), Andrew Miklas (founder/ex-CTO of PagerDuty), Diana Hu (GP at Y Combinator), and more.

We are default alive, and have signed many customers ranging from fastest growing startups to post-IPO enterprises.

About the role

About Infisical

Infisical is the #1 open source secret management platform for developers. In other words, we help organizations manage API-keys, DB access tokens, certificates, and other credentials across all parts of their infra! In fact, we process over 100M of such secrets per day.

Our customers range from some of the largest public enterprises to fastest-growing startups (e.g., companies like Hugging Face, Delivery Hero). Developers love us and our community is growing every day! Join us on a mission to make security easier for all developers ‚Äì starting from secret management.

About this role

Infisical is looking for a customer success engineer to help grow Infisical‚Äôs customer base and ensure great product/onboarding experience. You will be working closely with our CEO and the rest of the engineering team on:

  • ensuring new customers are activated, happy, and have all of their questions answered;
  • expanding Infisical to new use cases within accounts (e.g., more integrations, feature announcements, cross-sell);
  • running proof-of-concept with leads, guiding customer through onboarding, or being able to recommend best practices for specific architectures and use cases;
  • becoming a trusted technical advisor to customer and business leaders;
  • talking to customers daily to find points of friction and potential improvement in any workflows, understanding customer's needs and provide feedback towards product roadmap;
  • improving documentation and public facing materials based on customer feedback;
  • managing/facilitating case studies and customer quotes/references;
  • hosting webinars and knowledge sharing sessions for customer's stakeholders;
  • understanding user journey and being able to guide UX/DX roadmap;

Overall, you‚Äôre going to be one of the defining pieces of our team as we scale to thousands of customers over the next 18 months.

About you

This job will require you to have the following pivotal skills:

  • technical experience in development or systems engineering (open source experience is a plus);
  • experience in a customer-facing role (technical/developer product is a plus);
  • understanding of the Infrastructure/DevSecOps space is a plus;
  • exceptional verbal, presentation, and written communication skills;
  • high energy and strong work ethic;

How you will grow?

With this role, you play the defining role in:

  • growing Infisical and our customer base;
  • shaping short- and long-term product roadmap;
  • building out the future customer success & sales team;

Team, Values & Benefits

Our team has worked across transformative tech companies, from Figma to AWS to Red Hat.

We have an office in San Francisco, but we are mostly a remote team. We try to get together as often as possible ‚Äì whether it's for an off-site, conferences, or just get-togethers. This is a full-time role open to anyone in North American time zones.

At Infisical, we will treat you well with a competitive salary and equity offer. Depending on your risk tolerance, we would love to talk more with you about the range of options available between the two. For some other benefits (including lunch stipend, work setup budget, etc), please check out our careers page: https://infisical.com/careers.

job.title: Full Stack Engineer (Remote/SF)
job.company_description: Open-source secrets manager for developers
job.description:
About Infisical

Infisical is the #1 open source secret management platform ‚Äì used by tens of thousands of developers.

We raised $3M from Y Combinator, Gradient Ventures (Google's VC fund), and awesome angel investors like Elad Gil, Arash Ferdowsi (founder/ex-CTO of Dropbox), Paul Copplestone (founder/CEO of Supabase), James Hawkins (founder/CEO of PostHog), Andrew Miklas (founder/ex-CTO of PagerDuty), Diana Hu (GP at Y Combinator), and more.

We are default alive, and have signed many customers ranging from fastest growing startups to post-IPO enterprises.

About the role
Skills: Go, Node.js, React, TypeScript, Docker, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

About Infisical

Infisical is the #1 open source secret management platform for developers. In other words, we help organizations manage API-keys, DB access tokens, certificates, and other credentials across all parts of their infra! In fact, we process over 2B of such secrets per month.

Our customers already include some of the largest public enterprises and some of the fastest-growing startups. Developers love us and every day our community is growing stronger! Join us on a mission to make security easier for all developers ‚Äì starting from secret management.

About this role

Infisical is looking for a full stack engineer to help us build, optimize, and create the foundations of the product. You will be working closely with our CTO and the rest of the engineering team on:

  • making Infisical usable across a wide range of tech stacks;
  • maintaining our infrastructure;
  • ensuring our customers have a great experience;
  • implementing and advancing functionality like automatic secret rotation;
  • experimenting with new approaches for secret management in the AI world.

Overall, you‚Äôre going to be one of the defining pieces of our team as we scale to thousands of customers over the next 18 months.

About you

This job will require you to be a Swiss army knife of an engineer. Overall, this role demands the following pivotal skills:

  • strong proficiency in Node.js development using TypeScript
  • full-stack development, with strong expertise in both backend and frontend
  • react and Tailwind CSS for frontend development
  • understanding of cloud-native architecture and infrastructure management with tools such as Docker

On any given day, you may be:

  • developing new features that will be used by tens of thousands of developers.
  • working on resiliency and stability of the Infisical platform.
  • improving security and cryptography practices.
  • squashing bugs as well as talking to our community and enterprise customers.
  • hyper-polishing Infisical's UI/UX/DX.
  • presenting your work (e.g., new features/learnings) through blogs or videos to our community. or all of the above!

How you will grow?

With this role, you play the defining role in building out Infisical, choosing the right technologies, setting up all the necessary processes from the start, solving scalability issues, as well as making sure that our community and customer base keeps growing.

As our team grows and you get more experience on the team, you'll also have the opportunity to fully own particular parts of the platform end-to-end.

Team, Values & Benefits

Our team has worked across transformative tech companies, from Figma to AWS to Red Hat.

We have an office in San Francisco, but we are mostly a remote team. We try to get together as often as possible ‚Äì whether it's for an off-site, conferences, or just get-togethers. This is a full-time role open to anyone in North/South American and European time zones.

At Infisical, we will treat you well with a competitive salary and equity offer. Depending on your risk tolerance, we would love to talk more with you about the range of options available between the two. For some other benefits (including lunch stipend, work setup budget, etc), please check out our careers page: https://infisical.com/careers.

job.title: Sr. Economist - Hybrid 3 days in SF
job.company_description: On-demand access to English tutors over video chat.
job.description:
About Cambly

Change the future of education at Cambly.

English learners can now access seemingly unlimited free content and software for learning vocabulary and grammar. As with any subject, it‚Äôs also important to complement that learning with practice to exercise those new skills. For language education, that means having actual conversations with real English speakers.

At Cambly our mission is to provide students with an easy and affordable way to practice and improve their English skills. The Cambly app gives English learners instant 1-on-1 access to friendly native speakers over video chat 24/7. Cambly students speak over 30 languages and live in over 130 countries. English isn‚Äôt just a hobby for Cambly students. It‚Äôs a critical skill that can change their lives.

We have a small team running a large and rapidly growing business in our SF HQ. We look forward to hearing from you!

About the role
Skills: SQL

About Cambly: Our mission is to bring high quality English education to every English learner in the world at the touch of a button. Think of us as the Airbnb that matches English students with English tutors and come help us build the world‚Äôs largest English learning marketplace and school.

We're looking for a talented analytics thought leader who is passionate about changing the way people learn languages. You will own all the analytics related to the economics of a subscription business including but not limited to building and maintaining key financial metrics, forecasting our subscriber base and their value to the business, and optimizing the prices of our plans**.**  You will also be part of a nascent data community where you will help other analytics team members build and drive adoption of analytics processes that ensure data quality and technical rigor.  

Come join us in building the best place to learn and teach English!  

Job Requirements

  • 4+ years in industry experience and a Masters degree (PhD is a plus) in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research).
  • Experience in using machine learning and forecasting techniques to solve business problems and a deep understanding of ML lifecycle best practices (eg. training/serving, feature engineering, feature/model selection, labeling)
  • Experience designing and building metrics, from conception to data pipeline implementation
  • Ability to drive data strategies, with a central source of truth to impact business decisions
  • Expert in at least one programming language for data analysis (Python or R) and SQL
  • Proven ability to succeed in both collaborative and independent work environments
  • Proven ability to communicate clearly to audiences of varying technical levels 

Preferred 

  • 8+ years of relevant industry experience 
  • Experience in building ML applications for Finance 
  • Experience with setting up experiments and non-experimental causal inference methods like regression analysis and double machine learning.

Life @Cambly includes...

  • 60M VC backed and have most of the money in the bank
  • Hybrid First Company (M, T, Th)
  • Catered Lunches
  • 100% of Medical, Dental, and Vision paid along with matching 401k
  • Maternity and Paternity Paid Leave
  • 20 days of true, unbothered PTO
  • End-of-year shutdown
  • Family-friendly environment with amazing WLB and Culture
  • Helping others around the world unlock economic opportunities by learning English

This role is based in the San Francisco Bay Area, and the expected base salary range for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All full-time employees are also eligible for equity compensation and for benefits.

Compensation Package $160,000 - $190,000 USD Base Salary + Pre-IPO Stock Options

Also: We are proud to be a highly inclusive company and an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We believe in order to thrive, businesses need a diverse team and leadership. We welcome every background, identity, abilities, and mindset to join us on our mission to make high-quality English education for all. Everyone is welcome here. To request reasonable accommodation, contact peopleteam (at)cambly.com.

California Applicant Privacy Notice

Technology

iOS, Android, Python, React JS

job.title: Senior Data Engineer
job.company_description: Run machine learning models in the cloud
job.description:
About Replicate

What we're doing

Machine learning can now do some extraordinary things: it can understand the world, drive cars, write code, make art.

But, it is still extremely hard to use. Research is typically published as a PDF, with scraps of code on GitHub and weights on Google Drive (if you‚Äôre lucky!). It is near-impossible to take that work and apply it to a real-world problem, unless you are an expert.

We‚Äôre making machine learning accessible to everyone. People creating machine learning models should be able to share them in a way that other people can use, and people who want to use machine learning should be able to do it without getting a PhD.

With great power also comes great responsibility. We believe that with better tools and safeguards, we will make this powerful technology safer and easier to understand.

How we work

We're a kind, creative, hard-working bunch. We care about our work and our users. We're humble and show humility. We're looking for the same in the people we work with.

When starting this company, we thought: instead of getting a job at the best place to work, let's make that best place to work. We want to work with the best people in an inclusive, supportive environment. And, just have fun while we're at it. You will help us make that place.

You can be located anywhere. We have a beautiful office in San Francisco, CA (specifically The Mission) where some of us work, but we operate as a remote-first company across American and European timezones.

We want our team to feel invested in what we're building. We pay market salary, but well-above market equity. And, all the usual things. (We're European so you'll get really good healthcare.)

About the role

You‚Äôre a generalist data and analytics expert who thrives on developing data infrastructure at scale. You act like an owner and feel a desire to lead; you‚Äôve likely been a data engineer at traditional companies but you‚Äôre ready to amplify your impact as the first data hire at a leading AI startup.

Replicate is building the fastest way to deploy machine learning models. We offer access to all types of open source models across modalities and levels of customization. The business is complex and we need a solid data foundation to guide decisions and hold ourselves accountable. You‚Äôll be responsible for owning this foundation across the company.

We‚Äôre looking for the right person, not just someone who checks boxes, so you don‚Äôt need to satisfy all of these things. But you probably have some of these qualities:

  • Think like a software engineer: You put things in GitHub, use continuous integration, give things good names, make it consistent with how we do things in the product. We want to create data systems that integrate with the rest of our systems, not their own silo with a different culture.
  • Experience building 0‚Üí1: You‚Äôve set up data stacks and pipelines from scratch in the past.
  • Expert with SQL and other common analytics tools: You know your way around BI tools like Metabase and can leverage them to deliver actionable insights.
  • Agility and efficiency: You can move fast and prioritize effectively, delivering 80/20 solutions that address core needs.
  • Experience with usage-based businesses: You understand the nuances of analyzing usage-based businesses from the ground up.
  • Collaboration and partnership: You can work collaboratively with Finance, Product, Infrastructure, and Growth teams to create and maintain dashboards that measure key business metrics. You‚Äôre a solid communicator and can help teams pull together a story; you go beyond reporting metrics, diving deeper to understand what‚Äôs driving the numbers.

This role is based in our San Francisco office.

Technology

We have a web product (currently React + Django), an open source CLI (Go + Python), and Kubernetes ML serving infrastructure.

job.title: Senior/Staff Engineer - Infrastructure
job.company_description: Web apps in pure Python. Deploy with a single command.
job.description:
About Reflex

Reflex is an open-source framework to build web apps in pure Python and deploy them with a single command. This can be anything from a small data science/internal app to a large multi-page web app.

We launched in December and have seen rapid adoption of our open-source framework, with over 80,000 apps made to date. In parallel with improving our open-source framework, we are now working on a hosting service so users can quickly deploy and scale their apps. We have raised 5M in seed funding in August led by Lux Capital with some fantastic founders as angel investors.

Introduction:https://reflex.dev/docs/getting-started/introduction/Github: https://github.com/reflex-dev/reflex

Funding Blog Post: https://reflex.dev/blog/2023-08-02-seed-annoucement/

About the role
Skills: Kubernetes, Python, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

We‚Äôre looking for a fantastic SF/Bay Area-based engineer comfortable working on a very early product in a quickly changing codebase and role. Our office is in San Francisco and we work in person M-F.

This role will involve leading the development of our hosting service. We have an obsession over developer experience so getting things to run reliably, fast, and secure at scale is extremely important.

Responsibilities:

  • Improve deployment times and reliability for our hosting service and log streaming.
  • Build an observability stack for all of Reflex apps.
  • Implement new features such as hooking up custom domains, scaling up and down Reflex apps, and adding alerting on failed deployments
  • Skills: AWS, Terraform, Docker, Networking, Grafana, Kubernetes

What We Look for:

  • Extensive experience setting up and scaling secure infrastructure
  • Obsession over developer experience and performance.
Interview Process
  • The entire process is fully remote; all communication will happen via email and video chat.
  • Once you've submitted your application, the team will review your submission and may reach out for an intro call.
  • After the intro call, there will be a technical take-home test and then an onsite with 2-3 technical interviews, each around 45 minutes.
  • Once the interviews are over, the team will meet to discuss several roles and candidates and may be asked one or two follow-up questions over email or a quick call or go directly to make an offer.

  • Work on improving our different aspects of our hosting service:
    • Streaming logs, Authentication, authorization, database management
  • Work on improving performance, shaving milliseconds off our deployment times.

What We Look for:

https://reflex-dev.notion.site/Careers-at-Reflex-4cc955eac99248769554bdc5c8eef1a1\

Interview Process

  • After completing a bounty there will be an intro call, then an onsite with 2-3 technical interviews, each around 45 minutes.
  • Once the interviews are over, the team will meet to discuss several roles and candidates and may be asked one or two follow-up questions over email or a quick call or go directly to make an offer.

job.title: Full-Stack Engineer
job.company_description: AI-enabled financial automation and intelligence for CPG Brands
job.description:
About Confido

Confido is a next-generation financial automation and intelligence platform that helps fast-growing CPG brands operate and scale more efficiently.

About the role

Confido (YC S21) automates the expensive work of retrieving and analyzing CPG accounting data so that fast-growing CPG brands can track and optimize their spend. In 2024, it shouldn‚Äôt take 100+ hours of human labor for Mr. Beast‚Äôs Feastables (one of our customers) to determine how many millions were spent on in store promotions last quarter; and whether or not that money was well spent. To solve these problems, we‚Äôve built an all-in-one solution that deeply integrates with ERPs and other accounting systems, scrapes financial data from retailers and distributors, and leverages modern AI to analyze financial documents.

Today, we work with 50+ fast-growing brands, processing $3b+ in revenue. We have raised $3.6M from leading investors.

Our team has deep industry experience from Anheuser-Busch and SimpleMills, and engineering experience from Google, Square, HubSpot, and ThoughtSpot.

The Role

Location: New York, NY (relocation assistance available)

Compensation: $140,000 and $180,000 + Benefits + Meaningful Equity (.7% - 1.1%).

As a full-stack engineer at Confido, you will spearhead the development of new features and systems from the ground up. This role offers the unique opportunity to shape the product landscape and make a tangible impact on our technology and our customers.

You may be working on

  • AI (computer vision + NLP) powered data processing of financial documents
  • Scaling data collection capabilities across different sources
  • Financial analytics and forecasting
  • Interfacing directly with customers to understand their needs and craft intuitive UXs
  • Create intuitive user interfaces that simplify complex data into actionable insights
  • And more‚Ä¶

Requirements

(1) Strong technical background with 4+ years of full-time engineering experience (Backend or ML /AI experience highly preferred)

(2) Scrappiness and interest in learning the ins and outs of the CPG industry

Preferred qualifications

(1) Excellent communication skills with the ability to talk directly with customers and manage feature development

(2) Strong desire to work at an early-stage startup and touch all parts of the product

(3) CS or equivalent degree

Technology

Confido develops in: Ruby on Rails for our back-end, TypeScript React for the front-end, and Python for ML services and R&D analysis. We also use a variety of cloud/serverless services including AWS Textract, Lambda, S3, SES, Postgres, Porter K8s, and Render.

job.title: Full-Stack Engineer
job.company_description: A modern version of NetSuite
job.description:
About Campfire

Campfire is the modern accounting platform for startups and mid-size tech companies. Features include a powerful general ledger, invoicing, billing, revenue accounting and reporting, financial statements, AI-powered conversational reporting, and automated accounting workflows such as bank reconciliation. The product is natively integrated with industry leading solutions such as Ramp, Brex, Rho, Stripe, and has over 100+ API endpoints to build custom integrations and workflows. Campfire is a modern replacement for legacy, small business accounting software and mid-market ERPs.

Campfire's customers range from Seed to Series C with a variety of business models including SaaS, usage, FinTech, consulting and transactions ‚Äî from startups like Suger and Parallel to mid-size companies like Carbon Direct, Sprig and Delphia.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Foundation Capital, Y Combinator and Twenty Two Ventures.

About the role
Skills: Django

Please note: This role is in-office in San Francisco at our headquarters working with the entire company five days per week. We are not open to remote candidates.

About Us

Campfire is on a mission to redefine the accounting software landscape by taking on giants like Netsuite to build modern accounting software for startups and mid-size tech companies. We graduated from Y Combinator's Summer 2023 cohort, and we are backed by prominent investors like Foundation Capital and a rapidly growing customer base.

About the Role
üåü The Role:

Join our engineering team as a full-stack or back-end developers at Campfire, you'll be the architect behind building our mission-critical software to delight our customers.

üíº We Need Someone Who:

Has Expertise: Proven track record with Python, NextJS/React and Tailwind.

Thrives in Agility: Our team is lean and moves quickly. You're comfortable operating with little structure, adapting to change with ease.

Values Autonomy: We trust you to take the reins. You're self-driven, manage your tasks effectively, and can lead projects to the finish line.

üë• Ideal Candidate:

You're not just looking for a job; you're seeking a challenge.

You're passionate about creating user-centric solutions.

You're eager to collaborate, learn, and grow within a startup environment.

üì¢ Let's Connect:

Think you're the perfect fit? We're excited to meet you! Reach out, share your story, and let's explore how you can ignite change at Campfire.

‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π Benefits:

We provide top decile benefits including 100% premium coverage for employees and 80% coverage for dependents with comprehensive healthcare and dental care options.

Technology

We use Django in the backend, and NextJS in the frontend.

job.title: Founding Product Designer
job.company_description: AI-powered operating system for Airbnb hosts
job.description:
About ProhostAI

We are a YC S24 company on a mission to make every Airbnb host a 5-star host by automating and improving their operations with the help of AI. We are building an AI-powered operating system for hosts on Airbnb and other short-term rental platforms.

Our founding team consists of highly experienced technical leaders from Airbnb and Dropbox. We are looking to expand our small but mighty team.

About the role
Skills: Wireframing, Figma

Company Description
ProhostAI (YC S24) building an AI-powered operating system for Airbnb hosts. Our founding team consists of data scientists and engineers from Airbnb, Dropbox, Pinterest, Harvard and Yale. We have raised $1.5M and are backed by Y Combinator and Pear VC. Our founding team consists of technologists who are also Airbnb hosts with a 4.99+ rating across thousands of stays.

Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role based out of our office in San Francisco. We are seeking Founding Product Designer to join our early-stage startup and help shape the future of Airbnb hosting. In this role, you will have the opportunity to own the end-to-end design process for key features of our AI-powered host operating system. 

As our first full time Product Designer, you will:

  • Work closely with the founding team to define the product vision, strategy and roadmap
  • Lead the UX and UI design for core product features from ideation through implementation 
  • Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity designs to communicate design solutions
  • Partner with engineering to ensure designs are implemented to spec and the final product delivers an exceptional user experience
  • Conduct user research and usability testing to validate designs and gather insights
  • Contribute to building our design system and evolving our design processes as the team grows
  • Provide input on product direction and help shape the design culture at an early stage

What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of product design experience, in consumer, B2B SaaS and/or marketplaces
  • Strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end product design work across web and mobile 
  • Expertise in interaction design, visual design, and design systems
  • Highly proficient with Figma. Experience with Dev Mode
  • User-centered design approach and experience with user research and usability testing methods
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills 
  • Ability to operate autonomously in an ambiguous and fast-paced startup environment
  • Passion for the short-term rental space and empathy for hosts is a big plus
  • Contractor role with potential for full-time conversion

Why Join Us

  • Help establish the design foundation at a promising early-stage startup
  • Work directly with experienced technical founders to bring an ambitious product vision to life
  • Contribute to a product that will empower hosts and elevate the guest experience 
  • Competitive compensation and flexible work arrangements

To apply, please send your resume, portfolio, and a brief note on why you're excited about ProhostAI. We look forward to hearing from you!

Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role based out of our office in San Francisco. As a Full Stack Product Engineer, you will be responsible for back-end and front-end web development, software development, and full-stack development tasks. We are looking for a product minded engineer who is excited to ship novel & delightful AI-powered user experiences to build a category leading product for Airbnb hosts.

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience with front-end development (React, TypeScript, PWAs)
  • 2+ years of experience with back-end development (Python, RabbitMQ, Microservices)

  • Experience with cloud technologies and deployment (AWS/Google Cloud, Firebase, Docker
  • Knowledge of databases and web storage solutions (Postgres, Redis, NoSql)

Tech Stack

  • Backend: Python, Postgres
  • Frontend: React, Typescript
  • Infrastructure: AWS
  • Tools: Linear, Notion, Slack etc.

  • Competitive salary & equity
  • Fully covered top tier health, dental and vision plans
  • Base salary: $100K-$200K
  • 20 days of PTO
  • Fully specced Macbook Pro
