  • CEO interview - 30 minutes
  • Technical challenge - 1 hour
  • CTO interview - 60 minutes

job.title: Junior Software Engineer - Global/Remote
job.company_description: Data products for sales, marketing, finance, recruiting, and more.
job.description:
About MixRank

MixRank processes petabytes of data every month from web crawls, Google Play Store, Apple App Store, social media, and dozens of other sources. We have hundreds of customers using our data products including Google, Amazon, Facebook, Intel, and Adobe, across industries Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Security.

Team is 42 full-time as of 2024, full-remote. We're growing, profitable, employee-owned, no dependence on outside funding.

About the role
Skills: Python, TypeScript, SQL, Linux, PostgreSQL

At MixRank, we create B2B SaaS products that enable sales, marketing, finance, and business intelligence teams to accelerate their business with data and insights into their customers. One that provides the most comprehensive database of mobile apps and websites, technographics, companies, and decision makers. It's a platform created with the sole purpose of providing the fastest way for sales reps to build prospect lists, prioritize leads, and contact decision-makers.

We're looking for remote engineers that have finished school within the last 2 years or will finish in the next 6 months. This is an open-ended entry-level role with mentorship, and diverse opportunities to work on all areas of our product: databases, distributed systems, infrastructure and tooling, data analysis, machine learning, frontend and backend web development, APIs, data mining, data modeling, and more.

Our code base is very friendly to new contributors. You'll have a fully-functional development environment within hours (fully automated) and be pushing commits on your first day. Deployments to production happen multiple times per day and finish in less than 2 minutes. Effectively all of our codebase is written in Python, SQL, and Javascript/TypeScript. The core technologies you'll need familiarity with to be productive are Python, PostgreSQL, Linux, and Git.

Why Join MixRank? Fully-remote, no HQ office. Team of 32 people across 15+ countries. Invested in by Y Combinator, 500 Startups, Mark Cuban. Profitable and growing 50% every year.

Please include your updated resume when applying for this role.

Important: Only accept job offers from emails ending in @mixrank.com. Offers from any other email addresses are fraudulent. Do not share personal information with unverified senders.

Technology

Python, PostgreSQL, Linux, Nix, Rust, Javascript, TypeScript.

job.title: Full Stack Engineer ‚Äî Legion Health (Y Combinator startup, Remote, Argentina)
job.company_description: World-class, AI-enabled psychiatry covered by insurance
job.description:
About Legion Health

Legion Health is a pioneering telepsychiatry company dedicated to transforming patient care through advanced technology. We leverage cutting-edge language models and robust data analytics to enhance our patient-provider interactions, improve access to mental health services, and streamline our clinical operations.

Our mission is to integrate innovative AI solutions into every facet of psychiatric care, ensuring providers and patients benefit from the most effective and efficient treatment strategies.

About the role
Skills: Node.js, React, TypeScript, Google Cloud, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

About Legion Health

Legion Health is a pioneering telepsychiatry company dedicated to transforming patient care through advanced technology. We leverage cutting-edge language models and robust data analytics to enhance patient-provider interactions, improve access to mental health services, and streamline clinical operations. Our mission is to integrate innovative AI solutions into every facet of psychiatric care, ensuring both providers and patients benefit from the most effective and efficient treatment strategies.

About the Role

Skills

TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, Azure, Google Cloud, AWS

Mission

We are revolutionizing telepsychiatry through a core AI infrastructure that enables a vastly improved patient experience and quality of mental health care. We are actively improving our services in ingesting, chunking, embedding, caching, and searching to achieve this goal. Our technical goals include:

  • Enhanced processing: Implement robust data structures and caching mechanisms to handle increasing volumes of language data spanning every facet of patients‚Äô care while minimizing latency and maximizing system responsiveness.
  • System scalability: Ensure our systems can scale effectively to support growth from one million to hundreds of millions of data points.
  • Securing sensitive data: Uphold the highest standards of data security and privacy in compliance with HIPAA guidelines.

We are seeking a Senior Engineer (backend-focused) who will:

  • Lead the development and optimization of our backend architecture.
  • Implement and manage scalable and secure APIs and database schemas.
  • Collaborate on integrating agentic LLM models to enhance our services.
  • Communicate technology strategy to stakeholders and contribute to a culture of technical excellence.

Outcomes

  • System Performance: Achieve system scalability to handle tenfold data growth while maintaining or improving response times for our heavily LLM-dependent services.
  • Data Security: Implement solutions that fully comply with HIPAA and ensure zero breaches.
  • Innovation in Telepsychiatry: Introduce new functionalities that leverage language models to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency.

Skills

Soft Skills

  • Problem Solving: You are adept at identifying and resolving complex technical issues.
  • Innovation: You actively propose and implement solutions that push the boundaries of traditional healthcare IT.
  • Collaboration: You effectively communicate and work with cross-functional teams to meet business and technology goals.
  • Leadership: You are capable of guiding and inspiring a technical team towards achieving architectural and operational excellence.

Hard Skills

  • Practical experience with or demonstrated deep interest in language model-first systems and solutions.
  • Strong experience with backend technologies including TypeScript and Node.js.
  • Expertise in designing and managing databases, particularly with PostgreSQL.
  • Proficient in managing cloud services across Google Cloud, Azure, and AWS.
  • Experience in implementing secure and scalable APIs.

Background

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 3‚Äì5+ years of experience in backend development, with a focus on scalable and secure systems.
  • Proven track record in building and maintaining high-traffic, secure backend systems.

Technology

TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, Supabase, Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, LangChain, PostHog, Retool, React

Technology

Technology at Legion

We are revolutionizing telepsychiatry through a core AI infrastructure that enables a vastly improved patient experience and quality of mental health care. We are actively improving our services in ingesting, chunking, embedding, caching, and searching to achieve this goal. Our technical goals include:

  • Enhanced processing: Implement robust data structures and caching mechanisms to handle increasing volumes of language data spanning every facet of patients‚Äô care while minimizing latency and maximizing system responsiveness.
  • System scalability: Ensure our systems can scale effectively to support growth from one million to hundreds of millions of data points.
  • Securing sensitive data: Uphold the highest standards of data security and privacy in compliance with HIPAA guidelines.

##StackTypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, Supabase, Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, LangChain, PostHog, Retool

Interview Process

Interview Process

  • Phone interview with co-founder and CTO
  • Technical Interview/Workshop: Deep dive into technical skills and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Technical Case: Tackle a real-world problem related to our current technical challenges.
  • Interview with Co-founders: Discuss vision, motivation, and fit.
  • Interview with technical advisor
  • 3 Reference Checks: Confirm past achievements and qualifications.

job.title: AI Engineer
job.company_description: Search for the next generation using generative AI
job.description:
About Andi

Andi is search for the next generation. Instead of links, Andi gives you answers - like talking with a smart friend. Andi uses language models and generative AI combined with live data to generate answers to questions, and to explain and summarize information combined from the best sources.

About the role
Skills: ML, Python, Deep Learning, Docker, Natural Language Processing, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

AI Engineer - Pioneering the Future of Search with Generative AI

Join Andi, a YC-backed startup revolutionizing search with cutting-edge AI technology. We're seeking an exceptional AI Engineer to help us build the next generation of intelligent search engines. 

See what we‚Äôre building at andisearch.com

About the Role: As an AI Engineer at Andi, you'll be at the forefront of applying state-of-the-art language models and AI techniques to transform how people interact with information. You'll work on challenging problems in AI search, contributing to our mission of creating a more intuitive and powerful search experience.

 What You'll Do:

  • Design and implement advanced AI/ML features for our search engine
  • Develop and optimize large language models, focusing on open-source LLMs
  • Apply and innovate with RAG, Ô¨Åne-tuning, and prompt engineering techniques
  • Create curated datasets from high-quality sources, and using synthetic generation
  • Build and deploy scalable AI-powered backend services
  • Collaborate with a small, agile team to rapidly iterate and ship new features

 What We're Looking For:

  • 1+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, with a focus on NLP and LLMs. 3+ years in software development.
  • Strong Python skills and experience with AI frameworks (Langchain, PyTorch, Hugging Face, etc.)
  • Proven track record of implementing and optimizing LLMs in production environments
  • Experience with vector databases and efficient retrieval methods
  • Familiarity with AWS and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Passion for open-source AI models and staying current with the latest AI research
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently
  • Excellent communication skills and enthusiasm for user-centric product development

 Ideal Qualities:

  • Self-motivated with a passion for AI and its potential to transform search
  • Enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment
  • Low-ego team player who thrives on collaboration and knowledge sharing
  • Interest in sci-Ô¨Å and the future possibilities of AI technology

Location: We prefer candidates able to work in-person in San Francisco, but we're open to remote or hybrid arrangements for exceptional candidates.

Why Andi?

  • Opportunity to shape the future of AI-powered search from the ground up
  • Work with cutting-edge AI technologies and contribute to open-source projects
  • Join a passionate team backed by Y Combinator and top-tier venture capital
  • Competitive salary and equity package

Learn more about Andi on andi.co

If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and search technology, we want to hear from you. Apply now and be part of building something with real meaning and impact!

Technology

Search of vertical searches via APIs, and Generative AI using LLMs to give direct answers to questions.

job.title: Founding Backend Engineer
job.company_description: Google flights using credit card points and miles
job.description:
About Roame

Roame is Google Flights for your credit card points and miles. We search across airlines to find the best flight redemptions to help users maximize their points.

About the role
Skills: Go, TypeScript, React, Swift

About Roame

Roame‚Äôs mission is to make travel perfect. We empower everyone to search for flights using their credit card points and miles. By constantly monitoring available flight stock, we delight millions of users by finding them their dream flights, we have saved members tens of millions in flights. We are growing extremely quickly: Hundreds of thousands of users many of which are paid ‚Äî this is just the beginning.

Roame was part of Y Combinator‚Äôs Summer 2023 class.

The Role

We are hiring a full-stack/backend expert who can inform key architectural decisions and help Roame scale many orders of magnitude. You will own Roame‚Äôs innovative backend system, and help with frontend key APIs.

You‚Äôll work closely with our ambitious and no-BS engineering team to shape the foundations of our company.

Responsibilities

  • Own Backend and the technical build-out as we scale
  • Aid building user-facing features on frontend/mobile, improve performance and reliability in our React-based web-app
  • Improve Roame‚Äôs backend systems: build backend endpoints for application logic (e.g., search, smart user systems)

What we‚Äôre looking for

  • 5+ years of software development experience,
  • Proficiency in Golang
  • Familiarity with Mobile Systems, React, and Node.js
  • Familiarity with AWS, Google Cloud
  • Have worked on a code base at scale or created/contributed to code base at scale

Technology

Engineering problems we're solving: User customization, efficient inventory data gathering and engineering at scale, managing high outbound traffic, efficient data management, and building features on top of 3rd party data connections.

Our company culture, or why you may or may not be excited about joining us:

Culture: 

  • Strong work ethic is a significant competitive advantage

    As a startup we are trying to change the world and take on many large competitors. If this were easy, everyone would be doing it. Raw hours make a huge difference when facing overwhelming odds. We believe that having a strong work ethic is a competitive advantage, and we expect everyone at Roame to put in their best effort when they‚Äôre at work.

  • Going above and beyond

    Have an idea? Disagree with folks (founders)? Action speaks orders of magnitude louder than words, show us. Speaking up is not for everyone, but building to prove/disprove is. Our job is to delight our customers, anything to make their lives magical is in line with our mission. We got here because lightning struck the same place multiple times, but not without taking the first step. We can‚Äôt resist passion especially when it grows greater than ours.

  • Take ownership and be accountable

    We can rely on each member of the team to get their work done. When we say we'll do something - we get it done without anyone checking in on us. This way, we can establish a culture of trust and not micromanage each other. We are as strong as our weakest link and we aim to help one another to complete our tasks.

  • Be Nice

    We‚Äôre a family here, be nice to each other. We follow radical candor to get things done, we are a no-passive-aggressive shop, truth is hard to swallow, doesn‚Äôt mean it has to be delivered with malice. Egos are left at home, kindness is how we support each other. We are always improving at this.

  • Disagree and commit

    We can disagree and commit. Not all of our ideas will be implemented, and sometimes the group will decide to do something one of us disagrees with. Even if we disagree with the decision, we commit to getting it done. It's counterproductive to keep arguing and slow down implementation efforts; better to get it done quickly and see if it actually works instead of speculating otherwise.

Technology

We are tech stack agnostic, however, we value two things 1. Developer productive 2. Iteration speed. For now, we're on AWS deployed via Codepipeline, using Python + Nextjs

job.title: Founding Growth & Operations
job.company_description: Google flights using credit card points and miles
job.description:

About the role

The Role

We are hiring a Founding Growth & Operations team member who has an owner mentality, can wear many hats, and is crazy for points. With Roame, there is no limit to how much responsibility you can take on from growth to operations to even product.

You will report directly to the CEO and work closely with the engineering team. This position is in San Francisco with at least 4 days in-office per week.

Responsibilities

  • Growth: Own and run the growth function end-to-end, including: demand generation, marketing, conversion, community-building, and more. Craft growth processes for scale and constantly experiment. You‚Äôre relentless about operational excellence and always launching new ideas. You‚Äôll help take our growth to new heights through constantly refining processes, iterating on growth experiments, and constructing playbooks that will scale with exponential growth.
  • Operations: You will assist with various internal operations projects, related to finance, product research, partnerships, etc. as needed. Build for scale and efficiency. We have grown exceptionally fast and expect that growth to continue to accelerate. Identify areas for process improvement and efficiency gains, and scope new processes when needed. Be relentlessly curious, creative and proactive in implementing solutions to critical issues.
  • Data Analysis: You will analyze business and user behavior data to help inform decisions.
  • Customer Support: You will manage and improve the customer support processes to ensure we deliver an excellent customer support experience.

What are we looking for?

  • Passion for travel and all things points & miles.

  • Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.

Why join Roame?

job.title: Backend Engineer
job.company_description: Input OpenAPI. Output SDKs and API documentation.
job.description:
About Fern

APIs underpin the internet but are still painful to work with. They are often untyped, unstandardized, and out-of-sync across multiple sources of truth.

Fern enables businesses to offer ‚ÄúStripe-level‚Äù SDKs (client libraries) and Docs for their REST API. Inspired by internal tooling we saw at AWS and Palantir, we‚Äôre building Fern to let every engineering team offer easy-to-use and well-documented APIs.

Founded in 2022, we‚Äôre less than 10 people, building open source, and backed by YCombinator. We work together in our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Our customers include Cohere, ElevenLabs, Webflow, and Merge.dev.

About the role

This role is in person at our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY.

As a small team, we‚Äôre all generalists, constantly pick up new challenges, and interface with customers regularly. Regarding product and code, we‚Äôre looking to work with experienced people who can pick a problem and solve it. We don‚Äôt expect you to have a background in all the tools we use, but we expect a background working with TypeScript and at least one other language.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Develop a new Software Development Kit (SDK) generator. Be the primary author behind the next SDK language we release to our customers. We‚Äôre looking for expertise in Rust, Swift, and PHP.
  • Be a polyglot. Contribute code across repositories in different programming languages. You may help a user in Go, TypeScript, Python, and Ruby within the same month.
  • Earn trust with customers. Talk with developers from early-stage startups, growth-stage businesses, and large enterprises to understand their needs.
  • Build our team. We‚Äôre growing, and you will work directly with the CEO, CTO, and other founding members to bring in talented engineers.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • 4+ years of professional backend or full-stack development
  • Significant experience working with TypeScript and another language
  • Experience starting a project from scratch. You might have led a project, built a side project you‚Äôre proud of, or been a founder.
  • Strong communication skills with excitement to interact with customers over Slack and Zoom
  • (Nice to have) You've worked in a high-growth SaaS company

What we offer

  • Interesting and challenging work
  • Ownership of projects end-to-end while wearing multiple hats
  • First-hand experience building an early-stage startup 
  • A salary of $156,000 to $192,000 and equity
  • Living proximity bonus of $18,000 per year if you choose to live near the office
  • Meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) at the office
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation

Our tech stack

  • NextJS + Vercel (Frontend)
  • Fern (API)
  • Microservices: Express (NodeJs)
  • Postgres DB + Prisma ORM
  • AWS (Cloud)
Technology

  • Fern (API)
  • Microservices: Express (NodeJs), FastAPI (Python)

job.title: Frontend Engineer
job.company_description: Input OpenAPI. Output SDKs and API documentation.
job.description:
About Fern

APIs underpin the internet but are still painful to work with. They are often untyped, unstandardized, and out-of-sync across multiple sources of truth.

Fern enables businesses to offer ‚ÄúStripe-level‚Äù SDKs (client libraries) and Docs for their REST API. Inspired by internal tooling we saw at AWS and Palantir, we‚Äôre building Fern to let every engineering team offer easy-to-use and well-documented APIs.

Founded in 2022, we‚Äôre less than 10 people, building open source, and backed by YCombinator. We work together in our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Our customers include Cohere, ElevenLabs, Webflow, and Merge.dev.

About the role

This role is in person at our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY.

As a small team, we‚Äôre all generalists, constantly pick up new challenges, and interface with customers regularly. Regarding product and code, we‚Äôre looking to work with experienced people who can pick a problem and solve it. We don‚Äôt expect you to have a background in all the tools we use, but we expect strong JavaScript fundamentals and a background working with Next.js, React, and TypeScript.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Streamline the developer experience for our monorepo. Bring your opinions about what a ‚Äúgood‚Äù internal DX looks like that helps us reduce build time, accelerate deploy time, and increase our time-to-ship.
  • Manage our frontend infrastructure. You‚Äôll lead our implementation of Storybook, improve our CI/CD pipeline, optimize our web application's performance, and implement application monitoring.
  • Build user-facing features. Our customers ask us for a WYSIWYG editor to get them out of Markdown files and into an in-browser app. They also ask for a changelog that describes how their developer documentation changes over time. You‚Äôll be responsible for architecting, designing, deploying, and driving adoption amongst our growing customer base.
  • Earn trust with customers. Talk with developers from early-stage startups, growth-stage businesses, and large enterprises to understand their needs.
  • Build our team. We‚Äôre growing, and you will work directly with the CEO, CTO, and other founding members to bring in talented engineers.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • 4+ years of professional frontend development, ideally some of which you‚Äôve spent in startups
  • Significant experience working with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, and Next.js
  • Previous experience working closely with designers
  • Significant experience working with APIs
  • A customer-first mindset and an interest in talking with customers to make sure we‚Äôre building a polished product that meets their needs
  • (Bonus) You‚Äôre experienced using OpenAPI, Conjure (from Palantir), or Smithy (from AWS)

What we offer

  • Interesting and challenging work
  • Ownership of projects end-to-end while wearing multiple hats
  • First-hand experience building an early-stage startup 
  • A salary of $156,000 to $192,000 and equity
  • Living proximity bonus of $18,000 per year if you choose to live near the office
  • Meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) at the office
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation

Our tech stack

  • NextJS + Vercel (Frontend)
  • Fern (API)
  • Microservices: Express (NodeJs), FastAPI (Python)
  • Postgres DB + Prisma ORM
  • AWS (Cloud)
Technology

Our tech stack:

  • NextJS + Vercel (Frontend)
  • Fern (API)
  • Microservices: Express (NodeJs), FastAPI (Python)
  • Postgres DB + Prisma ORM
  • AWS (Cloud)

About Fern

APIs underpin the internet but are still painful to work with. They are often untyped, unstandardized, and out-of-sync across multiple sources of truth.

Fern enables businesses to offer ‚ÄúStripe-level‚Äù SDKs (client libraries) and Docs for their REST API. Inspired by internal tooling we saw at AWS and Palantir, we‚Äôre building Fern to let every engineering team offer easy-to-use and well-documented APIs.

About the role

This role is in person at our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY.

As a small team, we‚Äôre all generalists, constantly pick up new challenges, and interface with customers regularly. Regarding product and code, we‚Äôre looking to work with experienced people who can pick a problem and solve it.

We‚Äôre adding new customers every week, and as a result, we have more questions, feedback, and support tickets from developers using Fern than ever before. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre adding a customer-centric software engineer to our team.

What you‚Äôll do

  • Have direct relationships with customers. Whether they‚Äôre a CTO, VP of Eng, or Software Engineer, you‚Äôll be the face of Fern and the first person they turn to when they need help. You‚Äôll quickly build a network within the SaaS startup community, especially among YC founders.
  • Move fast. To support our customers, you‚Äôll work across several codebases to release bug fixes and features. For example, one day you may fix a bug related to our TypeScript SDK generator and another day you may add features to the Docs Frontend.
  • Drive our product roadmap. When you hear a request from a customer that feels hard to build, they may be questioning an assumption we made 6 months ago or proposing a feature requiring a large engineering effort from us. You can use this customer context to build something people want.‚Ñ¢

job.title: Product Designer
job.company_description: Input OpenAPI. Output SDKs and API documentation.
job.description:
About Fern

APIs underpin the internet but are still painful to work with. They are often untyped, unstandardized, and out-of-sync across multiple sources of truth.

Fern enables businesses to offer ‚ÄúStripe-level‚Äù SDKs (client libraries) and Docs for their REST API. Inspired by internal tooling we saw at AWS and Palantir, we‚Äôre building Fern to let every engineering team offer easy-to-use and well-documented APIs.

Founded in 2022, we‚Äôre less than 10 people, building open source, and backed by YCombinator. We work together in our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Our customers include Cohere, ElevenLabs, Webflow, and Merge.dev.

About the role
Skills: Figma

This role is in person at our office in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY.

We are a small, close-knit group of generalists who enjoy solving problems and get energy from working closely with our customers. We're looking for a talented Product Designer (you!) to bring expertise in Figma and prototyping tools to our team.

Core Responsibilities

  • Interaction and visual design. You'll be involved at every stage of design work. You'll help define early product concepts, flesh out the high-level workflow and micro-interactions of a feature, and execute a crisp and effective visual design.
  • Prototyping. You will prototype both to communicate your designs and validate your decisions. You‚Äôll go out and get feedback directly from our users over Slack and Zoom.
  • Empathy with the developer persona. Our users typically have the title software engineer and have a high capacity for complexity. As such, your ability to understand and reason about technical concepts is key, as you will be designing data-dense, operational interfaces. The ideal candidate is able to distill complex concepts into familiar, easy-to-use workflows while retaining the flexibility of an enterprise platform.
  • Product ownership. You will be responsible for the end-to-end user experience. We expect strong opinions about product direction. Utilize your design skills to help craft our roadmap.
  • Awareness of how software interfaces are built. Familiarity with modern web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript) is appreciated. You don't need to be an expert‚Äîjust fluent enough to collaborate with engineers and know what's possible with frontend technologies.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • 3+ years of professional product design experience
  • Significant experience working with Figma and a prototyping tool
  • (Nice to have) You've worked in a high-growth SaaS company
  • (Nice to have) Experience as the only designer on a small team

We‚Äôre looking for a 20-hour-per-week commitment with the opportunity for contract-to-hire.

Technology

Our tech stack:

  • NextJS + Vercel (Frontend)
  • Fern (API)
  • Microservices: Express (NodeJs), FastAPI (Python)
  • Postgres DB + Prisma ORM
  • AWS (Cloud)

job.location: New York, NY, US / Remote (New York, NY, US)
job.title: Social Media & Content Director
job.company_description: A protocol & developer stack for delivering your product experiences. Everywhere.
job.description:
About Dialect
About the role

About Dialect

At Dialect, we‚Äôre on a mission to unfurl the internet and give developers the tools to create experiences that are sharable‚Äîand actionable‚Äîeverywhere. We call them Blockchain Links, or Blinks.

About the Role

Dialect is hiring a Social Media and Content Director to shape the voice of the team behind Blinks and Actions. As the recurring impression maker on both users and our ecosystem partners, it is mission-critical that we are speaking loud and clear to our audience. You will have ownership over the process and results.

You may be a good fit for this role if you are comfortable creating a social media identity for an industry-changing product. This position offers competitive compensation, including salary, equity, and a benefits package commensurate with experience and location.

Responsibilities

  • You will shape the social media identity and voice of Dialect and Blinks & Actions across multiple social platforms.
  • You will lead marketing efforts for Dialect across blogs, X threads, X spaces, Discord and Telegram.
  • You will work with the Dialect team, our partners, and Actions & Blinks developers to spread our mission and values far and wide.
  • You will create, implement, and own a social media strategy that aligns with Dialect‚Äôs goals and objectives.
  • You will coordinate with our designers and animators to generate engaging and relevant content that includes posts, threads, and videos. Content should be focused on highlighting our partners and informing the ecosystem. Working directly with partners to create content and initiatives will be strongly encouraged.
  • You will work internally with the Dialect team to get into the details of what we‚Äôre building and why we‚Äôre building it. We ship fast. What are we shipping? How can we produce engaging, creative content surrounding each product release?
  • You will analyze social media metrics and report findings back to the team monthly.
  • You will expand our brand beyond core web3 and help create a distinct, authentic voice and brand for Dialect.

Requirements and Skills

  • You have 2+ years of experience running either your own high-engagement social media account or a business account.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and a strong ability to adapt tone and style for different audiences.
  • You have a deep knowledge of the web3 ecosystem.
  • You have a deep knowledge of web3 culture.
  • You are a storyteller and narrative shifter.
  • You know how to drive attention and build and maintain an audience.
  • You have generated content in a collaborative setting.
  • You are scrappy and self-motivated. You know how to push social media initiatives across the finish line.

job.location: New York, NY, US / Remote (New York, NY, US)
job.title: Developer Relations Engineer
job.company_description: A protocol & developer stack for delivering your product experiences. Everywhere.
job.description:
About Dialect
About the role

Website: https://dialect.to Twitter: https://twitter.com/saydialect

About Dialect

At Dialect we‚Äôre on a mission to unfurl the internet, and give developers the tools to create experiences that are sharable‚Äî& actionable‚Äîeverywhere. We call them Blockchain Links, or Blinks.

About the Role

Dialect is hiring its first Developer Relations Engineer to lead the education & adoption of a new developer tools product category.

You may be a good fit for this role if you have an obsession with great developer tools, an enthusiasm for evangelizing them, and a relentless drive to discover the language that defines them.

This position offers competitive compensation, including salary, equity, and benefits package commensurate with experience and location. This role requires being onsite in New York City one or two days a week.

Responsibilities

  • You will collaborate with the leadership, engineering, and product teams at Dialect to understand and shape our vision, and then share that knowledge with the community.
  • You will work closely with the developer community to educate them on these new concepts and the tools we‚Äôve built around them, & respond to feedback to help better shape how we communicate our products, & what the products are themselves.
  • You will be in charge of creating and managing a variety of technical documentation, including blogs, tutorials, videos, webinars, and workshops, to empower developers and bridge knowledge gaps, enhancing partners understanding and collaboration.
  • You will develop and execute strategies to educate and inspire developers about Dialect‚Äôs tools and features.
  • You will engage and build relationships with developers in blockchain and Web3 communities.
  • You will collaborate with the leadership team to maintain consistent messaging and brand alignment across all developer-focused initiatives.
  • You will align the team daily, weekly, and monthly on our vision and strategy as we explore this new product category. You will monitor and report on the effectiveness of community engagement initiatives, adjusting strategies as needed.

Requirements & Skills

  • You have 2+ of experience in Developer Relations or a similar role, ideally in the blockchain/web3 domain. Or: surprise us with something about you that makes you uniquely qualified for this role.
  • You have an ownership mindset. You take responsibility & you find solutions.
  • You possess a strong technical background with a solid understanding of blockchain technology and smart contract development.
  • You have experience creating technical content, including tutorials, blog posts, and videos.
  • Your communication and interpersonal skills are excellent, enabling you to engage effectively with a technical audience.
  • You thrive working independently in a dynamic, remote environment and can manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • You are passionate about blockchain technology and deeply committed to community building.
  • You are online. You understand that customer feedback comes through all kinds of channels, including X, Discord, and other community forums.
  • You are a commander of process, not its subject. We are a small, highly competent team, we move quickly, & we believe that every team must strive to create as little process as necessary, but no less.

job.title: Data Engineer
job.company_description: Connecting underserved communities to high quality care
job.description:
About Pair Team

Pair Team modernizes primary care with tech-enabled clinical support teams. Our software enables a geographically distributed care coordinator team to provide high-touch care to patients, helping them better understand their care plan, navigate the complex healthcare system, and achieve their health goals. Our solutions reduce healthcare costs, improve health outcomes, and empower patients to be active participants in their healthcare plans. Based in San Francisco and founded by experienced healthcare technologists and clinicians, Pair Team aims to empower both patients and clinicians to rethink healthcare access and navigation.

About the role

About Pair Team

Pair Team is on a mission to improve the wellbeing of underserved communities by connecting them to high-quality care.

Pair Team cares for the highest-need Medicaid recipients through a community-led model. We build local partnerships with shelters, food pantries, and other community-based organizations to turn them into a site of care. As a support system for the community, we provide wraparound clinical services, up-skill CBO staff to become Community Health Workers, and utilize our proprietary data-driven technology platform, Arc, for care coordination. Through Medicaid MCOs, we provide healthcare for hard-to-reach, high-need individuals, while sharing healthcare dollars with community groups to expand their social support programs.

Our Values

  • Lead with integrity:  We keep our commitments and take responsibility for our actions. We are dependable and choose authenticity over perfection.
  • Embrace challenges:  We leave our egos at the door and step forward into discomfort instead of back into safety. We help each other to learn and provide feedback using candor and kindness.
  • Break through walls:  We go the extra mile for our patients, partners and one another, and we run toward hard things. We are resilient in our push for consistent improvement and challenge the status quo.
  • Act beyond yourself:  We build each other up and respect boundaries. We seek first to understand and assume positive intent.
  • Care comes first:  We hold ourselves to the highest standards for our patients. We are relentless in the pursuit of our mission, and ensure that we are taking care of ourselves in order to care for others.

In the News

  • Forbes:  For Pair Team, Accessibility Is About Delivering Healthcare To Those Who Need It The Most
  • TechCrunch:  Building for Medicaid‚Äôs regulatory moment with Neil Batlivala from Pair Team
  • Axios:  Pair Team collects $9M for Medicaid-based care

About the Opportunity

We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer to own data engineering outcomes for our Tech team. We are a force multiplier, owning the data, analysis, and knowledge infrastructure that enables ourselves and our teammates to move faster and smarter. In this role you will have the ability to focus on the critical data problems at our company today, and play an instrumental part in impacting our future growth.

Your mission will be to empower decision making with data, maintain data integrity and security, enable scalability and agility. Your work includes ingesting data, building ETL pipelines and creating services and tools for others to use data more efficiently. You will work on developing and enhancing our data infrastructure, defining processes for data monitoring and alerting as well as maintaining data integrity in our data ecosystem. You will work with cross functional teams and internal stakeholders to define requirements and build solutions to meet the requirements. You will work with other engineers to ensure that our data platform and infrastructure are scalable and reliable.

This is a fully remote position.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Collaborate with product managers, data scientist, engineers, clinical leaders and operational leaders to define requirements and data specifications and translate them into technical solutions
  • Develop, deploy and maintain data processing pipelines, datasets, and other solutions to support operational and product outcomes
  • Define and manage overall schedule and availability for a variety of data sets
  • Work closely with other engineers to enhance infrastructure, improve reliability and efficiency
  • Make smart engineering and product decisions based on data analysis and collaboration
  • Act as in-house data expert and make recommendations regarding standards for code quality and timeliness
  • Architect cloud-based data infrastructure solutions to meet stakeholder needs
  • Develop support systems to scale the team and achievable outcomes

What You‚Äôll Need 

  • Strong desire to work in an early stage startup environment that is fast paced, complex, and has minimal barriers to make decisions (no ‚Äúred tape‚Äù)
  • You have 4+ years of professional experience working with data pipelines, products, and tools and have built and maintained complex data integrations or pipelines
  • Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment OR experience working in a data-centric healthcare role
  • An undergraduate degree in Engineering, Computer Science, another equivalent field or experience
  • Familiarity with statistical modeling and some/all of the following: regression analysis, clustering, and decision trees
  • A well-developed opinion on modern data infrastructure, tools, and patterns.
  • Excellent technical vision; you know the right architecture and patterns to build functional, durable, and maintainable product and able to make the right trade-offs when considering project scope
  • Experience with products that automate or streamline complex workflows
  • Ownership mindset ‚Äì own driving results for the mission, business, and customer experience through technical solutions
  • Strong collaboration skills with thought partners from engineering, design, product, operations, clinical and executive leadership
  • Clear and concise communication
  • Passion for helping individuals experiencing complex chronic needs such as homelessness, severe mental illness, and substance use disorder

Tech Stack
You should have experience with some of the following:

  • Experience with managing large Looker deployments or similar
  • Experience with cloud-based data warehouse: Snowflake
  • Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Golang, Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools like Airflow

Because We Value You

  • Competitive salary: $115,000 - $180,000 (depending on experience) 
  • Equity compensation package
  • Flexible vacation policy ‚Äì take the time you need to recharge
  • Comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance
  • $50 employer contribution to active HSA accounts
  • 401k through Guideline
  • Life insurance and AD&D
  • Work entirely from the comfort of your own home
  • Monthly $100 work from home expense stipend 
  • We provide the equipment needed for the role
  • Opportunity for rapid career progression with plenty of room for personal growth!

Pair Team is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At Pair Team, we value diversity and strive to provide an inclusive environment for all applicants and employees. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, marital status, age, disability, political affiliation, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic covered by federal, state, or local law. 

_Pair Team participates in E-Verify to verify employment eligibility for new hires. 

Any offer of employment at Pair Team is conditioned upon passing a pre-employment background check. Following a conditional job offer, candidates will undergo comprehensive employment background checks, including; criminal history, reference checks, and driving records if a role requires vehicle use._

Technology

Pair Team is changing the way medicine is practiced, by building out the technical infrastructure for medical operations and the largest geographically distributed team of remote nurses.

About the Opportunity

As Pair Team‚Äôs People Business Partner, you‚Äôll have the privilege and responsibility of supporting our Care Team employee experience while helping to lay additional foundations with Pair Team's People team. You‚Äôll be a champion of Pair Team culture, values, and strengthening a psychologically safe working environment.  Partnering with the EVP of Operations, Care Team leaders, and People Team, you‚Äôll advise the organization on best practices so that our employees continue to have fulfilling, engaging experiences working at Pair Team as they improve healthcare access and outcomes for underserved communities. Ultimately, you‚Äôll be nurturing and continuing to build People processes and systems that scale Pair Team‚Äôs culture as we rapidly grow.

This is a fully remote position that reports directly to the Senior Manager, People.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Have influence on shaping the culture of a fast-growing team
  • Manage and improve our employee relations and People processes so that Pair Team team members feel supported and valued by the organization
  • Partner with and coach Care Team managers as a support with performance management, retention, engagement and overall team success
  • Assist divisions in organizational design activities to streamline and implement new organization structures, roles, and/or processes that create speed & efficiency and support rapidly shifting business demands
  • Assist in the development and implementation of change management strategies to support the evolution of the business and achieve sustainable business results 
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable regulations, laws, and rules as a means of best practice

What You‚Äôll Need 

  • 4+ years as a People/HR BP, preferably with experience at fast-growing health-tech or health-adjacent companies
  • Team-player and able to flex as needed to support Care Team support and People Team initiatives
  • Passionate about supporting employees to do their best work 
  • Strong communicator and able to easily build trust and rapport with stakeholders
  • Mission-driven and passionate about helping marginalized communities
  • Experience gaining trust and building strong working relationships with diverse team members and organization leaders
  • Proven ability to use metrics-driven approaches to solve complex people problems
  • Strong program management skills, proven ability to design clear and efficient processes, and a very detail-oriented yet flexible approach to problem solving
  • Highly organized and self-motivated to work successfully in a remote environment

Because We Value You

  • Competitive salary: $100,000 - $120,000 (depending on experience) 
  • Equity compensation package
  • Flexible vacation policy ‚Äì take the time you need to recharge
  • Comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance
  • 401k
  • Work entirely from the comfort of your own home
  • Monthly $100 work from home expense stipend 
  • We provide the equipment needed for the role
  • Opportunity for rapid career progression with plenty of room for personal growth!

job.title: Senior Front End Engineer
job.company_description: All in one Company OS
job.description:
About Firstbase.io

Firstbase is building an all-in-one Company OS to help define how founders across the globe launch, manage and grow their businesses. More than ten thousand founders from over a hundred countries have used our product, Firstbase Start, to launch their startup. For many founders, "firstbase.io" has become what they type into their address bars when they think about incorporating a business.

About the role

About the role

Firstbase.io is hiring a Front-end Software Engineer to be an important member of our small and nimble product team. You will be expected to wear many hats and help make influential product decisions. You will write plenty of code, but also oversee software projects. You enjoy following good product development practices like reviewing, debugging, and testing code. You should obsess over delivering the best customer experience to a global market of founders, ensuring simplicity and clarity.

What's Firstbase.io?

Firstbase is building an all-in-one Company OS to help define how founders across the globe launch, manage and grow their businesses.

More than ten thousand founders from over a hundred countries have used our incorporation product, Firstbase Start, to launch their startup. For many founders, "firstbase.io" has become what they type into their address bars when they think about incorporating a business.

We are backed by Y Combinator & our team, investors, and advisors include people from Apple, Gusto, Carta, Wise, Plaid, and many other great companies.

Why you should join

Firstbase is much more than just incorporation. Our team is dedicated to building products & solving some of the startups‚Äô hardest problems, with a particular focus in:

  • Democratizing access to financial infrastructure

  • Automating tasks every founder faces when running a business

  • Making tools and resources more accessible to everyone, everywhere

  • Building integrated solutions for founders and removing friction

  • Delivering opportunities to traditionally overlooked founders and companies

  • Democratizing access to knowledge

Join us on a mission to help more companies succeed!

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for risk-takers with diverse experience able to provide fearless feedback.

You will have the following duties

  • Develop high-quality software design and architecture based on Vue

  • Identify, prioritize and execute tasks in the software development lifecycle

  • Develop tools and applications by producing clean and efficient code

  • Write, Test and Review code

  • Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to improve our products

  • Work with product and design to define, shape, and plan deliverables

  • Make technical decisions following best practices

  • Identify and solve problems that might affect our products or business

You should meet the following requirements

  • 5+ years of experience with front end development

  • 2+ years of experience in a similar role at a high-growth startup

  • Hard-working and dedicated team player that needs little to no supervision, but enjoys working a team toward a common goal

  • Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude

  • Self-motivated with an ability to work in the unknown

  • Ability to communicate technical topics to both technical and non-technical team members

  • Demonstrated collaboration with product managers, designers, other engineers to drive outcomes

  • Proficient in both oral and written English communication

Some perks you might enjoy

  • Competitive salary and equity: We lean on some of the best market data to ensure that we offer the most competitive compensation.

  • Hybrid work environment: We work both remotely & from our offices in New York City ‚Äì optimizing for collaboration while providing flexibility to team members.

  • 21 days of PTO + birthday off: We offer flexibility to allow people to relax and recharge whenever they need it.

  • Build your ideal work setup: We understand that how you work is extremely important, so we provide a stipend to set yourself up for success here at Firstbase.

  • Health benefits: Firstbase offers health insurance reimbursements to both US and international employees.

  • Learning and development: We provide a stipend together with resources to help people grow and develop in their careers.

  • Amazing annual bonus: Every team at Firstbase has a bonus structure that usually accounts for 10% of OTE.

The stack

Our product is built using PHP, Golang, Vue , MySQL, PostgreSQL, AWS. We also use Redis, Vue Router, Vuex, Docker Compose, Docker, GitLab CI, and Graylog, and some third-party API's like Stripe. We use Slack, Clubhouse, Notion, Whimsical, Figma , and G Suite to collaborate and build together.

If you think you're unqualified or don't meet all the requirements for this role, we encourage you to still apply. We celebrate diverse candidates, adjacent experiences, and simply put, good people who want to build great things. If that's you, then we'd love to meet.

Technology

Current back-end tech stack:

PHPLaravelPostgreSQLDocker (Compose and Swarm)GitLab CIAWS S3AWS EC2GreyLog

Current front-end tech stack:

Vue (and Vue-Router)Vuex3rd party libs for GTM/Stripe/etc.
