job.title: Solution Engineer - Post-Sales
job.company_description: Open Source Metering and Usage Based Billing
job.description:
About Lago

Lago is the open-source platform that helps engineers build better monetization systems. They enable software teams to build customizable and scalable usage metering, subscription management, billing, invoicing, and payment systems.

Lago is the leader of their category on Github (5k+ stars), won ¬´ Product of the month ¬ª on ProductHunt, and is used by leading companies such as Mistral, Together, Swan, Juni, Fintecture, JuliaHub, Regate, Flipside Crypto, Unifonic, Vida.id , Bureau.id, Sortium.

Lago‚Äôs founding team had previously built and scaled the home-grown monetization system of fintech unicorn Qonto from pre-launch to series D.

Our Values

  • Ambition: we aim big, because otherwise, where is the fun?
  • Progress: we care more about the grit, the steep learning curve, the resilience and creativity muscles, than the current status or where you come from.
  • Humble confidence: we know our strengths and always strive for excellence, but we also know there‚Äôs so much we don‚Äôt know yet
  • Pay it forward: we‚Äôve all started somewhere, people gave us a hand when we needed one, we don‚Äôt forget this, and reinforce this positive cycle
  • Not taking ourselves too seriously: we are ambitious, restless learners and hustlers, but at the end of the day, our health (physical and mental), and our loved ones are what matter the most.
About the role
Skills: Ruby

The team and your role

  • As part of our growth, we're hiring for someone to lead our post-sales customer experience, overseeing the implementation of our product, the day-to-day run, and the potential account expansion. Our customer base include software, fintech and infrastructure companies mainly based in Europe and the US, such as Mistral.ai, Together.ai, Swan.io.

  • This role is based either in-office in Paris in our gorgeous new office in the 10th arrondissement, and/or remote in a timezone that is +2/-2h from CET. Any application outside these criteria will unfortunately be automatically archived.

  • We're a team of 12 today and will be a team of 20 in the upcoming months, and we're all about Customer Experience, Product, and Open Source.

Your role includes:

  • Deeply understand the customer, their business objectives, their workflows, and their goals to demonstrate value as effectively as possible
  • Utilize deep technical expertise to drive and project manage customer implementations from end to end
  • Deliver excellent customer experience throughout the implementation project by providing consistent, clear communication across multiple stakeholders
  • Distinguish between ‚Äúmust-have‚Äù and ‚Äúnice-to-have‚Äù requirements and feedback from the customer throughout implementation
  • Make sense of ambiguous and/or complicated business requirements and translate them for a variety of audiences
  • Document the Implementation project plan for internal and external understanding. Define project milestones and meet them; clearly communicate dependencies and ownership (status updates to the various audiences, clear priorities set internally and externally)
  • Identify and mitigate project risks such as scope creep, stakeholder engagement, customer IT resourcing, internal backlogs; escalate appropriately to internal and/or customer executives
  • Build trust, understanding and influence with members of technical and operations teams who contribute to the implementation and then use our product
  • Leverage these "live" cases to build a repeatable playbook (e.g., learnings, frameworks, best practices) to support our growth

The person we are looking for

  • 3+ prior experience in Technical Project Management, Sales/Success/Solution Engineers, or other Customer-facing roles with Mid-Market or Enterprise business customers
  • A technical software engineering background by training
  • A passion for the preciseness required when scoping an implementation or migration, while thriving on leading negotiations: with strategic thinking, patience and emotional intelligence. Untangling complex and ambiguous cross functional projects will be the day to day job.
  • Comfortable holding others accountable to tasks and deadlines
  • Ownership mentality and initiative - if you see something needs to be done, go do it!

Enthusiastic about learning technicalities of domain-specific concepts such as billing, payments, integrations, even ingestions, open-source.

Competitive package including equity ; Remote-friendly ; Regular workations, usually by the ‚òÄÔ∏èüåäüèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

About the interview

  • 20-min first call
  • Technical case or pairing
  • Review of the case with the team
  • Offer

What we commit to:

  • Your time is precious, and we'll do our very best to be time-conscious with yours.
  • If you're open to it, we commit to give you the most constructive feedback as possible on your case, as we are aware it's quite an investment of time on your side.
  • We approach recruiting as a 2-way street, we make offers when we have a strong conviction on the mutual fit: in terms of skills, mindset, cultural fit.

Learn more how we think and work

  • Open-source does not win by being cheaper
  • Post-mortem of our 1st YC startup: a Reverse ETL
  • How soon should you have a design system?
  • How we ship fast: our framework
Technology
  • Back-end: Ruby, Postgres, AWS
  • Front-end: .js, React, GraphQL, Typescript

job.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
job.company_description: Vertical AI for Audit & Advisory Firms
job.description:
About Fieldguide

Fieldguide is a platform that powers the most complex compliance and financial audits performed by accounting and advisory firms. With Fieldguide, firms save thousands of hours per year, transforming the operations of their practices and modernizing the experience of their clients.

About the role

About us:

Fieldguide is establishing a new state of trust for global commerce and capital markets through automating and streamlining the work of assurance and audit practitioners specifically within cybersecurity, privacy, and ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance). Put simply, we build software for the people who enable trust between businesses. 

We‚Äôre based in San Francisco, CA, but built as a remote-first company that enables you to do your best work from anywhere. We're backed by top investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, 8VC, Floodgate, Y Combinator, DNX Ventures, Global Founders Capital, Justin Kan, Eric Ries, and more. 

We value diversity ‚Äî in backgrounds and in experiences. We need people from all backgrounds and walks of life to help build the future of audit and advisory. Fieldguide‚Äôs team is inclusive, driven, humble and supportive. We are deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of team and culture that we are building, seeking teammates that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth. 

As an early-stage start-up employee, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to build out the future of business trust. We make audit practitioners‚Äô lives easier by eliminating up to 50% of their work and giving them better work-life balance. If you share our values and enthusiasm for building a great culture and product, you will find a home at Fieldguide.

About the role:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Product Marketing Manager to join our fast-growing marketing team. This role will be pivotal in shaping our product messaging, enabling our sales team, and creating compelling content for our demand generation campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in B2B SaaS marketing and a proven track record of driving successful marketing initiatives.

What you'll do:

Product Positioning, Messaging & GTM:

  • Conduct market research to understand customer needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape.

  • Analyze data to inform product positioning and marketing strategies.

  • Develop clear and compelling product positioning, value propositions, and messaging that differentiates the product from competitors.

  • Create and maintain buyer personas to better understand target audiences.

  • Plan and execute go-to-market strategies for product launches.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product development, sales, and customer success).

Content Creation & Sales Enablement:

  • Equip the sales team with the tools and resources they need to effectively sell our products.
  • Develop sales tools and collateral (including, presentations, product demos, white papers, datasheets) to support the sales team.
  • Drive pricing and ROI strategy and enablement for the sales team.
  • Train sales teams on product features, benefits, and how to effectively sell the product.

Demand Generation:

  • Create and manage content for marketing campaigns and events, including whitepapers, ebooks, webinars, blog posts, and email campaigns.

  • Collaborate with the broader marketing team to develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns that drive lead generation and conversion.

  • Measure and analyze the effectiveness of content, making data-driven decisions to optimize performance.

  • Work with Customer Marketing and Customer Success to develop testimonials and case studies.

About you:

  • 5+ years of product marketing experience at leading B2B enterprise software organizations.
  • Proven track record of developing and executing successful product marketing strategies.
  • Storyteller with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficiency with Google Slides/PowerPoint for creating presentations and sales collateral.
  • A self-starter who is comfortable with both defining and executing product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

Bonus points if you have:

  • Industry knowledge of assurance and advisory services, preferably with exposure to financial audits, cybersecurity, or regulatory standards. 
  • Prior experience marketing to accounting or other professional services firms is preferred. 
  • Experience with HubSpot or other CRM platforms for managing marketing campaigns and analyzing performance.
  • Proficiency with video editing tools such as Camtasia, Descript, or Loom for creating engaging video content.

More about Fieldguide:

Fieldguide is a values-based company. Our values are:

  • Fearless - Inspire & break down seemingly impossible walls.
  • Fast - Launch fast with excellence, iterate to perfection.
  • Lovable - ‚Äã‚ÄãDeliver happiness & 11 star experiences. 
  • Owners - Execute & run the business with ownership.
  • Win-win - Create mutual value & earn trust for life. 
  • Inclusive - Scale the best ideas with inclusive teams. 

Some of our benefits include: 

  • Competitive compensation packages with meaningful ownership
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 401k
  • Wellness benefits, including a bundle of free therapy sessions
  • Technology & Work from Home reimbursement
  • Flexible work schedules
Technology

We're looking for early-stage engineers with experience in the following:

  • Complex web tech stacks consisting of several of the following: JavaScript/TypeScript, React, GraphQL, NodeJS, Hasura, Postgres, and AWS
  • Architecting large features and determining the best technologies for the job
  • Test and automation tools like Jest and Cypress
  • DevOps and continuous integration/delivery best practices
  • Information security best practices
  • Collaborating on all aspects of product strategy and UX
  • Working directly with customers and fixing bugs
  • Shaping a young tech stack, product, and engineering processes

We‚Äôre based in San Francisco, CA, but built as a remote-first company that enables you to do your best work from anywhere. This is an opportunity to be an early engineer at a young, fast growing startup, working directly with the company‚Äôs co-founders and early employees. We offer competitive compensation and perks.

We greatly value learning and invest in our team members. As we build the company together, we‚Äôll map your professional interests and goals to ensure you‚Äôre learning not only how to be a better engineer, but also growing towards your ideal role in the future.

Fieldguide is committed to building a diverse and inclusive company that celebrates individuals of all backgrounds. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants.

job.title: Software Engineer II
job.company_description: Scheduling and workforce management SaaS for home healthcare providers
job.description:
About Axle Health

Axle Health builds scheduling and workforce management software to empower in-home healthcare providers to deliver exceptional, personalized care right where patients feel most comfortable‚Äîat home.

Some of the biggest providers in the country use our software to improve the utilization of their field teams by 15%+, and automate the operational burden of scheduling and dispatching.

Our platform includes proprietary logistics algorithms to optimize scheduling, a mobile app for field staff, an operations dashboard for office teams, engagement and booking tools for patients, and a wide range of integrations and external APIs for modular access.

We‚Äôre a team of all-star engineers and operators, backed by $4m from top investors such as Y Combinator and Pear VC, applying our intellect and logistics experience to upend how home healthcare is delivered.

About the role
Skills: Django, Git, Node.js, Python, React, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Express, Microsoft Azure, React Native, TypeScript

About You

We're looking for an innovative Software Engineer II ‚Äî someone who wants to spend all day designing and implementing high leverage technical processes and systems. We value practical experience and a strong commitment to personal growth.

Our dream candidate can effortlessly adapt to different domains and is fueled by a passion for tackling complex problems head-on. Whether you've built your expertise designing scaled systems at large companies, or scaling startups from 0 to 100, we want to hear your story.

What You'll Do

  • Design advanced logistics algorithms and Electronic Health Record (EHR) integrations
  • Rearchitect technical systems to scale by 1000x and improve reliability from 99.9% to 99.99%
  • Empower customers to build API integrations with the Axle Heath ecosystem
  • Collaborate with internal teams and customers to gain insights and translate those insights into world class products
  • Evaluate and prioritize between tasks and projects based on their strategic value and potential impact

Requirements

Must have:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field
  • 2-5 years of experience in a SWE role (or equivalent)
  • Experience defining and communicating technical trade offs to non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience conducting code reviews yourself
  • Experience mentoring and/or managing junior engineers on the above skills
  • Expertise in an industry-standard programming language (preferably JS and Python)
  • Experience designing, building, deploying, and maintaining web services
  • Experience writing applications which interact with databases (Postgres, MySQL, NoSQL)
  • Expertise in a modern web framework (React, Angular, etc.)
  • Familiarity with CI/CD, DevOps, and Build Systems

Nice to have:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in CS or an equivalent technical field
  • Experience teaching yourself new skills and technologies
  • Experience working with Electronic Health Records (EHRs)
  • Experience with healthcare interoperability (FHIR)
  • Experience with our existing programming languages and tools

What We Offer

In addition to offering a competitive salary and best-in-class equity, we want to ensure every team member has the tools they need to work to the best of their ability. To that end:

We are committed to your Ownership:

  • We cultivate an environment where team members feel ownership over the work they do. Everyone in an organization has big ideas and we want to hear them and implement them
  • All of our employees have equity compensation. We want you to benefit from all the hard work you do in helping patients and catalyzing this shift in healthcare.

We are committed to your Wellness:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Unlimited PTO and sick days
  • Flexible working hours

We are committed to your Growth:

  • Fast paced work environment geared towards professional growth
  • Get the chance to move roles within the organization to learn new skills and contribute in other areas

We are committed to building Community:

  • Monthly team events, dinners, & happy hours
  • Special team events: yacht party, Universal Studios, Magic Castle, Vegas, etc.
Technology

Healthcare is complex, healthcare in the home even more so. Part of the reason in-home care isn't widespread is because it's not economical without a heavy technological component. Providing economical in-home care is a series of optimization problems. How do you assign visits to the lowest cost health professional qualified for a visit? How do you account for different license requirements across states? How do you ensure visits that require refrigerated supplies are completed earlier in the day? Solving this 3-dimensional tradeoff between time, geography, and licensure is what we do day-in and day-out.

job.title: Robotics Engineer, Wireless Networking
job.company_description: Semi-autonomous heavy construction equipment
job.description:
About Teleo

Teleo is a robotics startup disrupting a trillion-dollar industry. Teleo converts construction heavy equipment, like loaders, dozers, excavators, trucks, etc. into semi-autonomous robots. This lets one operator control multiple machines in parallel unlocking significant returns for the customer while materially enhancing the safety and comfort of the operator.

Teleo is founded by Vinay Shet and Rom Clement, experienced technology executives who led the development of Lyft‚Äôs Self Driving Car and Google Street View. Teleo is backed by YCombinator, Up Partners, F-Prime Capital, and a host of industry luminaries. Teleo‚Äôs product is already deployed on customer sites and generating revenue.

Teleo has recently raised $XX Million and is looking to grow rapidly. This is an opportunity to build a real customer-impact driven product, work on cool 100,000 Lbs autonomous robots, engineer complex systems at the intersection of hardware, software, AI, and get in on the ground floor of a hot startup.

About the role
Skills: C++

Teleo is a robotics startup disrupting a trillion-dollar industry. Teleo converts construction heavy equipment, like loaders, dozers, excavators, trucks, etc. into autonomous robots. This technology allows a single operator to efficiently control multiple machines simultaneously, delivering substantial benefits to our customers while significantly enhancing operator safety and comfort.

Teleo is founded by Vinay Shet and Rom Cl√©ment, experienced technology executives who led the development of Lyft‚Äôs Self Driving Car and Google Street View. Teleo is backed by YCombinator, Up Partners, F-Prime Capital, and a host of industry luminaries. Teleo‚Äôs product is already deployed on several continents and generating revenue. 

Teleo is poised for rapid growth. This presents a unique opportunity to be part of a team that is creating a product with a profound impact on our customers, working on cutting-edge 100,000-pound autonomous robots, engineering intricate systems at the intersection of hardware, software, and AI, and joining the early stages of an exciting startup journey.

About the role

As a Wireless Networking Robotics Engineer at Teleo, you will lead the development and deployment of state-of-the-art wireless communication technologies, ensuring Teleo‚Äôs heavy machinery fleet operates flawlessly in diverse environments and conditions. From rapid evaluation to rigorous production deployment in the field, your work will directly contribute to the success of Teleo‚Äôs Supervised Autonomy product.

You will collaborate closely with hardware and software teams within Teleo to integrate robust communication solutions, driving reliability and uptime to new heights. Additionally, you will work with domestic and international deployment teams to expand Teleo‚Äôs footprint and bring our groundbreaking solutions to new markets.

We are looking for a passionate and multidisciplinary professional who thrives on building reliable and reusable solutions. If you are eager to make a significant impact and be part of a team driving heavy machinery's future, we want to hear from you!

This role requires the ability to travel a minimum of 25% to construction sites at customer locations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop wireless communication solutions for robotics products, operating over larger job sites.
  • Work with embedded OSs for networking equipment, to better integrate with the Teleo Software stack.
  • Design and implement wireless mesh technologies and routing algorithms.
  • Enhance transmission reliability, using techniques such as bonding and link aggregation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate wireless solutions into products.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in developing wireless communication solutions for robotics products.
  • Hands-on experience with embedded OSs for networking equipment (OpenWRT, LEDE).Proficient in WiFi standards (802.11n/ac/ax/be and 802.11r/s/k/v).
  • Extensive experience in Linux kernel and kernel module development.
  • Strong knowledge of wireless mesh technologies and routing algorithms.
  • Expertise in techniques to improve transmission reliability, such as bonding.
  • Proficient in C and/or C++, as well as Python.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of wireless backhaul solutions.
  • Experience in indoor and outdoor site RF evaluation, simulation, and planning.
  • Experience deploying Private LTE/5G, CBRS, or 900MHz wireless solutions at large-scale sites.
  • Experience with Software-Defined Radio (SDR) platforms.
  • Experience obtaining FCC certification (or equivalent) for new radio products.
  • Knowledge of video streaming frameworks and solutions.
  • Experience with middleware frameworks such as ROS1 and ROS2.

Additional Skills

  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
Technology

Teleo has developed a Hardware + Software kit that can turn any heavy construction equipment (like excavator, dozer, mining trucks...) into an autonomous robot.

job.title: Vehicle Systems Integration, Embedded Firmware
job.company_description: Semi-autonomous heavy construction equipment
job.description:
About Teleo

Teleo is a robotics startup disrupting a trillion-dollar industry. Teleo converts construction heavy equipment, like loaders, dozers, excavators, trucks, etc. into semi-autonomous robots. This lets one operator control multiple machines in parallel unlocking significant returns for the customer while materially enhancing the safety and comfort of the operator.

About the role
Skills: C, C++, Rust

Teleo is a robotics startup disrupting a trillion-dollar industry. Teleo converts construction heavy equipment, like loaders, dozers, excavators, trucks, etc. into autonomous robots. This technology allows a single operator to efficiently control multiple machines simultaneously, delivering substantial benefits to our customers while significantly enhancing operator safety and comfort.

Teleo is poised for rapid growth. This presents a unique opportunity to be part of a team that is creating a product with a profound impact on our customers, working on cutting-edge 100,000-pound autonomous robots, engineering intricate systems at the intersection of hardware, software, and AI, and joining the early stages of an exciting startup journey.

About the Role

As a Vehicle Systems Integration Engineer specializing in Embedded Firmware, you will be instrumental in the development, integration, and validation of onboard firmware enabling the conversation of any piece of equipment into a drive-by-wire vehicle. Your primary objective will be to achieve rapid and universal conversion across all types, brands, and vintages of construction equipment.

Interacting daily with the hardware, deployment, and software teams, the best candidate for this role will have a multidisciplinary approach with a clear passion for implementing highly scaleable code bases.

Because we are hands-on and end-to-end testing matters, this role requires the ability to travel up to 25% to construction sites at customer locations.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or relevant degree with 3+ years of experience developing low-level embedded software C/C++ on microcontrollers (NXP, Ti, STM, ESP...)
  • Experience with protocols such as CAN, I2C, Ethernet, SPI, PWM 
  • Experience developing firmware on RTOS
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting complex systems at remote isolated locations and, proposing solutions
  • Acute attention to engineering details with a safety-first mindset

Preferred Qualification/Bonus Points

  • MS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or a related field with 5+ years of hands-on experience developing, qualifying, and deploying safety-critical embedded systems for automotive or space or similar applications using specific RTOSProven experience in managing independently (as an individual contributor and/or technical lead) the development, verification, and validation of an electronics product
  • Well-versed in C/C++/Rust for embedded safety-critical applications on Safety Critical OS
  • Well-versed in safety protocol (CanOpen or similar)
  • Startup experience (hands-on + creative thinker with a Get It Done attitude)
  • Experience designing HIL (Hardware In the Loop) test benches and production line procedures
  • Experience in engineering universal solutions broadly and rapidly deployable to multiple platforms and use cases
  • Experience interacting with customers and representing the company

Work Environment & Physical Demands

Performance of the position requires working safely and may occasionally require climbing up to elevated surfaces, working outdoors in a variety of weather conditions, noise levels, and on a range of outdoor work surfaces. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus in addition, the position may require frequent movement and activity relating to using keyboards, viewing data on computer displays, and communicating verbally and in writing. 

You may be required to occasionally stand for extended periods, operate tools and controls, and occasionally lift and move up to 50 lbs

Technology

Teleo has developed a Hardware + Software kit that can turn any heavy construction equipment (like excavator, dozer, mining trucks...) into an autonomous robot.

job.location: San Francisco, CA, US / San Mateo, CA, US / Remote (US; CA; MX)
job.title: Founding Software Engineer - Backend
job.company_description: Open-source, dev-friendly observability.
job.description:
About HyperDX

HyperDX helps engineers figure out why production is broken faster by centralizing and correlating logs, metrics, traces, exceptions and session replays in one place. We're building the open source and developer friendly alternative to tools like Datadog and New Relic.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, Kubernetes, Node.js, TypeScript, SQL, Distributed Systems, Docker, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Hi there! We‚Äôre building an open source platform for engineers to monitor, debug, and scale their production applications. What this looks like is we help developers collect and ingest terabytes of telemetry from their application (ex. logs, metrics, traces, session replays) and give them the tools to easily monitor their application/infra health and search through all that data to get to the root cause of what‚Äôs gone wrong.

If you‚Äôve ever been on call and been frustrated at 2am over why your Grafana/Datadog/New Relic/Elastic/etc. isn‚Äôt giving you straightforward answers to what‚Äôs gone wrong - you know exactly the problem we‚Äôre solving for.

We‚Äôre incredibly early in our journey, but already captured a huge amount of interest from the wider developer community, from reaching 6k Github stars, deployed by enterprises such as ARM, to thousands of teams on HyperDX cloud.

We‚Äôre hiring for a founding engineer who is excited to build with us a PB-scale high performance observability streaming & analytics with a focus on crafting an amazing developer experience on top (the DX in HyperDX).

The Role

  • You'll be hands-on building out any and all parts of the product (broadly focused on the backend), with a focus on building the best developer experience possible to bring an engineer from incident or bug, to root cause and resolution.
  • You'll be directly engaging our amazing community of customers, open source contributors, and users (who are all engineers) - closely listening to their feedback and actioning on them quickly or giving them a hand when they get stuck. Most of them live directly in our Slack or Discord community.
  • You'll be solving hard technical problems, from building durable SDKs for a variety of languages/platforms (from Node, Deno, RoR, Java, etc.) to helping effectively scale out our ingestion pipeline and Clickhouse cluster.

About You

  • You love to move quickly and ship often to solve real customer-impacting problems.
  • You embrace ambiguity - you love to take big ideas and execute on them independently, but can collaborate with the team and customers when needed.
  • 3+ years of experience as an engineer, bonus points for experience building developer tools.
  • Strong proficiency in Typescript for both our Next.js frontend and Express backend.
  • Proficient in SQL to do query generation for our Clickhouse DB.
  • Comfortable with Docker/containers and familiar with Kubernetes or other container orchestration platforms.
  • You love building alongside an open source community.
  • You love learning new technology and approaches, and love to push the boundaries of what you know.

Bonus Points

  • Deep experience with distributed systems, particularly scaling high-volume event ingestion pipelines and columnar data stores (ex. Clickhouse, Druid).
  • Opinionated in observability tooling today - and know where they can get 10x better.
  • Curious about other languages and platforms, to help build/maintain our next iteration of integrations for anything from Rust to PHP.

About Us

It's currently just us the founders (Michael and Warren) - we're both deeply technical with a passion for building great developer tools on top of solid and scalable infrastructure.

We plan to continue scaling up the team to meet the incredible amount of customer demand we've had - and are well capitalized with many years of runway as part of that. On the technical end, you can learn more about our setup here in our contributing docs. In production we're running on AWS and Kubernetes.

We think there's an incredibly rewarding experience ahead in re-thinking how developers are empowered when they're tasked with their next bug ticket or paged for their next incident. If you've read this far, drop us a note about the most memorable incident you were part of!

Technology

StackApp: Typescript, AWS, Kubernetes, Next/React, Node, Express, Clickhouse, OpenTelemetry, Vector, PythonMaintained Integrations: Typescript, Python, Ruby, Deno, and Go (many more to come)

Get an overview and take our stack for a spin here via our contributing.md

Technical ChallengesHyperDX needs to stay up when our customers are down, massively scale when our customers scale, and trawl through TBs of data in seconds. On top of all this, we need to build a world-class developer experience so developers can actually make sense of the telemetry they're sending our way.

job.title: Software Engineer
job.company_description: Glimpse fights invalid fees for CPG brands in retail using AI
job.description:
About Glimpse

Glimpse helps retail-first CPG brands automate their cash reconciliation process and fight invalid fees from retailers and distributors using AI.

Previously, the Glimpse founders built the first Airbnb product placement network for brands. We worked with 10,000+ properties & dozens of brands.

We‚Äôve raised $6.2M from leading investors like Y Combinator, GSR Ventures, Origin Ventures & an incredible group of angels from companies like Instagram, Instacart, Google, and more.

About the role
Skills: Kubernetes, MongoDB, Node.js, Python, React, Google Cloud, Docker, PostgreSQL

ABOUT US

Glimpse helps retail-first CPG brands automate their cash reconciliation process and fight invalid fees from retailers and distributors using AI. Imagine a beverage company sold $100k worth of goods to Whole Foods but only got paid $60k. The deducted $40k comes in hundreds of long PDFs with obscure codes that a team has to manually review to ensure the fees are valid. Almost always a percentage of these fees are invalid, and brands have to go through a lengthy process to reclaim the money owed. We automate this entire process, saving brands dozens of hours a week and recouping lost revenue. Since launching earlier this year, we‚Äôre already working with 20+ leading brands and growing rapidly.

We‚Äôve raised $6.2M from leading investors like Y Combinator, GSR Ventures, Origin Ventures & an incredible group of angels from companies like Instagram, Instacart, Google, and more.

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and driven full-stack engineer with 2+ years of experience to join our dynamic team. This role requires a highly skilled individual comfortable with rapid development cycles and end-to-end project ownership, working closely with the CTO.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain end-to-end front-end and back-end applications.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features.
  • Push complete projects into production from start to finish.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to best practices.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

  • Minimum 2 years in full-stack development.
  • Exceptional coding skills and ability to ship code quickly.
  • Proficient in React, Python, JavaScript, Docker, and GCP.
  • Experience building with LLMs.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented attitude.
  • Ability to work from our NY office full-time.

Technologies:

  • JavaScript, Node.js, React, TypeScript, Python
  • BigQuery, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
  • GCP
  • Docker, Kubernetes

Why Work With Us

  • Be an early team member at a fast-growth YC startup with a high level of ownership.
  • Work directly with the founders - we‚Äôve previously built a business together.
  • Be part of a fast-paced team that works together in person in NYC.
  • Solve a real problem that impacts the bottom line of your favorite brands in retail.

Location:

  • New York, NY (Relocation Assistance Available)

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Relocation assistance to NYC
  • Comprehensive medical, vision and dental insurance plans offered
  • 401k plan offered
  • Unlimited PTO

job.title: Finance & Operations Director
job.company_description: The first prediction market for sports
job.description:
About Novig

At Novig, we are building the first high-frequency, commission-free sports trading platform in the US ‚Äî essentially the NASDAQ of betting.

We guarantee bettors the best odds and eliminates the need for traditional sportsbooks. We do this by enabling users to bet directly against friends or the market, rather than against the house, making the betting experience more efficient, fair, and, most importantly, profitable.

Novig‚Äôs founders, Jacob and Kelechi, are recent Harvard grads with experience at Jane St & BoA who started Novig with the believe that a commission-free P2P exchange model will replace the exploitative and unprofitable betting model of traditional sportsbooks. They themselves were sophisticated sports bettors who grew increasingly frustrated by the latency, discriminatory practices, monotony, and non-profitability of the retail sportsbook betting experience.

As the regulatory landscape evolves in the United States, Novig is positioned to become a leading innovator in sports betting with our unique focus on research and technology.

About the role

*****Candidates must apply directly through link to be considered: **https://boards.greenhouse.io/novig/jobs/4384650006

Finance & Operations Manager/Director

$110k ‚Äì $140k ‚Ä¢ 0.15% ‚Äì 0.30%

Summary:

  • The first peer-to-peer sports prediction market, recently closed a $6m seed round from YC, Lux, Soma, Paul Graham, Joe Montana, Innospark, the founders of Instacart and Dropbox, and many other top angels and funds
  • Looking for a Finance & Operations Manager or Director to report to work out of our NY office (4 days/week on-site)
  • Salaries at the top of benchmarks, with significant equity ownership and generous benefits
  • Founders are recent Harvard grads with quant experience at Jane Street and BoA and years of experience as sharp sports bettors
  • $300B annually bet on sports in the US and the size of the market is rapidly growing, particularly given the opportunity for operators to capitalize on the sweepstakes business model
  • Currently the only way to bet is with retail sportsbooks which have egregious margins, discriminatory and inefficient practices, and a stale betting experience
  • Novig is a sports prediction market that guarantees users the best lines by allowing them to play directly against friends or the market, rather than against the house, making the wagering experience more efficient , fair , and, most importantly, profitable

What will you do?

As a Finance/Operations Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing financial and operational activities to support Novig‚Äôs growth and success. With Novig being a startup, you will wear many hats:

  • Payment Operations : Manage and oversee the payment operations of our platform.
  • Accounting/FP&A : Manage financial planning and analysis, including ensuring accurate financial reporting.
  • Modeling and Projections : Develop financial models and projections for investors to support fundraising and strategic planning.
  • Promotion Management : Work closely with the marketing team to develop and implement promotional strategies.
  • Customer Support : Provide proactive and reactive customer support to ensure a positive user experience.
  • Data Analytics : Utilize data analytics to inform business decisions and optimize operational efficiency.

What are we looking for?

We value candidates with expressed interest in sports and markets, who have demonstrated excellence in financial and operational roles. You are someone who is passionate about optimizing business processes and driving strategic financial decisions:

Requirements:

  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years in finance or operations roles, preferably in investment banking, management consulting, or tech startups.
  • Skills: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and data analysis.
  • Attributes: A strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a passion for operational excellence. Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Who is Novig?

At Novig, we have reimagined the sports betting landscape by building a sweepstakes-based sports prediction market. Our innovative platform allows users to engage in sports predictions without traditional gambling constraints. By leveraging the sweepstakes model, we ensure compliance with regulatory requirements while providing a unique, engaging, and profitable experience for our users. Our goal is to make sports prediction more accessible, fair, and enjoyable.

Novig‚Äôs founders, Jacob and Kelechi, are recent Harvard grads with experience at Jane St & BoA who started Novig with the belief that a commission-free P2P exchange model will replace the exploitative and unprofitable betting model of traditional sportsbooks. They themselves were sophisticated sports bettors who grew increasingly frustrated by the latency, discriminatory practices, monotony, and non-profitability of the retail sports betting experience.

As the regulatory landscape evolves in the United States, Novig is positioned to become a leading innovator with our unique focus on research and technology.

How does Novig approach compensation?

We are big believers in providing excellent compensation to everyone on the team as we build.

  • We offer salaries at the top of the benchmarks you‚Äôd find for senior roles at big name companies
  • We provide equity to all employees regardless of role. We are looking for people who can grow with us as we scale our team and product, and we think it‚Äôs important for all employees, especially our first few teammates, to have significant equity in the company so you have skin in the game and our incentives are aligned.

What benefits does Novig offer?

We are embarking on an ambitious journey and are committed to providing generous benefits, even at this early stage.

  • Robust health, dental, and vision plans, covering 100% of health premiums and 90% of dental and vision premiums
  • Generous 401(k) plan, matching up to 4% of base salary
  • Health Savings Account (HSA) with $1,080 annual company contributions
  • $24/day food or commuter stipend when working in our new office
  • Access to Gympass for fitness benefits

*****Candidates must apply directly through link to be considered: **https://boards.greenhouse.io/novig/jobs/4384650006

Technology

We're building the first high-frequency trading platform for sports betting.

Stack: mobile app in React Native; backend exchange and trading components in Java; database layer in PostgreSQL, Mongo, S3.

We‚Äôre a nimble team of researchers, engineers, statisticians, and other flavors of nerd who want to tackle some of the most challenging open-ended problems at the intersection of sports, game theory, and technology.

If you enjoy solving hard interdisciplinary problems, then you‚Äôll enjoy working at Novig.

Proof: People who work at Novig solve hard interdisciplinary problems. ‚ñ°

  • Novig is a sports betting exchange that guarantees users the best lines by allowing them to bet directly against friends or the market, rather than against the house, making the betting experience more efficient, fair, and, most importantly, profitable

What will you do?

We‚Äôre on the search for individuals passionate about social media content creation to join our team to produce, shoot, and edit entertaining short-form video content for @novig_app on TikTok, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube. If you‚Äôre obsessed with creating content that is equal parts entertaining, addictive, and on-brand, then we want to hear from you! Must be habitually online and have impeccable awareness of internet trends, with a knack for storytelling.

We‚Äôre offering a pay-per-video structure. The more videos you create, the more you‚Äôll earn. Here‚Äôs the best part: when your videos get noticed, you‚Äôll receive a bonus based on performance. 

This is a fully remote position. As long as you have internet connectivity, we don‚Äôt mind where you are.

What are we looking for?

  • Storyteller passionate about sports and social media 
  • Awareness of internet trends and pop culture 
  • Interest in sports betting and finance
  • Experience with editing videos
  • Detail-oriented 
  • Strong leadership, problem-solving and communication skills

What is Novig?

At Novig, we are building the first peer-to-peer, commission-free sports betting platform in the US ‚Äî essentially the NASDAQ of betting.

We guarantee bettors the best odds and eliminate the need for traditional sportsbooks. We do this by enabling users to bet directly against friends or the market, rather than against the house, making the betting experience more efficient, fair, and, most importantly, profitable.

Novig‚Äôs founders, Jacob and Kelechi, are recent Harvard grads with experience at Jane St & BoA who started Novig with the belief that a commission-free P2P exchange model will replace the exploitative and unprofitable betting model of traditional sportsbooks. They themselves were sophisticated sports bettors who grew increasingly frustrated by the latency, discriminatory practices, monotony, and non-profitability of the retail sports betting experience.

As the regulatory landscape evolves in the United States, Novig is positioned to become a leading innovator in sports betting with our unique focus on research and technology.

 

Technology

We're building the first high-frequency trading platform for sports betting.

Stack: mobile app in React Native; backend exchange and trading components in Java; database layer in PostgreSQL, Mongo, S3.

We‚Äôre a nimble team of researchers, engineers, statisticians, and other flavors of nerd who want to tackle some of the most challenging open-ended problems at the intersection of sports, game theory, and technology.

If you enjoy solving hard interdisciplinary problems, then you‚Äôll enjoy working at Novig.

Proof: People who work at Novig solve hard interdisciplinary problems. ‚ñ°

job.title: Founding Engineer
job.company_description: Software that streams data from databases to warehouses in real-time
job.description:
About Artie

We are building Artie, a real-time data streaming solution focused on databases and data warehouses. Typical ETL solutions leverage batched processes or schedulers (DAGs, Airflow), which cannot achieve real time data syncs. We leverage change data capture (CDC) and stream processing to perform data transfers in a more efficient way, which enables sub-minute latency.

About the role
Skills: Go, React, TypeScript, Kafka

We are a small team based in San Francisco looking to hire our third founding engineer!

As a founding engineer, you will have the opportunity to wear multiple hats, directly interact with our customers and play a critical role in shaping the future of our product. 

This is a challenging and dynamic role, and you will be working at the forefront of distributed systems, infrastructure and data engineering.

What you should expect & examples of day-to-day tasks:

  • New functionality to our customer dashboard such as column exclusion, launching our analytics portal, schema change alerts
  • Talking with customers to understand core pain points and working with them on feature requests
  • Implementing a new database type as a source and/or destination
  • Spinning up a new data plane in a new AWS or GCP region with tools like Terraform and Helm

About us

Artie is a real-time database replication solution for databases and data warehouses. To do this, we leverage Kafka and change data capture. We're growing fast - we launched our cloud product a year ago and are now processing billions of rows per month.

We're backed by Exponent Founders Capital, General Catalyst and other world class angels like Benn Stancil (Mode), Lenny Rachitsky (Lenny‚Äôs Newsletter), and Arash Ferdowsi (Dropbox).

What we are looking for

  • Strong fundamentals in computer science or related
  • Pragmatic and care more about building the right thing vs. being right
  • Comfortable jumping around the stack and wearing different hats
  • Someone that wants to take an active role in defining the next gen data platform that utilizes stream processing and CDC to drive data latency to zero, while also focusing on ease-of-use and extensibility
  • Past experience working on scaling asynchronous systems and exposure to topics like gRPC, Kafka and Kubernetes is preferred but not required!
  • Proficiency writing in Go is preferred, but not necessary

Tech Stack

  • Frontend: TypeScript (React and Material UI)
  • Backend: Go, PostgreSQL, Redis and Kafka
  • Infra: Terraform, Kubernetes, and Helm on GCP and AWS
Technology

Frontend

  • Our marketing site is written with Next.js and Tailwind.
  • Customer dashboard is written with React, Material UI and Typescript.

Backend

Our open-sourced service, Artie Transfer and our backends are all written in Go.

Infrastructure

  • Kafka
  • Kubernetes w/ Helm
  • Terraform

job.title: Founding Applied AI Engineer
job.company_description: AI Servicing for Auto Lenders
job.description:
About Salient

Salient is an AI workflow automation tool for lenders. We're working with the largest auto lenders in America and are hiring!

About the role
Skills: Machine Learning

Founding Front End Engineer at Salient

About Us

Salient is a pioneering AI platform tailored for the largest auto lenders in the United States. Our technology empowers financial institutions to autonomously conduct over 100,000 calls daily, facilitating payment collections, fraud detection, dispute resolution, and the automation of critical enterprise workflows.

Harnessing the power of more than 10 proprietary in-house Large Language Models (LLMs) and speech diffusion models, Salient delivers low-latency, humanlike interactions that strictly adhere to regulations set forth by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

Joining Salient means collaborating with a highly skilled founding team hailing from Carnegie Mellon and Columbia, boasting a decade's worth of experience at leading companies such as Tesla, Airtable, Goldman Sachs, and Dropbox. Backed by our industry expertise and early successes, we've secured a $4M seed investment from Y Combinator, Matrix Partners, and General Catalyst, alongside executive backers from Tesla, Stripe, Brex, and more.

With seven-figure revenue, profitable cash flow, and a growing list of clients eager to onboard, Salient is poised for rapid expansion.

About the Role

Salient is actively seeking a Founding Applied AI Engineer with a specialization in Large Language Models (LLMs) to join our engineering team. This is an unparalleled opportunity to impact our company culture, drive innovation in AI-powered products, and make a significant contribution to our technological direction.

You Will:

- Develop and refine cutting-edge AI products with a focus on Large Language Models, enhancing the financial sector's capabilities.

- Partner closely with the founding team and clients to steer the strategic direction of our LLM initiatives.

- Display adaptability and a willingness to take on multi-faceted challenges in a fast-paced startup environment.

Minimum Requirements

- Deep understanding of and practical experience with Large Language Models such as GPT-3, BERT, or similar frameworks.

- Proven track record of implementing LLMs in real-world applications, particularly in natural language understanding, generation, and conversational AI.

- Expertise in Python and familiarity with AI/ML libraries and tools.

- Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.

- Proficiency with version control systems, notably Git.

- 2+ years of relevant work experience in a high-velocity tech or financial services environment.

- Passionate about AI with a keen interest in staying abreast of the latest LLM developments and trends.

- Strong communication skills for effective collaboration and the ability to convey complex AI concepts to diverse audiences.

Technology

python + LLM stack + transformer based voice models

job.title: Sr. Community Association (HOA) Manager
job.company_description: Tech-enabled HOA management
job.description:
About Assembly HOA

Assembly HOA Management is a modern homeowner association management firm with a presence across California. Our vision is to provide exceptional service to our homeowners by utilizing state-of-the-art software that automates administrative tasks, promotes transparent communication, and offers convenient online access to important information. Our innovative approach to HOA management is efficient and convenient for both our employees and clients.

About the role

We are seeking a Senior Community Association Manager, a role akin to a special forces operator in the HOA management world. This is not just a job; it‚Äôs a commitment to excellence and a chance to be part of a dynamic, highly skilled team. You will be working alongside colleagues who will never let you down, in an environment that demands the best and gives back in equal measure.

Key Responsibilities:

-Oversee the day-to-day operations of multiple HOA communities.

-Implement and manage effective strategies for community engagement and property management.

-Ensure compliance with Davis-Stirling Act and other relevant regulations.

-Handle budget preparation, financial management, and report generation.

-Mediate and resolve conflicts with diplomacy and tact.

-Lead, motivate, and support community board members and residents.

-Maintain high standards of customer service and community relations.

Qualifications:

-Minimum 3 years of full-time experience in HOA management.

-In-depth understanding of the Davis-Stirling Act.

-Strong skills in communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution.

-Ability to work effectively under pressure and prioritize tasks.

-Proficiency in project management and organizational skills.

-Competence in Microsoft Office or Google Suite.

-Experience in budget preparation and financial management.

-Capability to interpret legal documents and agreements.

-Exceptional customer service and leadership abilities.

-CMCA, AMS, or PCAM designation is highly desirable.

Why Assembly HOA?

Joining Assembly HOA means being part of a mission to transform an industry. The role is challenging but immensely rewarding, offering an opportunity to make a real difference. We promise a journey of growth, support, and unparalleled teamwork. If you are ready to be part of our team, we welcome you to apply.

Benefits at Assembly HOA:

We deeply value our team and we understand that our employees are the cornerstone of our success.

  • Top-Shelf Health Coverage: We offer premium medical, dental, and vision plans. Our health benefits are designed to ensure that you and your family have access to the best care available, without the stress of high costs.
  • Equity in the Company: Believing in our mission means being part of our success. We offer meaningful equity to our employees as a testament to our belief that every team member contributes to, and should benefit from, the growth and success of our company.
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: We understand the importance of work-life balance. Our flexible work policies are designed to accommodate the diverse needs of our team members.
  • Generous Paid Time Off: We provide ample paid time off, including vacation days, sick days, and holidays, to ensure that you have the time you need to rest, rejuvenate, and spend time with loved ones.

....and much more!

At Assembly HOA, we‚Äôre not just offering a job; we‚Äôre inviting you to be part of a family that looks out for each other. Our benefits package is a reflection of our commitment to the well-being and success of every member of our team.

Technology

We use the latest in AI and fintech to provide end-to-end financial automation & strategic community planning.
