job.title: Founding Mobile iOS SDK Engineer (Onsite - SF)
job.company_description: API for IoT Devices
job.description:
About Seam

Seam is an API for controlling a wide range of IoT devices.

Today we primarily focus on door lock and access systems. Our customers span industries, such as hospitality, real-estate, networking equipment, or even last-mile delivery, and range in size from startups-in-garage to public companies.

Across the board, their goal is the same: use code to control hardware devices, and orchestrate the physical world.

Our team is made of alums from Nest, Sonder, Stanford, Apple, Latch, Berkeley, YC, and more. We shipped millions of IoT devices and built dev tools used by every developer on earth. We are advised by the amazing Bunnie Huang and backed by Tiger Global, Root VC, founders and execs at Stripe, Plaid, and Airbnb, and other amazing angels and funds.

About You

We generally seek "sharp minds with kind souls." We prefer generalists over specialists; we move quickly, with purpose; we enjoy working with each other and aim to be the best.

About the role

Who we are

About Seam

Seam is building a platform for software developers to connect and manage smart devices in buildings, like locks, thermostats, and intercoms. It provides a way for software applications, like Airbnb, Zillow, and WeWork, to easily interact with and control these devices across various brands and technologies, streamlining the process of building and scaling smart home and building applications.

Seam is backed by Tiger Global, Root VC, founders and execs at Stripe, Plaid, and Airbnb, and other amazing angels and funds. üöÄ

About the team

The Seam Mobile SDK allows developers to build mobile applications that communicate with smart devices via Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and NFC. Our goal is to develop SDKs in various languages including Swift, Objective C, Kotlin, and Java. We also aim to create a code generation framework to produce SDKs and documentation snippets.

Seam was founded to make it easier for developers to automate the physical world. We are dedicated to providing a world class experience for developers using our API and SDKs. While we‚Äôve solved a small part of that problem, our ambition is to go much further.

What you‚Äôll do

We are seeking an experienced Mobile Developer skilled in iOS development. You should have a background in Mobile SDK development and BLE technology, and be comfortable with our Node.js, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL stack.

As the first dedicated iOS mobile developer at our company, you will play a key role in designing our Mobile SDKs and mentoring our engineers in mobile development. You will work closely with our engineering team to improve developer productivity, streamline build processes, and enhance the overall developer experience.

We play with a lot of hardware and spend a lot of time thinking about developer UX. We like written communications. We prefer to keep things simple and don't overthink first implementations. You should generally be curious, comfortable with the unknown / experimentation, and be able to move fast.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain iOS SDKs that interact with BLE and NFC.
  • Enable IoT mobile applications across various mobile devices.
  • Contribute to the development and optimization of the Seam API, working with Node.js, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL.
  • Collaborate closely with our engineers, product managers, and designers to define requirements and deliver end-to-end solutions that meet business needs.
  • Lead testing initiatives to maintain high code quality and reliability.
  • Develop resources such as documentation and tutorials to support developers.

Who you are

Qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience in Mobile Development.
  • Expertise in iOS app development using Swift.
  • Proficient in Node.js, TypeScript, and SQL.
  • Skilled in Mobile SDK development, building pipelines, and CI/CD processes.
  • Proficient in backend testing methods and tools (unit tests, integration tests, API testing).
  • Track record of enhancing development processes and productivity.
  • Ability to work in-office at least 50% of the time in San Francisco.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with BLE and NFC technologies on iOS or Android.
  • Background in growth-stage and larger companies.
  • Interest or experience in IoT, hardware integration, or similar areas.
Technology

Typescript.

  • react/nextjs, and some Python & Ruby here and there.
  • postgres
  • running on Vercel with some workers on Fly.io.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer (Onsite - SF)
job.company_description: API for IoT Devices
job.description:
About Seam

Seam is an API for controlling a wide range of IoT devices.

Today we primarily focus on door lock and access systems. Our customers span industries, such as hospitality, real-estate, networking equipment, or even last-mile delivery, and range in size from startups-in-garage to public companies.

Across the board, their goal is the same: use code to control hardware devices, and orchestrate the physical world.

Our team is made of alums from Nest, Sonder, Stanford, Apple, Latch, Berkeley, YC, and more. We shipped millions of IoT devices and built dev tools used by every developer on earth. We are advised by the amazing Bunnie Huang and backed by Tiger Global, Root VC, founders and execs at Stripe, Plaid, and Airbnb, and other amazing angels and funds.

About You

We generally seek "sharp minds with kind souls." We prefer generalists over specialists; we move quickly, with purpose; we enjoy working with each other and aim to be the best.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, Node.js, React, TypeScript, Internet of Things (IoT), PostgreSQL

We are looking for software engineers, preferably proficient in TypeScript. We prefer people who are comfortable in a full-stack role and have superhero strengths in building scalable backends. We play with a lot of hardware and spend a lot of time thinking about developer UX. We like written communications. We prefer to keep things simple and don't overthink first implementations. You should generally be curious, comfortable with the unknown, love experimentation, and be able to move fast.

Below is a quick description of some of our projects.

Backend API

Our high-level goal is to build a device/manufacturer agnostic integration layer that connects to various devices and exposes their functionality through a simple API. This task involves integrating dozens of different IoT brands and their protocols (Z-Wave, Zigbee, BACnet, OEM API...etc) and neatly organizing them amongst common functionality. We spend a lot of time building this part of our stack.

Client Libraries & APIs

Our customers tend to be quite technical and some of them even contribute code to our SDKs. In general, we spend a lot of time creating tools and client libraries to make interfacing their applications with devices easier. We strive to standardize device functions across brands and hide all the nasty complexity away. For example, below is an example from our TypeScript library:

import Seam from "seamapi";// Seam will automatically use the SEAM_API_KEY environment variable if you// don't provide an apiKey to `new Seam()`const seam = new Seam();const {  devices: [someLock] } = await seam.locks.list();  // If the lock is opened, lock it, else unlock it. Code works irrespective of the brand. if (someLock.properties.locked) {  await seam.locks.unlockDoor(someLock.device_id);} else {  await seam.locks.lockDoor(someLock.device_id);}

You can read more about how we strive to standardize device functions across brands here. Alternatively, you can also play with our client libraries below:

  • Javascript/TypeScript ‚Üí npm install seamapi
  • Python ‚Üí pip install seamapi
  • Ruby ‚Üí gem install seamapi

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of full-stack development experience with expertise in TypeScript.
  • Strong in SQL, particularly with PostgreSQL, including schema design, query optimization, and performance tuning.
  • Familiarity with SRE principles, including incident management, monitoring, and system reliability.
  • Experience in designing and maintaining scalable backend APIs and client libraries, with a focus on performance, reliability, and developer experience.
  • You maintain a healthy balance between perfectionism and actually getting stuff done

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience working with both high growth stage private start ups and larger scale companies.
  • Previous experience or interest in IoT, hardware integration, or related fields is a bonus.
Technology

Typescript.

  • react/nextjs, and some Python & Ruby here and there.
  • postgres
  • running on Vercel with some workers on Fly.io.

job.title: Content Marketing Manager (Onsite - San Francisco, CA)
job.company_description: API for IoT Devices
job.description:
About Seam

Seam is an API for controlling a wide range of IoT devices.

Today we primarily focus on door lock and access systems. Our customers span industries, such as hospitality, real-estate, networking equipment, or even last-mile delivery, and range in size from startups-in-garage to public companies.

Across the board, their goal is the same: use code to control hardware devices, and orchestrate the physical world.

Our team is made of alums from Nest, Sonder, Stanford, Apple, Latch, Berkeley, YC, and more. We shipped millions of IoT devices and built dev tools used by every developer on earth. We are advised by the amazing Bunnie Huang and backed by Tiger Global, Root VC, founders and execs at Stripe, Plaid, and Airbnb, and other amazing angels and funds.

About You

We generally seek "sharp minds with kind souls." We prefer generalists over specialists; we move quickly, with purpose; we enjoy working with each other and aim to be the best.

About the role

As a Content Marketing Manager at Seam, you will be instrumental in producing and promoting high-quality technical content that elevates our brand's presence.

You'll be producing a mix of written and media content, including in-depth articles, product announcements, case studies, newsletters, customer testimonials, product reviews, and videos. Your content will highlight our unique product, showcase our clients' innovative use cases, and provide valuable industry insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include creating monthly case studies and video testimonials for our marquee clients, leading the production of our bi-weekly newsletter in collaboration with the product team, and developing thought leadership content with in-depth articles on IoT-related topics. Additionally, you will work on growing our audience across major channels such as Hacker News, Reddit, Twitter and LinkedIn to drive engagement and awareness of Seam.

You'll take ownership of our content calendar, ensuring all content is created and distributed on schedule. Using Figma, you'll produce graphics and presentations, and you'll work with graphic designers to ensure all content aligns with our brand requirements. Your role will also involve directing and editing videos to make sure they are engaging and informative.

*This role is San Francisco based. We are not looking for remote candidates at the moment.

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of proven content marketing experience, with experience across a variety of content types including longform content (e.g., thought leadership pieces), short form content (e.g., infographics) and video script writing, preferably in tech.
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills, with the ability to articulate complex product features into compelling marketable content.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to create a scalable content production/management engine within the organization
  • Demonstrated track record of success with turning content into traffic, engaging and educating audiences, and creating content that converts prospects into customers
  • Proficiency in graphic design using Figma
  • Excellent understanding of SEO best practices and web analytics

Benefits

  • 100% employer-paid health care insurance including medical, dental, vision + 75% dependent coverage
  • Our comprehensive benefits package includes a company managed 401K, Flexible Spending Accounts, coverage for gynecological services and support for family-building initiatives, access to mental health services, etc.
  • Paid Time Off and Company paid holidays
  • Free in-office lunch dailyüç¥
  • Base Pay Range: $100k - $130k per year + Equity

To Apply: Please send your resume and include your portfolio. Be sure to include examples of your previous work that demonstrate your ability to create high-quality writing, design, and video content.

Technology

Typescript.

  • react/nextjs, and some Python & Ruby here and there.
  • postgres
  • running on Vercel with some workers on Fly.io.

job.title: Senior Product Designer
job.company_description: Empowering businesses to sell more online
job.description:
About Replo

Replo helps companies build websites with less code. Today, we sell this product to e-commerce companies (e.g. Hexclad, Studs) who use it to build everything from their latest products to giveaways. Our goal is to create a single platform for businesses to design, develop, and market content on the internet.

About Us

Replo was founded in the summer of 2021. We launched in 2022 and grew to over 1000+ paying customers in just 6 months with no sales team. We‚Äôve raised over $4.2M from Figma, YCombinator, Infinity Ventures, MAGIC Fund, Base Case Capital, as well as the founders of NextJS/Vercel.

About the role
Skills: Wireframing, Figma

üåÜ About the Role

Hiring a senior product designer to join our team and focus on design for our core product. This role involves working on projects ranging from our real-time collaborative editor to managing the onboarding flow for tens of thousands of new users. Beyond owning multiple projects and products at a time, you'll collaborate with the overall design team on revamping our information architecture. brand, and design system.

Day-to-day, you'll participate in project planning, conduct user research, and engage in hands-on design work. You'll also contribute to design-specific projects and play a crucial role in establishing and nurturing the design culture at Replo. If you're passionate about creating intuitive and collaborative design solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

Your responsibilities

  • Lead design initiatives for our core product, the Replo editor

  • Create, collaborate, and iterate on user flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs

  • Conduct user interviews with designers and marketing teams across hundreds of D2C brands and cutting-edge e-commerce agencies

  • Help shape Replo‚Äôs design practices and design voice as we continue to scale

  • Hold a strong design perspective and deep care for our product - and use that to speak out when you see something that you don‚Äôt agree with

  • Hopefully have fun working with us üòá

Looking for someone who:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree

  • 3+ years of design experience ideally with 2+ years working on web-based products

  • Has strong visual taste and style

  • Is comfortable managing multiple UX projects at once

  • Can collaborate and communicate effectively with our team and our customers

  • Is an expert in using Figma and has a passion for design tools and what they can unlock

  • Is a scrappy self-starter, and can own the E2E design process without the support of a large org

  • Is self-motivated and can roll with the punches in a fast-paced environment where priorities and requirements may change frequently

  • Is 100% product and customer-obsessed (and can show it!)

Bonus points if you:

  • Have started a company before

  • Know how to code and have experience working with engineers

  • Have a background using great low-code tools like Webflow, Squarespace, etc

  • Have a background in marketing automation/AI products

  • Have worked at an early-stage (seed/Series A) company before

  • Are comfortable (and enjoy) working somewhere where things may change daily

The salary range for this position is $130,000 to 160,0000. The salary offered depends on a variety of factors, including job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and market location. In addition to the salary, a performance bonus and long-term incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, as well as a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.

Replo is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, and non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Note on H1B Visas: At this time, Replo is unfortunately unable to support employees on H1B visas.

Technology

We use NextJS, Node, and Typescript aggressively. We deploy on Fly.io and Vercel.

At Replo, you won‚Äôt just be writing the next internal tool at a big-tech company. We‚Äôre building a highly distributed, scalable system to power the next-generation of online commerce. If this sounds interesting to you, we‚Äôd love to chat!

job.title: Software Engineer (Full-Stack Generalist)
job.company_description: Empowering businesses to sell more online
job.description:
About Replo

Replo helps companies build websites with less code. Today, we sell this product to e-commerce companies (e.g. Hexclad, Studs) who use it to build everything from their latest products to giveaways. Our goal is to create a single platform for businesses to design, develop, and market content on the internet.

About Us

Replo was founded in the summer of 2021. We launched in 2022 and grew to over 1000+ paying customers in just 6 months with no sales team. We‚Äôve raised over $4.2M from Figma, YCombinator, Infinity Ventures, MAGIC Fund, Base Case Capital, as well as the founders of NextJS/Vercel.

About the role
Skills: JavaScript, React, TypeScript

üåÜ About the Role

Replo‚Äôs looking for a software engineer to be a key player on our team. As an engineer, you‚Äôll build critical parts of our product - everything from the core Replo no-code editor used by hundreds of people every day, to real-time analytics for 100M+ visitors our customers track, to cloudflare based multi-tenant NextJS deployments for teams driving and testing millions in ad traffic. You‚Äôll work closely with all parts of our organization (product, customer support/success, sales, growth) to ship products daily, take ownership of improvements to Replo platform, and (hopefully!) have fun in a collaborative environment with a challenging technical roadmap.

*This is a hybrid role based in San Francisco, where we typically work in the office 2-3 days per week.

Your responsibilities

  • Be a critical part of technical and product roadmap, we expect all of our engineers to be actively part of the product management process

  • Build products across our stack (using React, Typescript, Node, and more) that enable our customers to build differentiated user experiences online

  • Architect full-stack systems across our product area (e.g. creating an SSR publishing flow for Replo components, or integrating Replo components with different third-party systems) and lead the implementation of these projects with our engineering team

  • Collaborate directly with our team and customers to ship stable, maintainable code while iterating as fast as possible

  • Hopefully have a blast working with us üòá

Looking for someone who:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

  • Has professional experience building full-stack applications in Typescript and React (at least 3 years of professional experience)

  • Has professional experience building and deploying scalable systems in real life (not pet projects)

  • Has a very product and customer focused mindset

  • Has substantial experience in Typescript, Node

  • Understands the value of writing clean, maintainable software, including documentation

  • Is comfortable with ambiguity and defining software architecture patterns to solve customer pain points

  • Is self-driven and can roll with the punches in a fast-paced environment where priorities and requirements may change frequently

  • Can work fast and has a passion for iterating and getting a lot of code out the door quickly

Bonus points if you:

  • Are an ex-founder OR worked at an early-stage startup previously (Series A or earlier)

  • Have not wasted hours interview-prepping on Leetcode üò≠

  • Have experience with modern full-stack React frameworks like Next.js or Remix (the founder of NextJS/Vercel is one of our investors)

  • An eye for visual design (or past experience in product design, Figma, etc)

The salary range for this position is $120,000.00 to $170,000.00. The salary offered depends on a variety of factors, including job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and market location. In addition to the salary, a performance bonus and long-term incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, as well as a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.

Replo is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, and non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Note on H1B Visas: At this time, Replo is unfortunately unable to support employees on H1B visas.

Technology

We use NextJS, Node, and Typescript aggressively. We deploy on Fly.io and Vercel.

At Replo, you won‚Äôt just be writing the next internal tool at a big-tech company. We‚Äôre building a highly distributed, scalable system to power the next-generation of online commerce. If this sounds interesting to you, we‚Äôd love to chat!

job.title: Frontend Engineer
job.company_description: Testing and Simulation Stack for GenAI Systems
job.description:
About Relari

Relari is defining the new category of data-driven development infrastructure for GenAI applications. We work with top AI teams from leading startups to large enterprises, and we are growing at a blazing-fast rate. Our founding team are experts on AI system production and we are well-funded by top-tier VCs.

About the role
Skills: Figma, CSS, React, TypeScript

As a frontend engineer at Relari, you will help us solve the most critical challenges facing our society‚Äôs adoption of foundation models.

In this role, you will:

  • Spearhead the development and maintenance of high-quality user interface of our Generative AI Testing and Simulation stack.
  • Focus on user experience design, creating intuitive and innovative interfaces that meet the needs of our users.
  • Collaborate closely with backend team to integrate new features seamlessly into the user interface.
  • Work closely with the design team to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences.

You‚Äôre a good fit if

  • You are an experienced frontend engineer who‚Äôve shipped production-grade UI/UX that have scaled to a large user base.

  • You are highly proficient in React, Next.js, TypeScript, and CSS.

  • You have a strong understanding of frontend development tools and have experience with

    responsive and adaptive design.

  • You thrive in a fast-moving environment and view unstructured environments as opportunities to identify the most impactful work and define the future success of the company.

  • You are ownership-minded. You don‚Äôt wait for company processes to get work done; instead, you proactively contribute wherever you can to drive success.

Bonus points if you have:

  • Experience building developer-facing B2B products.
  • Shipped an AI product or feature.
Technology

Our testing and simulation stack leverages a suite of foundation models and traditional machine learning techniques to generate large-scale, high-fidelity synthetic data for rigorous evaluation and systematic fine-tuning. There's a heavy research angle to our tech stack as we are on the cutting edge of defining the best practices in building reliable AI applications. We collaborate with top institutions like MIT to publish research papers and open source part of our stack (continuous-eval).

job.location: Foster City, CA, US / CA, US / US
job.title: LLM Whisperer (Founding AI Engineer)
job.company_description: AI alternative to ZoomInfo
job.description:
About Openmart

We are Openmart and we are creating the world‚Äôs largest live directory of local businesses. We help sales professionals query millions of unstructured business data like websites, product catalogs, reviews and socials.

Both of our founders are located in Foster City and we work in a loft where Richard lives in. Both of us have dogs and have a very dog-friendly office!

Team

Richard

  • Richard was a senior software engineer at Cruise working on ML. Then joined as founding engineer at Graft, funded by NEA and GV where he trained and finetuned large-language models. 
  • Built an AI agent as weekend project that got on to GitHub trending projects

Kathryn

  • First product manager at Databento, which was funded by Redpoint venture which sells market data API‚Äôs.
  • Previously was on various growth teams at Pinterest and ran hundreds of A/B testings. 
  • She also runs a DTC tea brand where she experienced the problem that led to the idea of OpenmartWe‚Äôve known each other at Pinterest back in 2019 and have been good friends ever since. Openmart‚Äôs idea stems from our founder‚Äôs own pain points. Kathryn faced GTM challenges while launching her beverage brand trying to find great local business leads. 
About the role
Skills: Kubernetes, Python, SQL

Overview

Openmart is currently seeking an Founding AI Engineer with experience in search engine and AI agents. We are building a Google-like search engine for B2B unstructured data (similar to Perplexity) and seeking candidates with in-depth understanding of AI (LangChain, OSS models, tool/function calls, RAG, prompt-tuning, evals etc.)

Team Culture

Our team leader is innovative and supportive, fostering a culture of continuous learning and collaboration. They encourage open communication and provide regular feedback to help team members grow.

We expect the team to be in person at our Foster City office.

Description

We are Openmart, dedicated to creating the world's largest real-time directory of local businesses. We assist sales professionals in querying millions of unstructured business data, including websites, product catalogs, reviews, and social media information. Openmart is backed by Y Combinator, execs at DoorDash, Square, Instacart, and top venture capital firms. If you are passionate about joining us, please get in touch.

Join Us and Get:

  • Opportunity to play a key role in a startup backed by top investors
  • Solve real-world problems, improving business data querying and utilization through technology
  • Work in a vibrant, innovation-driven environment, growing alongside a talented team

Requirements

  • AI: Proficiency in Langchain, RAG, embeddings, multi-step AI agents, AI agent evals & finetune
  • (Preferred) Search Algorithm Technology: Experience in search engine development, familiarity with re-ranking algorithms, embedding algorithms, fuzzy search, word2vec
  • (Preferred) Startup Experience: Experience leading significant projects in startup environments
Technology
  • Semantic Search (Multi-stage re-ranking, embeddings, etc), we are building Google for B2B data
  • AI Agents (LangChain, OSS models, tool/function calling, etc)
  • We use Supabase as our DB, Python as our backend, NextJS as our frontend
Interview Process
  1. 15 min phone screen about your background
  2. 60 min technical phone interview (1 system design questions, 1 coding question)
  3. one take-home mini project
  4. 60 min culture fit interview with our founders

job.title: Founding Engineer
job.company_description: Instantly draft, review, and send complex regulatory notices.
job.description:
About Kyber

With Kyber, companies operating in regulated industries can quickly draft, review, and send complex regulatory notices. For example, when Branch Insurance's claims team has to settle a claim, instead of spending hours piecing together evidence to draft a complex notice, they can simply upload the details of the claim to Kyber, auto-generate multiple best in-class drafts, easily assign reviewers, collaborate on notices in real-time, and then send the letter to the individual the notice is for. Kyber not only saves these teams time, it also improves overall quality, accountability, and traceability.

About the role
Skills: Git, JavaScript, Node.js, Python, React, Docker, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

At Kyber, we‚Äôre building a next generation document generation and delivery platform for the enterprise.

While building Generative AI solutions for the insurance industry, we realized that today‚Äôs claims teams are spending 30-40% of their time just drafting tedious, hard to understand regulatory notices for claimants and third parties. As we dug deeper, we realized that the reason for this largely fell on outdated enterprise tools that were holding them back. Document generation tools are a critical yet often overlooked aspect of operations and poor systems can severely impact efficiency not just in insurance but across multiple industries.

We believe our platform will fundamentally change how organizations interact with and leverage their information, unlocking new possibilities for innovation and growth by keeping their people focused on what matters in their business.

Just a few of the cutting-edge platform features that allow us to enable a 10x boost in productivity for enterprises include:

  • Generative AI powered smart drafting that automatically leverages existing unstructured context to get writers to the best possible first draft.
  • Real-time collaborative editing with an embedded AI co-pilot for complex editing capabilities
  • Integrated review workflows for transparency and accountability in the process
  • AI powered template migration to get enterprises off of multiple fragmented legacy systems and into Kyber in a matter of days instead of years

Join us in shaping the future of enterprise document management. At Kyber, you'll work with state-of-the-art AI technology, tackle challenging problems, and make a tangible impact on how businesses operate in the digital age.

We are small, passionate team backed by top VCs

Arvind Sontha signed full-time with Google at 19 and was previously an ML Tech Lead for Google Search‚Äôs User Modeling Platform. Sav Gadoo was previously the Director of Product for Ladder Life and Next Insurance.

Kyber is backed by Y Combinator (Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox) and a number of other top Silicon Valley VCs and angels.

We are looking for a Founding Engineer to join us in-person in New York to build the document generation platform of the future.

Responsibilities

A sample of things you might work on:

  • Deeply integrating LLMs into our real-time editor with industry specific super user functionality
  • Redesigning critical components of the user experience end-to-end based on evolving client needs 
  • Generating evaluation metrics on new LLMs for generating notices from AI templates and benchmarking it against existing performance.
  • Collaborating with enterprise customers to understand their pain points and how we can apply AI to streamline their document generation workflows.

What we're looking for in you

  • You believe that building things that solve customer problems comes first.
  • You have proven experience in building complex full-stack applications.
  • You are fluent in one or more frontend and backend technologies (pref: NextJS, Tailwind, React, Node, & Python).
  • You are relentlessly resourceful and ready to tackle new challenges as they arise.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Generous stock package
  • 100% employer-covered medical, dental, and vision for you

Apply today

As one of the first engineering hires, you'll have the opportunity to directly impact how businesses across industries handle some of their most critical information assets and customer touchpoints.

If you're passionate about building innovative software and want to revolutionize how enterprises create, manage, and leverage documents using cutting-edge AI, we want to hear from you.

job.title: Growth Manager, SEM+SEO
job.company_description: Online Training for Healthcare Jobs
job.description:
About Stepful

Stepful is on a mission to revolutionize vocational education. We train people with a high school education in 4 months or less and places them into healthcare jobs. Healthcare is the fastest growing industry in the US accounting for 40% of all jobs added including medical assistants, nursing assistants, and phlebotomists.

About the role

About Stepful:

Stepful is reimagining healthcare training making it 10x more accessible, effective and fun. Stepful is one of the fastest growing start-ups based out of New York City. We launched a year ago and have already graduated thousands of students. Our graduates, mainly from underprivileged communities, go on to work at leading healthcare institutions such as OneMedical, NY Presbyterian and Davita. Stepful students increase their salaries by 60% on average after just 4 months of training.

The founding team is uniquely positioned to grow Stepful to be the leader in healthcare education. Each founder brings in relevant experience coming from leadership roles at Udacity, Apple, Uber, and Triplebyte.

Stepful is backed by Y Combinator and just closed a Series A round led by AlleyCorp with participation from SemperVirens, Reach Capital, Y Combinator, Company Ventures, Green Sands Equity, and 01 Advisors.

What You‚Äôll Do at Stepful:

Are you passionate about empowering millions of low-wage workers, enabling them to upskill and transform their lives? Do you excel at managing and optimizing paid search acquisition campaigns? Consider yourself an SEO expert? Enjoy running experiments and crunching data to drive Stepful‚Äôs growth? Thrive in an environment that values autonomy and encourages exceeding goals?

  • Own the end-to-end execution of customer acquisition campaigns across all paid search marketing channels, including budgeting, optimization, and measurement/reporting.
  • Manage and scale media spend while actively optimizing towards meeting profitability goals and lowering customer acquisition costs (CACs).
  • Design and operationalize a process for A/B testing campaigns, creatives, audiences, landing pages, and product marketing related to new customer acquisition.
  • Define the strategy and oversee the execution of Stepful‚Äôs SEO efforts, including working with agency partners to create content around relevant keywords, identifying backlink opportunities, and collaborating with engineering to ensure Stepful‚Äôs website follows SEO best practices.

Some key qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience working at an early-stage direct-to-consumer start-up.
  • Proven track record of scaling marketing spend on Google while maintaining ROI targets.
  • Proficiency in tactical end-to-end execution of ad campaigns across Paid Search, Display, and Pmax campaigns.
  • Experience writing creative briefs and working closely with creatives to iterate quickly and identify messaging/content that resonates with audiences.
  • Experienced SEO marketer with a track record of increasing ‚Äútop 3‚Äù keyword ranks, organic traffic, and website domain ranking.
  • Highly analytical with strong communication skills.

At Stepful, we're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Technology

Our current stack is based on Postgres, Rails and React.

We are building the best student experience ever!

job.title: Product Engineer
job.company_description: Online Training for Healthcare Jobs
job.description:
About Stepful

Stepful is on a mission to revolutionize vocational education. We train people with a high school education in 4 months or less and places them into healthcare jobs. Healthcare is the fastest growing industry in the US accounting for 40% of all jobs added including medical assistants, nursing assistants, and phlebotomists.

About the role
Skills: React, Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL

Stepful partners with healthcare institutions to build talent pipelines and career pathways.We are reimagining allied healthcare training with a digital-first environment for student cohorts that prepare job-ready graduates five times faster at a fraction of the cost. Stepful graduates, primarily from underrepresented communities, go on to work at leading healthcare institutions and report an average 25% income increase after just four months of training.

Stepful is backed by Y Combinator and recently closed a round led by AlleyCorp, Reach Capital, and Sempervirens.

Us

We are successful only if our students are successful, we are successful if they keep studying, graduate, and ultimately if they find a job. Everything you will be building at Stepful will directly influence our outcomes and impact the lives of thousands of students.

Here is what you can expect to be working on:

  • World Class Learning Experience: Develop and iterate on an advanced Learning Management System that generates outcomes! Focus on seamless UX, adaptive learning, peer-to-peer engagement, gamification and motivational mechanisms..
  • Innovative Career Services: Empower graduates to find jobs and match our growing network of clinical partners. Apply generative AI to the job-seeking process, from resume generation to interview training.
  • Empower the Internal Workforce: Design and maintain platforms for instructors, TAs, coaches, and operators to optimize student success. Leverage generative AI to maximize its impact on students' lives.
  • Cutting Edge Content Management: Generate and maintain content at scale that adapts to evolving educational needs. Build the technology to create new curricula in a fraction of the time and iterate to maximize students' learning.
  • Data Pipelines: Make data reliable and accessible to everyone at Stepful, and empower the business, learning, and operation teams at Stepful to make data-driven decisions.

You

  • Are strongly driven to make an impact in people's lives
  • Relentlessly obsess over solving complex problems with cutting-edge technology and willing to learn something new every day
  • Find excitement in joining an early-stage company and are not afraid of building something new
  • Have built something meaningful to you, before
  • Eat, sleep and breathe at least one of part of our stack (React, Typescript, Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL), you will learn the rest
  • Can take ownership of the whole development lifecycle (this means you are comfortable operating full-stack)

You will be successful if

  • Care first: We do everything it takes for our students to succeed.
  • Learn quickly: We test, learn with data, and iterate
  • Build together: We win when we rely on each other
  • Own it: We show up, we take initiative, and pride

Join our team for a unique opportunity to make an impact

We offer competitive salaries, equity packages, 401k, health insurance

Stepful is an equal opportunity employer, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace for all.

Note: Salary ranges are indicative and applicable to US-based employment.

Technology

Our current stack is based on Postgres, Rails and React.

We are building the best student experience ever!

Interview Process

Full Stack Coding (Take Home)

You will create a full-stack website implementing the user stories specified in the prompt.
We will ask you to spend no more than 3 hours on this problem. The 3 hours do not include setup time for setting up your coding environment or your project scaffolding. Your goal is to make tradeoffs so that all the user stories in the prompt are implemented_._

At Stepful we use Ruby on Rails, React and Postgres, but for this exercise we highly recommend picking the stack that you are more familiar with.

The take-home is followed by a review call (1h long) where you will present the work you have done. We would love for you to walk through and talk about decisions and tradeoffs you have made and we will also ask you to add one more feature during the call.

System Design

This is a live 1h long call where you will pretend to be a tech lead at Stepful. We‚Äôre working together on a project to design a distributed, scalable, application from scratch, and you‚Äôre leading its design. Your goal will be communicating the design and architectural decision to the engineer on the call and brainstorm with them on the scalability of the system.

Onsite

You will be invited to our NY office for the last round of interviews and to meet the rest of the product engineering team. The interview program can change based on the technical screening, but here is an example

  • Additional tech screen (at certain level of seniority, or based on the outcome of the previous round, we might need to collect more signals on your tech skills, we will let you know in advance what to prepare)
  • Product interview (Product sense, X-functional collaboration)
  • Values and Culture fit

job.title: Software Engineer (NYC)
job.company_description: Treasury management for CRE
job.description:
About Arpari

We are Arpari, a seed stage company based in New York, US.

At Arpari, we simplify the daily treasury operations of finance teams. Our platform empowers CFOs, controllers, and treasurers to access all banking and manage workflows from a single platform.

Each day, high performing teams use Arpari as their system of record to manage over $1.0bn of cash. By aggregating relevant information and workflows into a single dashboard, our customers are able to make better decisions faster.

Since launching, we have focused on real estate and financial services firms, and have signed up some very large customers. We are now expanding our target audience and accordingly our product suite.

We are a humble and hungry team and are backed by prominent investors. Our team brings together a wealth of experience from top-tier finance companies like Goldman Sachs.

In June 2024, we completed a $4.2mm seed round and are growing quickly.

About the role
Skills: Django, Git, Python, React, SQL, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

INDIVIDUAL APPLICANTS ONLY, PLESE DO NOT REACH OUT IF YOU ARE A RECRUITER

How we work

  • As an early employee, you‚Äôll get to work directly with the CEO and early team to define and execute on tasks with high impact to Arpari and our growth.
  • We promote an outcome-focused, low-bureaucracy work environment with an emphasis on having impact and moving relevant metrics.

The Role

As a key member of our team, you'll have a significant impact on shaping the direction of the company and product. You will manage Arpari features from design to deployment, solve complex issues, and collaborate with different teams.

For the right candidate, this is a rare opportunity to help build an industry-defining company from the ground up.

What we're looking for

We are not looking for specific frameworks, skillsets, and experiences. We value above all else folks who want to make real customer impact by building great software.

For example:

  • You thrive at solving tough problems
    • You enjoy breaking down challenging problems into simple & well-designed solutions
    • You are fact-driven and want to measure the real impact of your work
  • You enjoy building products and making real-world impact
    • You take responsibility over end-to-end deployment of what you build
    • You like shipping code frequently, iteratively, and collaboratively
    • You value MVPs and customer impact over perfectly engineered systems
    • You care about scalable infrastructure & process. Even better if you are the one to help improve / implement the system!
    • You choose the best framework / technology for the task, even if you might have favorites. We work primarily in Python on the backend, and React on the frontend, but are always experimenting with what framework enables the greatest performance and delivers the most value
  • You like to work in an fast-paced, high-growth, team-based environment
    • You are entrepreneurial. This means having a growth mindset, finding problems without being told about them, thinking independently about issues and clearly advocating your position, and taking full ownership of your work, even if things go wrong
    • You are a helpful teammate and understand best practices for building products as part of a team e.g., code review / version control

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package, including equity
  • Periodic team retreats

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is passionate about solving problems and is excited about the opportunity to shape our sales motion from the ground up. If you're ready to make a significant impact and grow with us, we'd love to hear from you!

Technology

Arpari is looking to hire a Software Engineer. As one of the early engineering hires on our team, you‚Äôll have an outsized impact on our success and a unique opportunity for ownership. You'll be responsible for implementing key product features on our banking platform and building out new verticals. Given our broad surface area, you'll gain experience across the stack while learning how to design and execute projects. The ideal candidate will be ambitious, product-focused, and entrepreneurial. We only hire high-impact individuals.

What You'll Do: prototype, productionize and deploy features in our user-facing web applications; iterate on data-driven tools and services to aide business operations; and engage with sales, marketing and operations to identify and plan key products.

What You'll Need: (1) prior experience as a software engineer (internship is fine); (2) computer science or related degree; (3) strong skills in Python; (4) knowledge of Django and React; and (5) entrepreneurial spirit.

Interview Process
  1. Initial screen (30 minutes) -- A conversation with Alex to discuss what you're looking for, what Arpari offers, and to see if there's a good fit
  2. Technical challenge (60 minutes) -- An opportunity for you to see what is a representative problem you will work on at Arpari, and for us to see your problem solving skills
  3. Onsite interviews (60 minutes) -- Meet the team you will be working with
  4. References -- 2 references from previous work experience, who can give examples of your impact and behavior in a professional environment

job.location: New York, NY, US / Remote (New York, NY, US)
job.title: Data Engineer
job.company_description: Everything for your fitness or wellness business.
job.description:
About Arketa

Arketa is shaping the future of the fitness + wellness industry.

We make it easier than ever for fitness professionals to start, run and scale their own businesses. Our platform allows the wellness + coaching industry to host classes, monetize on-demand content, and build community-driven courses from their own website.

The future of wellness has more voices in the space who bring inclusion, diversity, and creativity to movement, so working out is a better experience than ever before.

Arketa's culture embraces diverse perspectives, outside-the-box thinking, and collaborative problem-solving. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't exactly match the description. We believe in motivating our employees to succeed at the highest level‚Äîand letting them know that we have their backs when things get tough. Arketa offers competitive compensation, health insurance, generous vacation time, and an in-class fitness and wellness budget!

We're looking for talented team members looking to create the future with us.

About the role
Skills: Data Warehousing, Data Analytics

What we're looking for

This role is perfect for an ambitious Data Engineer looking to grow and work with customer data. Someone who is engineering-driven, can translate business and data requirements into production-ready stacks, and provide innovative systems with a focus on data resilience and accuracy.

We are looking for someone who shows passion and can champion data not only internally but to our customers. This person would help shape data collection, compliance, processes, and work cross-functionally with all Arketa teams.

The Role

  • Creating data pipelines to handle batch and steaming ETLs
  • Create and implement efficient solutions to enrich existing data workflows
  • Create software/technology that will be the foundations for future systems
  • Identifying and report data resilience issues to key stakeholders

The You

  • You like to get things done.
  • Be confident working with batch data processing systems
  • Provide data-focused solutions and obtain buy-in from stakeholders
  • Experience working with stacks such as BigQuery, DataFlow, DataPrep, Data Studio, Pub/Sub, Kafka, Apache Airflow and the like
  • Experience defining schemas and growing a Data Warehouse
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, especially Firestore and/or MongoDB
  • Experience with Stripe + Hubspot is a plus!

The Benefits

  • Weekly workouts with the team
  • Health/dental/vision coverage
  • Unlimited PTO / sick leave
Technology

React, Node, Firebase

We're looking for talented team members looking to create the future with us.

About the role

What we're looking for

job.title: Chief of Staff to the COO
job.company_description: Expanding Metal Production with Biology
job.description:
About Maverick BioMetals

Maverick BioMetals is a YC startup (Summer'22) developing a new biological mining process called BioExtraction focused on lithium and other battery metals. Our process is more environmentally friendly and efficient than traditional metal extraction methods.

About the role

What we do

Maverick BioMetals extracts lithium, other battery metals, and rare earth elements from hard rock using engineered enzymes. Our process is more cost effective and greener (reduced environmental contaminants and CO2 emissions) than the current acid roasting extraction method.

We believe in a world powered by sustainable energy. Lithium and other metals are necessary for a sustainable energy transition which requires responsible metal extraction and processing. We are a small, driven team with strong startup vibes. If you‚Äôre interested in joining us at the forefront of the clean energy revolution and value autonomy and making a tangible impact, we encourage you to apply!

The role

We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Chief of Staff to support our COO, Jesse Evans. This role is designed for a proactive individual who can eventually step into the COO's shoes when needed. You will oversee various responsibilities including, but not limited to, exploring different avenues for the commercialization of our technology, building and managing client relationships, project management, and some administrative duties. This role will be varied as the company needs change, and requires someone with an adaptable go-getter attitude who is excited to get in on the ground floor of a quickly growing seed-stage startup.

Key responsibilities

Client engagement & partnership development

  • Develop, maintain and manage customer and commercial relationships
  • Research, identify and develop new business opportunities
  • Represent the COO in meetings with clients and partners
  • Act as a liaison between the COO and external parties
  • Manage customer projects, including coordination between the technical teams and operations teams, ensuring timely deliverables and communication to the executive team 
  • Support the COO in identifying and securing new partnership opportunities
  • Attend industry conferences and events to promote the company and its technology

Operational & administrative support

  • Collaborate with internal teams to align on company goals and strategies 
  • Support the COO in the development and execution of business strategies
  • Help coordinate and manage special projects and initiatives
  • Prepare reports, presentations, and correspondence
  • Own new responsibilities as we continue to scale

Qualifications

  • 2+ years experience in business development, management consulting, investment banking, customer success, and/or project management
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Strong organizational and multitasking skills
  • A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements
  • Eager to learn and take on new challenges
  • Highly motivated and self-directed, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Willingness to travel and participate in industry events
  • Nice to haves: experience in a client-facing role; experience or interest in mining, mineral processing, and/or renewable energy experience

Note: Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt precisely match the job description, you're encouraged to apply. Your skills and passion will stand out‚Äîand set you apart‚Äîespecially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns

Benefits

At Maverick BioMetals, our compensation packages reflect our recognition of the value our employees bring to our success and our commitment to recruiting top talent. We cater our benefits to ensure our team succeeds both in and out of the office:

  • Unlimited vacation: We value employee well-being and believe you should take the time you need, when you need it. Our policy ensures you recharge and thrive
  • Premium health insurance: With medical, dental, and optical options, we offer some of the best coverage on the market 
  • Continuing education: We take employee development seriously and strive to unlock our team‚Äôs full potential through continuous learning initiatives

Notice of E-Verify Participation and Right to Work

Maverick BioMetals is a participant in the E-Verify program. E-Verify is a web-based system that helps us confirm the eligibility of our employees to work in the United States. For more information, please review our E-Verify Participation Poster and Right to Work Poster located at the bottom of our Careers page.

Additional info

Maverick BioMetals complies with all laws prohibiting discrimination against employees and applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, or veterans‚Äô status.

Technology

We use enzymes to completely breakdown rock to extract the metal encased inside. Imagine how salt dissolves in water -- yeah, that's what we do to rock. Then we simply take out all the metals.

Our process is energy efficient, so we produce fewer greenhouse gases than traditional extraction, and we valorize the entire rock so there is no waste, unlike traditional extraction.

job.title: Backend Engineer
job.company_description: Tool and platform to create and sell webcomics
job.description:
About Storyboarder

Storyboarder is a tool and a platform for anyone to create, share, and sell webcomics.

In East Asia, the webcomic (or digital manga) industry is an $12B market and rapidly growing to the rest of the world. Webtoon, the largest company in the space, generates $100M / month in revenue. However, their addressable market is limited by their content creators, who need know how to draw. Readers are desperate for a greater variety of stories in webcomics.

Through years of working with filmmakers, we‚Äôve built extremely easy to use storyboarding software that has 700K users. We‚Äôre democratizing visual storytelling to everyone. We‚Äôre working on the next generation that, through advances in video game interfaces, ubiquitous 3D compute, and AI, will allow anyone to easily create scenes, pose characters, to create webcomics.

Storyboarder is co-founded by Charles Forman who founded OMGPOP (S06) which sold to Zynga for $200M, a top YC exit.

Storyboarder is backed by Y Combinator (W23), David Karp (Tumblr Founder), Andrew Kortina (Venmo Founder), and other product focused investors.

About the role
Skills: Node.js, React, TypeScript

About Storyboarder

We're building a creative tool and a platform for anyone to create and publish web comics. Our mission is to democratize storytelling, allowing anyone with a story idea to create a beautiful visual representation of that story, even if they don't know how to draw. Think of the creative tool as a videogame level editor, but instead of a game, the output is a series of shots to make a story.

Backend Engineer Role:

We're seeking a Backend Developer who has experience with Node, Next.js, and some React.

Qualifications:

  • Experience with React, Node, Next.js.
  • Strong knowledge of web technologies and responsive design
  • Passion for web comics, manga, and video games
  • Experience in gaming industry (a big plus)
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

You may be a good fit if:

  • You love narrative fiction, particularly web comics / manga.
  • You've worked on a game before.
  • You have a strong sense of good user experience.
Technology

Our stack is: Editor: Javascript, React, Threejs / React Three Fiber. Platform: Nodejs, NextJS, Postgres.

job.title: Implementation Project Manager
job.company_description: Optimizing nurse staffing for health systems
job.description:
About Vitalize Care

Vitalize Care enables health systems to optimize how they schedule and deploy nursing staff to align with real-time patient demand. 

Within months of starting, Vitalize has exceeded 7-figures in contracted ARR with top health systems and are scaling our initial implementations to reach thousands of staff. We‚Äôve raised $3.8M from top seed investors (including Y Combinator) and hospital executives around the country. We project our software saving customers > $2.5M in labor costs, while saving nurse managers 2+ hours/day in manual work by automating scheduling tasks.

About the role

‚úçÔ∏è Position Overview:

As an Implementation Project Manager at Vitalize Care, you will drive the successful adoption and implementation of our software solution within health systems. Working with the operations team, you‚Äôll ensure a seamless transition from legacy software to our innovative platform with minimal disruption. You will liaise between healthcare organizations and our product development team of engineers and designers, facilitating feedback-driven product improvements to guide the evolution of our software. You will also closely monitor our product‚Äôs performance to track cost savings, time savings, and other impact metrics for our clients.

üß≠ Responsibilities:

  • Maximize Implementation & Operational Success: Manage and ensure the successful implementation of our software within healthcare facilities. Develop and lead all phases of project implementation and configuration, train and guide healthcare leadership and staff (nurses, nurse managers, administrators, allied health professionals) through the transition, foster user adoption, conduct product demos, and overcome potential challenges.
  • Measure ROI and Impact: Measure and monitor the ROI: cost savings, time savings, retention, satisfaction associated with the Vitalize platform. This data-driven approach underscores the impact of our technology.
  • Develop Product with Stakeholder Feedback: Serve as a bridge between the healthcare workforce and our product development team to surface and prioritize valuable feedback that inform enhancements and refinements to our software. Contribute to the design and development of our product, ensuring that it is responsive to the evolving needs of our clients.
  • Strengthen Customer Relationships: Establish and nurture deep relationships with nursing leadership and staff at our health system customers. Your rapport and responsiveness will make Vitalize Care a trusted partner in healthcare.

üß≠ Why you should join us?

  • Mission-Driven Company: At Vitalize Care, we're on a mission to revolutionize healthcare staffing and scheduling. If you want to be part of an organization that is making a tangible difference and is backed by industry leaders, this is the place for you.
  • Incredible Customers/Partners: We‚Äôre working with the most innovative health systems, and have some of the most respected nursing and digital health leaders as investors and advisors on our team.
  • Professional Growth: As an early employee, you will have the opportunity to eventually build and lead a team that helps us keep up with growth and maximize success. You‚Äôll also have a huge role in day-to-day decisions that guide the overall trajectory and growth of the company.

‚òë Qualifications and Requirements:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree
  • Skills:
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build strong relationships with healthcare professionals.
    • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
    • Ability to understand and explain software solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
    • Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
    • Willingness to travel to healthcare facilities as needed.
  • Nice-to-Have Experiences:
    • Relevant healthcare industry experience
    • Proven experience in healthcare technology implementation, project management, or nursing management
    • Previous experience implementing Epic, Cerner, Clin Doc, or other clinical modules, build experience highly desirable

üìç Location + Hours

  • Willingness and ability to travel weekly (at least 3 days per week) when necessary, however, at times you may be able to provide services remotely
    • We will work with you to design an optimal travel schedule that aligns with your preferences and customer needs
  • This is a full-time position with standard hours, but flexibility may be required to accommodate healthcare facility schedules.
Technology

Node.js, TypeScript, React, Next.js, Python, Postgres, AWSStack: Next.js 13 w/ TailwindCSS, Supabase, FastAPI, AWS

job.title: Senior FrontEnd Engineer
job.company_description: Contract and negotiation AI built for lawyers
job.description:
About DraftWise

DraftWise is at the forefront of AI in the legal industry, building a secure knowledge platform that helps lawyers at elite law firms draft, negotiate and review contracts faster, and with an edge over their competitors. Our core product unlocks for the first time the years of historic legal contracts that firms have negotiated for their clients. We use the latest in data management, machine learning and language analytics to help lawyers and legal professionals write better, safer contracts. Some reasons to join DraftWise:

  • Our core offering has achieved product market fit proven by our partnerships with the industries leading Vault 10, Magic Circle and AMLAW 100 firms.
  • Our founding team is composed of former Palantir and Google engineers along with an experienced lawyer from a top global law firm.
  • We are backed by Y-Combinator and recently raised our $20M in our Series A backed by Index Ventures
  • We are a fully remote company, though offer the option to co-work in our major cities in the US and Europe.
  • We are working with the latest generative AI technology and developing practical applications of it for the legal industry
  • We are solving problems that matter to lawyers, and our users love us for it!
About the role
Skills: React, TypeScript, Microservices, PostgreSQL

Senior FrontEnd Engineer

About the Role

We're looking for a Frontend/Fullstack software engineers to join our growing yet still core team as a founding engineer. As an early team member, you will have a broad ownership, impact over the technology, the product, and our culture. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to evolve within our fast-growing company.

We have plenty of exciting challenges and opportunities at all levels of the stack. We would love to have you to take ownership of features, make architectural and product decisions as well as writing code to build the perfect experience for users.

What we value

  • Strong communication skills in an open environment.
  • Skills to work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision.
  • Interest in working in a dynamic environment with dynamic objectives.
  • Individual autonomy and ownership, building quality products.
  • Being open to giving and receiving feedback.

About You

We're looking for engineers who have:

  • A passion for shipping high-quality product that delights users
  • Interest in the data products space, and a love of building tools that empower lawyers to do more
  • Interest and curiosity about the bigger picture of building a company, including go-to-market, customer development, people, and marketing
  • Interest in helping us build an engineering organization
  • Interest in ownership and autonomy
  • Strong software engineering fundamentals
  • 3+ years as a professional software engineer
  • 3+ years of experience on React with Typescript
  • Time Zones: GMT-05:00 to GMT+03:00, but flexible

It's also great if you have:

  • Knowledge of modern browser APIs and language features
  • Experience with common frontend frameworks and libraries
  • Worked with elements in our tech stack:
    • Product: React, Redux, Typescript, NextJS, Java
    • Infrastructure: Fargate on AWS, Docker on-prem
    • Data: Postgres, Elasticsearch
    • DevOps: AWS VPCs
  • Experience in build and infrastructure tools
  • Interest in being involved in engineering design decisions

What we offer

  • All-remote work style, work anywhere. Ideally within UTC+4 to UTC-7
  • Equity plan
  • Competitive salary
  • Private medical care
  • New laptop and a work-from-home stipend for necessary accessories
  • Generous PTO / sick leave
  • Opportunity to lead our company as we disrupt the legal world
Technology

We have plenty of challenges at all levels of the stack, from the nuts and bolts of designing a processing back-end engine, VM infrastructure and NLP all the way up to building beautiful web technology.

If you have the appetite for it, you‚Äôll be able to drive the product direction.

Product: React, Typescript, Redux, Postgres, Java, Elasticsearch

Interview Process

  1. Intro chat to tell you about what we are building and find more about your interests. We are looking for ownership, autonomy, and intent but we also dig deeper into communication. This should take about 30 minutes.

  2. Technical chat for us to deep dive into your past work and interests. the conversation will cover some light technical discussion about your past projects. Mostly, we want to know that you can code and ship fairly involved systems, and speak to them with clarity on the details. This tends to be a good indication that an engineer had strong ownership and showed autonomy in making product or technical decisions. This should take about 45 minutes.

  3. Take home project (~3-4 hours). We simplified something we already built and will provide skeleton code for you to work on. The idea is to see your technical skills, as well as for you to find out if you like what we are working on.

Optionally, we would love for you to meet the rest of the team if you like to before you make a decision.

The typical interview process takes 2 weeks from start to finish.

job.title: Content & Community Associate
job.company_description: Contract and negotiation AI built for lawyers
job.description:
About DraftWise

DraftWise is at the forefront of AI in the legal industry, building a secure knowledge platform that helps lawyers at elite law firms draft, negotiate and review contracts faster, and with an edge over their competitors. Our core product unlocks for the first time the years of historic legal contracts that firms have negotiated for their clients. We use the latest in data management, machine learning and language analytics to help lawyers and legal professionals write better, safer contracts. Some reasons to join DraftWise:

  • Our core offering has achieved product market fit proven by our partnerships with the industries leading Vault 10, Magic Circle and AMLAW 100 firms.
  • Our founding team is composed of former Palantir and Google engineers along with an experienced lawyer from a top global law firm.
  • We are backed by Y-Combinator and recently raised our $20M in our Series A backed by Index Ventures
  • We are a fully remote company, though offer the option to co-work in our major cities in the US and Europe.
  • We are working with the latest generative AI technology and developing practical applications of it for the legal industry
