job.title: Fullstack Engineer
job.company_description: Multicurrency account & international payments for businesses
job.description:
About Levro

Levro is a new multicurrency business neobank. We help companies expand overseas by giving them the ability to hold, convert, and pay in/out of 30+ currencies using one account. Businesses can go global and hold $, ‚Ç¨, ¬£, ¬•, etc., convert at better wholesale rates, pay in/out using local payment rails, and automate FX optimization.

About the role
Skills: Flask, Python, React

About us:

At Levro, our mission is to build the financial backbone for global commerce. We are building financial infrastructure to allow any company to frictionlessly expand to any country. Our first product is a bank account for businesses that will let you hold and spend multiple currencies ($, ‚Ç¨, ¬£, ¬•, etc.).

We leverage AI to provide payments solutions to our customers - our latest product enables customers to upload and parse their contracts so that they match outgoing payments against the,

Opening a bank account abroad as a business can be really hard: it can take up to 6 months in the UK, and you often even need to fly to Canada to open a Canadian bank account! Once accounts are open, banks charge high fees to convert between currencies, and the setup can be complicated to administer. We solve that by having one business bank account that lets you hold and transact in any currency you want. Many businesses currently forgo accepting overseas customers due to administrative challenges - we want to fix that.

We're second time founders and experienced operators. Both of our first companies had successful outcomes, and we're backed by top Silicon Valley investors, including YCombinator. We're well capitalized with a long runway.

Role Description:

As a Fullstack Engineer, you‚Äôre sure to have a big impact! You‚Äôll shape our product and technology direction, as well as support an engineering culture that empathizes with our customers, users, and other team members.

What You'll do:

  • Take our product from 0 to 1 by designing and implementing secure, highly scalable, and pragmatic technical solutions
  • Work closely with the founders to influence, develop, and implement product design and roadmap
  • Develop subject matter expertise in areas like international banking, card issuing, and machine learning for lending
  • Work directly with our customers to help them expand their companies around the globe
  • Pitch in on many surprising, daily challenges that come up in an early-stage start up

What We're Looking For:

  • 2+ years of software engineering experience
  • Coding skill in Python, Typecript, C++ or similar. We currently use Python and Typescript, but welcome developers of any background, as long as you can use Python and React.
  • We value the correctness, maintainability, elegance, and testability of code. We want to do things the right way over just getting things ‚Äúdone.‚Äù We‚Äôre strict about our code style and quality so that you don‚Äôt have to spend your time tracking down other peoples‚Äô bugs.
  • Experience in working in financial services is nice, but by no means a requirement.

Our Tech Stack:

  • Python - we have a simple Flask backend, connected to a few other services, all in Python
  • AWS - Docker containers running on ECS
  • Frontend - HTML + CSS + React (NextJS)

You‚Äôll help define the rest of this list. We have plenty of ideas for what technologies make sense here, but we need your help to turn those ideas into product!

Founders

üá®üá¶ Cathy was previously CEO of 42 Technologies (YC W14), a big data platform processing over $4 billion of data for global retailers including AllSaints, Rebecca Minkoff, and Sports Direct. She led enterprise sales, finance, strategy, and operations. [Education: Harvard Business School]

üáÆüá≥ Abeer was previously CTO of Theorem LP (YC W14), a data science and machine learning platform that bought marketplace loans with over $1.5 billion in assets under management (from MIT Endowment, GIC, etc.). He led the research and engineering teams and wrote the algorithms Theorem used to buy over $2B+ worth of loans. [Education: Carnegie Mellon University]

Technology

We use Flask, and React JS on the front end. We're completely dockerized and use AWS

Interview Process

We‚Äôll start with one initial non-technical phone screen, move to a technical one, and then an onsite for technical + behavioral questions

job.title: Product Marketing Lead
job.company_description: Multicurrency account & international payments for businesses
job.description:
About Levro

Levro is a new multicurrency business neobank. We help companies expand overseas by giving them the ability to hold, convert, and pay in/out of 30+ currencies using one account. Businesses can go global and hold $, ‚Ç¨, ¬£, ¬•, etc., convert at better wholesale rates, pay in/out using local payment rails, and automate FX optimization.

About the role

About Levro

Levro is building a new global finance platform for businesses.

Our cornerstone product is a a multicurrency business neobank that allows companies to collect, hold, and pay in 34 currencies within a single interface. We help software and ecommerce companies make international payments as easy as domestic payments, minimizing fees, redtape, and errors .

We are 2x YCombinator batchmates who have experience in regulated financial spaces and expertise with deep enterprise integrations. Abeer built a $1.5B machine learning enabled hedgefund with LPs like MIT and GIC, and Cathy built a profitable big data company that processed $4B of retail data.

We‚Äôre looking for the core team that will build Levro into the operating system for international commerce.

What we‚Äôre hiring for:

We are building a inbound customer acquisition engine from scratch, and are looking for an entrepreneurial, data-driven, cross functional marketer to lead that charge.

We want someone willing to take reasonable risks to define the marketing strategy, and work cross-functionally to execute it

Our ideal candidate is a "full stack" marketer - someone as comfortable writing content and designing collateral as they are setting up and managing customer acquisition campaigns.

What You‚Äôll do:

  • Define and execute Levro's go-to-market messaging - from setting the strategy to writing for our blog, authoring ebooks, make videos, and manage our social media
  • Set up and manage our marketing automation strategy and pair it with an equally strong content marketing approach
  • Serve as the voice of the customer in discussions with product and engineering to help triage feature priorities
  • Wear a "growth hacker" hat - figure out the best ways to attract and retain our target audience
  • Own the top of our funnel - making sure we generate sufficient marketing qualified leads through a combination of prospecting and other lead generation activities
  • Build a team of internal and external specialists to help with scaling our brand

What we‚Äôre looking for:

  • 3-4 years experience in various aspects of marketing - content marketing, social media, paid acquisition
  • Entrepreneurial, with high tolerance for ambiguity and complexity, and efficient with limited resources.
  • Experience working at, or with startups - most of our initial customers will be startups
  • Strong ability to conduct and compile research into how-to guides and eBooks - distilling complex processes and concepts into simple checklists for our clients to better understand the nuances of international banking
  • Proven ability to track, prioritize, and steer multiple concurrent projects to success using data to track progress along the way
  • Action oriented with excellent work ethic and initiative
  • Location: San Francisco or New York office

What makes this job amazing:

  • As an early employee, you will get exposure to the nuances of venture-backed companies. From fundraising and investor conversations to product and customers, we will share what we know so that you can eventually start your own company
  • Your work will matter - you will get to shape the product foundations and build the culture that‚Äôll be at Levro‚Äôs core
  • Levro's goal is to become the best global business bank, you will play a part of that
  • You'll have an opportunity to grow with Levro - as we scale, you will have an opportunity to define the ideal professional path for you, and bring along smart people to complement you
  • The team is amazing, you'll learn and grow alongside some of the most talented people in the industry!
  • Every day is a new challenge.

Founders

Levro was founded by 2x YC batchmates who have experience in regulated financial spaces and expertise with deep enterprise integrations. We understand the unique needs of international business banking and are building a new way for payments to flow around the global economy.

üá®üá¶ Cathy was previously CEO of 42 Technologies (YC W14), a big data platform processing over $4B of data for global retailers including AllSaints, Rebecca Minkoff, and Sports Direct. She closed 42's first $1MM ARR and led enterprise sales, finance, strategy, and operations.

[Education: Harvard Business School]

üáÆüá≥ Abeer was previously CTO of Theorem LP (YC W14), a data science and machine learning platform that bought marketplace loans with over $1.5B AUM (from MIT Endowment, GIC, etc.). He led the research and engineering teams and wrote the algorithms Theorem used to buy over $2B+ worth of loans.

[Education: Carnegie Mellon University]

Technology

We use Flask, and React JS on the front end. We're completely dockerized and use AWS

job.title: Senior Backend Engineer
job.company_description: Generative AI Worlds
job.description:
About Dream3D

Dream3D is an AI research and product company building generative models to simulate and emulate worlds, real and imagined.

About the role
Skills: Python

Dream3D is building a new type of graphics engine for virtual worlds. We‚Äôre tackling hard problems across AI and UI/UX design to build the future of digital computing.

We‚Äôre a team of creative technologists and researchers passionate about exploring our relationships with intelligent systems. We‚Äôre backed by great investors like SNR, Twenty Two VC, Y Combinator, and are looking to grow our founding team.

If this resonates, we want to meet you.

About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a backend engineer to join our team to help power our research and training efforts. This is a in-person role for someone excited about working closely to both end-user product development and ML research and development.

You will work in the core loop of implementing research papers, building datasets, training, and productizing to our end users.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement core data infra + pipelines.
  • Help prototype and scale datasets for both model training and fine-tuning.
  • Work closely with the rest of the team as we build and iterate on product.

Ideally you:

  • Have 3+ years of data / data science / machine learning engineering experience.
  • Highly comfortable in Python, Ray, AWS/GCP.
  • Excited about being close to and participating in both research and product efforts.
  • You have a Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Physics, Applied Math, or Statistics.

We‚Äôre big believers that small, in-person teams are the ones that create the future. We work out of our Brooklyn, New York office.

job.title: Senior/Staff ML Researcher - Generative AI Worlds in Brooklyn, NY
job.company_description: Generative AI Worlds
job.description:
About Dream3D

Dream3D is an AI research and product company building generative models to simulate and emulate worlds, real and imagined.

About the role
Skills: Machine learning, Python, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Torch/PyTorch

Dream3D is building a new type of graphics engine for virtual worlds. We‚Äôre tackling hard problems across computer graphics, AI and UI/UX design to build the future of digital worlds.

We‚Äôre a team of creative technologists and researchers passionate about exploring our relationships with intelligent systems. We‚Äôre backed by great investors like SNR, Twenty Two VC, Y Combinator, and are looking to grow our founding team.

If this resonates, we want to meet you.

About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional machine learning researcher to join our founding team. You‚Äôll be working directly with Tony to implement state-of-the-art research papers, do your own research and when the moment is right, train foundational models.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop state-of-the-art generative models
  • Read, implement and improve the latest papers in this field
  • Rapid prototyping of ideas, approaches, methods etc.

Ideally you:

  • Have 3+ years of machine learning engineering/research experience
  • Track record of implementing research papers in PyTorch
  • Solid understanding of state-of-the-art generative models (VAEs, GANs, Autoregressive, Diffusion, etc.)
  • Knowledge of computer graphics fundamentals (rendering, geometry processing, etc.)

We‚Äôre big believers that small, in-person teams are the ones that create the future. We work out of our Brooklyn, New York office, but are flexible with hybrid work schedules. Ideally you are based in NYC.

job.title: Product Engineer
job.company_description: Social platform for fractional ownership of investment properties.
job.description:
About Fractional

Fractional is a social platform for fractional ownership of investment properties. We‚Äôre on a mission to open the private real estate market to everyone by making it inclusive, educational, collaborative, and fun.

We're well funded with backing from CRV, Y Combinator, Will Smith, Kevin Durant, Unusual Ventures, among others such as founders and leaders of Affirm, Compass, Blend, and Sprout Social.

Democratizing residential real estate investing is just the start, and we‚Äôd love to have you join us to build the future of investing.

About the role
Skills: Node.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, React, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

What We Are Building

Getting started with real estate is an expensive and arduous task, we make it easy. Options are very limited and expensive for most - you either lack the cash and know how to do things yourself or you're stuck with the high fees and limited opportunity that funds offer. We believe that with the right tools and guidance anyone can choose to own, invest, and grow real assets how they want. Our mission is to empower the next generation of real estate investors and operators by building the best products they need to do their best work.

We are a small team with deep experience in fintech, real estate, and SEC regulations backed by Fifth Wall, Left Lane, CRV, and Y Combinator.

What We Look For

  • Prior experience building, launching and maintaining products at scale, bothon the frontend and backend.
  • Sense for small details to help us build beautiful products that our customers love to use.
  • Enjoys working cross-functionally and collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders.
  • Grit and adaptability to thrive with an early-stage team and navigate the unknown.
  • Well-developed interpersonal, written and verbal communication.
  • Passionate about Fractional's mission and empathize with our users and how they'll use our products.

What You'll Do

  • Drive end-to-end design and implementation of product requirements including task break-down, delivery, testing, monitoring, and maintenance.
  • Consistently generate simple and elegant designs, and write high-quality code that can be easily understood and leveraged by others.
  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and the rest of engineering to turn feature/product specs into reality.
  • Influence the features and direction of the platform with your own ideas and proactively identify opportunities to improve business processes.
  • Grow with the company as a technical leader.

What We Offer

  • Health benefitsFull healthcare benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance - for you and your dependents.
  • Time offUnlimited paid vacation that we encourage you to take advantage of.
  • Team eventsRegular off-sites and retreats throughout the year.
  • ToolsA laptop, monitor and any equipment you might need to do your best work.

We are a remote-friendly team with an in-person hub in New York.

Technology

Our tech stack:

  • Frontend: React, Tailwind, Next.js, GraphQL
  • Backend: Node, DynamoDB, AWS
  • Experience with our stack isn't necessary - we can teach you or you can show us your ways.

Fractional is a social platform for fractional ownership of investment properties. We‚Äôre on a mission to open the private real estate market to everyone by making it inclusive, educational, collaborative, and fun.

Current options for real asset investments are limited and expensive.

Many people with the skills to do it themselves lack the cash to get started, whereas others with sufficient capital are stuck with the high fees and limited opportunities typical markets offer.

We believe that with the right tools, guidance, and community, anyone can choose to own, invest in, and grow real assets in their own way.

We're well funded, with backing from Fifth Wall, Left Lane, CRV, Y Combinator, Will Smith, Kevin Durant, and others, such as the founders and leaders of Affirm, Compass, Blend, AirBnB, and Sprout Social. We bring prior experience in fintech, real estate, and securities regulation.

Democratizing real estate is just the start. We‚Äôd love to have you join us to build the future of ownership

What you'll do

  • Drive end-to-end design and implementation of product requirements including task break-down, delivery, testing, monitoring, and maintenance.
  • Consistently generate simple and elegant designs, and write high-quality code that can be easily understood and leveraged by others.
  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and the rest of engineering to turn feature and product specs into reality.
  • Influence the features and direction of the platform with your own ideas and proactively identify opportunities to improve business processes.
  • Grow with the company as a technical leader, including mentoring earlier-career engineers, and helping to shape our systems and culture

What we look for

  • Prior experience building, launching, and maintaining products at scale
  • Sense for small details and shaping speedy, reliable user experiences
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders, such as design and sales
  • Grit and adaptability to thrive with an early-stage team and navigate the unknown
  • Well-developed interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
  • Passion about Fractional's mission, empathizing with our users and how they'll interact our products
  • At least 6 years of engineering experience, including technical leadership (ideally with prior experience at a startup)
  • Knowledge of Typescript, Postgres, GraphQL

Bonus points for

  • Interest or experience in building social or collaboration platforms
  • Marketplace or fintech experience
  • Interest or experience in industries with regulatory or compliance considerations

Preference will be given to candidates who can help build our SF and NYC engineering hub.

What we offer

  • Health benefits Full healthcare benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance - for you and your dependents.
  • Time off We encourage you to take advantage of our unlimited vacation policy.
  • Team events Regular off-sites and retreats throughout the year.
  • Tools A laptop, monitor and any equipment you might need to do your best work.
Technology

Our tech stack:

  • Frontend: React, Tailwind, Next.js, GraphQL
  • Backend: Node, DynamoDB, AWS
  • Experience with our stack isn't necessary - we can teach you or you can show us your ways.

job.title: Founding Backend Software Engineer
job.company_description: Payroll, Banking, Bill Pay For Global Teams
job.description:
About Thera

Thera is building HR for the future of work. Traditional providers are failing to meet the compliance, global, and benefits needs of tomorrow‚Äôs best companies, which will be global and remote from Day 1.

We make it simple and satisfying to set up your company and employees for success, including for busy founders and leaders without HR experience.

Our founding team consists of ex-Palantir and ex-Amazon engineers.

About the role
Skills: Kotlin, Maven, Spring, Java

üå≥ About the Role

We‚Äôre looking for a well-seasoned backend engineer ready to hit the ground running and build the HR platform for the future of work.

üèÜ What You‚Äôll Achieve

  • Lead backend development
  • Combine in house and 3rd party API provider functionality to build holistic HR platform
  • Define our engineering culture and best practices from the ground up
  • Collaborate closely with our CTO and CEO and directly impact product roadmap

‚ú® About You

You are a strong engineer who moves fast while keeping scalability in mind. You will thrive in our culture if you:

  • Have a strong bias towards action and prioritize execution above else
  • Easily handle the unstructured environment of fast moving startups
  • Have the hunger to grow together with Thera as we scale up

üìà Requirements

  • Fast-learner: you are proactive and able to pick up new things quickly
  • Builder: you have experience working with Kotlin / Java, Spring Boot, or similar frameworks as well as DynamoDB or other NoSQL databases
  • Product minded: you genuinely want to build something people want, you enjoy talking to users and learning their needs

üöÄ Bonus Points

  • Previous experience in fintech / payroll / HR tech
  • Previous experience building and deploying on AWS
  • Previous experience at high-growth, fast-paced startups
  • If you‚Äôre a builder who wants to shape the future of HR, join us! ‚ú®
Technology

BE:

  • Java SpringBoot
  • DynamoDB
  • Microservice architecture

FE:

  • Typescript
  • React
  • NextJS
  • Tailwind CSS

job.title: Founding Engineer
job.company_description: Background task orchestration and visibility
job.description:
About Hatchet

Hatchet is a distributed, fault-tolerant task queue designed to solve scaling problems like concurrency, fairness, and rate limiting. Our mission is to provide developers with a simple, powerful, and reliable way to distribute and manage background tasks and workflows, enabling them to focus on building great applications.

As multi-time YC founders and CTOs, we have felt the pains of managing complex background tasks and workflows ourselves. We have a transparent, collaborative, and fast-paced culture with a flat organizational structure.

We‚Äôre engineers building for engineers. We work closely with our customers in slack to understand their needs and help them achieve their goals. We‚Äôre solving the hard infra and architecture problems that are as rewarding as they are thought provoking. Here‚Äôs an example of a problem we‚Äôve recently drilled into: https://docs.hatchet.run/blog/multi-tenant-queues.

About the role
Skills: Go, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL

This is an in-person role: we expect at least 3 days a week in our office in Brooklyn, NYC. 

Need to know: Go, Distributed Systems, Kubernetes, Docker, gRPC, PostgreSQL

Nice to know: Typescript, Python, Github Actions, GCP or AWS

We are seeking a Founding Engineer to join our early-stage team as our first hire! As a senior Go application engineer with experience implementing and scaling services that run as background tasks, you will play a critical role in building our platform and driving the technical direction of our company.

This is a hands-on keyboard position that will involve working on all parts of our stack, from the core task orchestration engine to the worker SDKs, and collaborating with other engineers and founders. It's a great opportunity for someone to create a lasting impact not only on the primary product but also on the company's values and vision, given our early stage.

As the first member of our engineering team, you will set the culture of collaborating with our customers. We all share the responsibility of providing frontline support and building relationships with our customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and maintain the core components of the Hatchet task queue, ensuring high performance, reliability, and scalability.
  • Collaborate with the team to build and improve the worker SDKs in various languages, making it easy for developers to integrate Hatchet into their applications.
  • Help define and execute the technical roadmap for our platform, balancing technical debt and innovation to ensure we can deliver on our business goals.
  • Contribute to the development of best practices, coding standards, and documentation to maintain a high-quality codebase.
  • Mentor, and guide other engineers as the team grows, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.
  • Provide support to customers and improve documentation as needed.

Qualifications:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience as a software engineer, preferably a strong focus or interest in Go and distributed systems.
  • Deep understanding of concurrency, parallel processing, and asynchronous programming patterns.
  • Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP or AWS, and experience designing and deploying highly available, fault-tolerant systems.
  • Knowledge of message queues, pub/sub systems, and event-driven architectures.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and customers.
  • Passion for building scalable, reliable, and developer-friendly tools and platforms.

Benefits:

  • 150k-210k base compensation, 0.5%-2% equity
  • Full benefits package, including premium healthcare coverage for you and unlimited PTO.
  • Up to 2 work from home days per week.
  • Metrocard allowance

job.location: New York, NY, US / Remote (United States)
job.title: Customer Success Manager
job.company_description: Helping 100+ brands bring all quality and compliance operations together in a single unified platform
job.description:
About Factored Quality

Helping consumer goods brands run Quality Control across their supply chains.

About the role

About Factored Quality:

At Factored Quality, we're building one of the last missing pieces of modern commerce infrastructure: a platform for consumer brands to manage their quality control inspections.

Factored Quality was started by a team of software engineers, data scientists, and supply chain managers - all focused on one goal: enable entrepreneurs to bring their products to market faster, simpler, and cheaper. We worry about managing brands‚Äô quality control so they don't have to. We aim to redefine how quality control is managed, and need strong engineers to make it happen.

At FQ, you‚Äôll support every aspect of the business, developing a holistic understanding of our customers and product. We're looking for people who are passionate about creating the future of commerce enablement and building the tools needed to help people quit their day jobs to start new e-commerce businesses.

Our team is composed of 20 folks across our US and Hong Kong offices. We've raised more than $7.2 Million to date from an incredible team of investors and operators like Amity Ventures, Dynamo Ventures,Y-Combinator and Vinyl VC.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Factored Quality is searching for a Customer Success Manager ****to join the team. Our ideal candidate is someone who:

  • Someone that has a solid grasp of the hardline product development cycle and good understanding of supply chain
  • Can effectively articulate and sell Factored Quality's value proposition and range of products and services
  • Can act almost as a consultant for quality control for the customers brand
  • Can proactively identify new opportunities for revenue growth - either through new customer identification, new product or feature ideas, or new market expansion

The Customer Success Manager role can be expected to interact with our leadership, operations, and product management team.

Factored Quality is a team of individuals whom are genuinely excited by solving hard problems, and are eager to work hard to find solutions. We don‚Äôt want people who just want a job, we want people who want to build.

The Job:

We‚Äôre seeking a Customer Success Manager to help Factored Quality navigate its next growth stage.

Core categories of responsibilities for this role will be to serve as points for:

  • General:
    • Act as the single point of contact for 30+ accounts. Cater to every need they have, be it technical, operational, or commercial, looping in the relevant team when needed.
    • Your success will be measured by the number of accounts you manage (1), the size of the accounts (2), and the NPS for your accounts (3).
    • We are still young and defining/ iterating our current SOPs. We expect your constructive input on how to make customer operations smoother and frictionless and improve our internal operations.
  • Onboarding:
    • You will take the customer from onboarding onwards, ensuring the customer is ready to hit the ground running and place their first bookings with us right away.
    • You will need to support the customer in getting their suppliers and product information and any integrations that need to be set.
    • You will support the customer by clarifying their quality needs and ensuring they book the service they need. For many of our customers, this is their first dab with quality control. You need to know our services and truly understand the customer's needs.
  • Day to Day:
    • As you will be the face of the company, you will need to build a relationship with the client, but you should be comfortable setting boundaries and expectations within reason towards the customer.
    • Analyze the customer reports and provide feedback to the customer on potential next steps and additional services FQ is offering that will help them improve their overall product and supplier quality/ performance.
    • You will act as a bridge between the customer and the Ops execution team, ensuring their requests are translated to checklists and are taken into account during inspections and audits.
    • Own partnership with Product, bringing ‚Äúvoice of the customer‚Äù to Product teams, including interlock, reporting, metrics, and facilitating customer engagement (e.g., surveys, interviews, etc.)
    • You will ensure all customer technical requests are answered/ resolved.
  • Growth:
    • Together with an Account Executive, you will seek opportunities to scale the accounts you are managing.

You should apply to this role if:

  • Have 3+ year experience with hardline product development cycles and good understanding of supply chain manufacturing is HIGHLY PREFERRED!
  • Experience in account management, operations, consulting, or client relations roles is a major plus.
  • You should only apply if you have experience managing US and/ or EU accounts.
  • A customer-focused mindset is where you maintain customer empathy constantly throughout your entire build process.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills - we deeply value transparency and accountability dictated by how we communicate.
  • You consistently meet deadlines (you‚Äôre probably the person in your friend group pushing everyone out the door to ensure you make a dinner reservation on time).
  • If you are excited to grow your career and move into more senior roles.

Working Hours:

Because our work involves coordination with our Hong Kong office and our New York Office, there are meetings that are scheduled outside of traditional 9-5 working hours. That being said, we trust all team members to manage their schedules and take appropriate measures to care for themselves and their well-being.

This role is expected to be available between 9:00 - 5:00 EST.

Benefits and Compensation:

FQ offers the following benefits:

  • Unlimited paid time off (with the expectation that you take two weeks of vacation each year)
  • Paid sick days
  • Competitive maternity/ paternity leave
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • 401k (US based employees)
  • Home office stipend

The Process:

Please submit your application and we will reach out if there is a potential fit.

At Factored Quality  we are constantly refining our hiring process to be as inclusive, transparent, and respectful of applicants‚Äô time as possible. As part of this process, you may be asked to complete a paid assessment based on the role.

Factored Quality  is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We firmly believe that a diversity of experience, perspectives, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and to better results for our clients. We strongly encourage diverse candidates to apply.

Technology

React frontend, Phoenix/Elixir backend stack.

job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.company_description: AI underwriting automation and fraud prevention
job.description:
About Two Dots

Two Dots is working to remake the way lending is done using AI, starting with real estate. Our founding team are Goldman, Google, and Blend alum, and we're always interested in talking with other extremely intelligent and hard working people.

About the role
Skills: Machine learning, Python, SQL, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Torch/PyTorch

This is a full-time in-person role in Los Angeles. The office is on the beach.

Role requirements:
1. Existent (2+ yrs) non-academic experience writing software professionally
2. Ability to improve models for key information extraction, named entity recognition and matching, text classification over semi-structured financial documents
3. Experience with active learning, HITL driven workflows, and working with large labeling and quality teams a plus

4. Carries their own weight, serviceable as a fullstack engineer
5. Open minded, creative, charismatic, and extremely hard working
6. Cares about implications of what they do, at least mild interest in economics, real estate and debt markets, issues in consumer finance

Technology

We use spaces, not tabs.

Interview Process

Interview Process

Phone Screen

This is just a quick chat to understand if we're aligned. We'll ask if you're okay with working in person in Los Angeles, your timelines, and why you're interested in working for Two Dots.

Technical Screen

We will spend 45 minutes working on a short technical challenge that the company actually faced and solved in its earliest days. This interview is mostly there to elicit how you think and communicate about the problem.

Interview Process

If we think we might be a good fit for each other, you will travel to LA for a full day with us. There will be a whiteboarding and pair coding exercise tailored to your background, along with informal discussions about how you can help the company and how we can help you grow your career.

Timing

We should be able to give you an answer within a week of your in-person interview.

About the role

Two Dots is a fraud prevention and consumer underwriting focused financial technology company. We improve outdated processes at our clients and give them superpowers they can use to make better decisions.

About the role:

We are seeking an Operations Analyst to join our team and play a critical role in dealing with complicated support cases, advising on operational and support management programs, and performing financial document analysis. You will work closely with engineering, operations management, and customer success.

Responsibilities:

  • Consumer underwriting - collect information from messy financial documents, using a combination of AI tools, manual inspection, and forensic tools, to detect fraud or help consumers that have unclear or complicated financial situations express that to our clients
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve customer complaints and provide solutions
  • Manage and maintain inbound support inquiries through Intercom
  • Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree, quantitative or analytical degrees preferred
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously

Additional equity compensation will be provided in the form of an option grant

Technology

We use spaces, not tabs.

job.title: Senior Product Designer (Founding Team)
job.company_description: Modern on-call and incident management
job.description:
About Rootly

At Rootly, we are a mission to be the go-to way companies respond when things go wrong, helping every organization be more reliable. We do this by building an industry leading incident management platform that allows companies around the world consistently and quickly resolve incidents. We are not simply transforming an industry, we are carving an entirely new +$B segment ourselves and need incredible talent to achieve this ambitious goal together.

Customers love Rootly. Some of the fastest growing companies around the world such as NVIDIA, Figma, Canva, Tripadvisor, Squarespace and more rely on Rootly to power their critical incident management process. They obsess over our delightful enterprise-ready platform and unique partnership model. See why our customers have reviewed us 5 stars on G2.

Investors love Rootly. We are backed by some of the most respected funds in the world from Y Combinator to operators like the CTO of Dropbox and GitHub. We'd be happy to disclose our entire funding and profitability picture live during the interview. As a culture we relentlessly put transparency first. We conduct monthly financial reviews as a team so everyone has a pulse on the health of the business and publish what we are building in our weekly changelog.

About the role

About Rootly

At Rootly, we are a mission to be the go-to way companies respond when things go wrong, helping every organization be more reliable. We do this by building an industry leading incident management platform that allows companies around the world consistently and quickly resolve incidents. We are not simply transforming an industry, we are carving an entirely new +$B segment ourselves and need incredible talent to achieve this ambitious goal together.

Customers love Rootly. Some of the fastest growing companies around the world such as NVIDIA, Figma, Canva, Tripadvisor, Squarespace and more rely on Rootly to power their critical incident management process. They obsess over our delightful enterprise-ready platform and unique partnership model. See why our customers have reviewed us 5 stars on G2.

Investors love Rootly. We are backed by some of the most respected funds in the world from Y Combinator to operators like the CTO of Dropbox and GitHub. We'd be happy to disclose our entire funding and profitability picture live during the interview. As a culture we relentlessly put transparency first. We conduct monthly financial reviews as a team so everyone has a pulse on the health of the business and publish what we are building in our weekly changelog.

About the Role

This is a ground floor opportunity to be one of the first designers at Rootly and tangibly shape our trajectory. You will experience the balance of being scrappy and operating at scale. You will own the design and brand end-to-end (not only for product but also marketing) with unbound amounts of creativity and autonomy. If you want your work to influence how thousands of our users work everyday and in an environment with the shortest feedback loop possible, this is right for you. There is no better place to see your work on display.

The Ideal Candidate

  • 4+ years of experience with B2B, developer tooling, or enterprise software product design.
  • Has built design systems from scratch and familiar with building/maintaining component libraries. 
  • Experience owning features through the entire design process, from user research to visual design.
  • Experience designing a variety of UX/Visual Design artifacts, such as: ecosystems, flows, wireframes, detailed UI, prototypes, etc.
  • Craves working iteratively with customers for user testing, interviews, and more.
  • Beyond just product design, has a background in illustration as this will support other functions such as marketing, sales and DevRel.
  • Is a master at prioritizing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with a good sense of the trade-offs between good vs. perfect.
  • Act as the UX advocate for users to inform our product and design strategies, and use quantitative data and qualitative feedback to inform the design decisions iteratively.
  • Has an understanding of the impact of design decisions on product/engineering but also sales.
  • A meticulous or fanatical attention to detail...a poorly labelled folder or an image with one pixel off drives you crazy.
  • Examples of developing and conveying ideas clearly in a written and visual format--clearly demonstrate how your designs tackle customers' problems or add value to their lives.

Benefits

  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision
  • 3 weeks vacation + unlimited sick/mental health days + company-wide shutdown EOY
  • M2 MacBook Pro of choice
  • $1,000 for health and wellness
  • $1,000 for home office
  • $1,000 for visiting a teammate located in a different geography
  • WeWork membership
  • Weekly happy hour on Friday
  • Learning and advancement budget at your discretion
  • Annual retreat - at least once a year we gather together in person üèùÔ∏è
  • Ground floor opportunity to be an early member of a fast growing venture-backed startup

 

Rootly is an equal opportunity employer. We aim to create an environment where every team member at Rootly feels like they belong so they can have a greater impact on our business and customers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Technology
  • Rails, Postgres and Redis in the backend
  • Sidekiq for background jobs
  • Hosted on AWS with Heroku
  • Terraform for infrastructure as code
  • GitHub, Slack, Notion

We'd be happy to disclose our entire funding and profitability picture live during the interview. As a culture we relentlessly put transparency first. We conduct monthly financial reviews as a team so everyone has a pulse on the health of the business and publish what we are building in our weekly changelog.

About the role

About Rootly

At Rootly, we are on a mission to be the go-to way companies respond when things go wrong, helping every organization be more reliable. We do this by building an industry leading incident management platform that allows companies around the world to consistently and quickly resolve incidents. We are not simply transforming an industry, we are carving an entirely new +$B segment ourselves and need incredible talent to achieve this ambitious goal together.

Customers love Rootly. Some of the fastest growing companies around the world such as NVIDIA, Figma, Canva, Tripadvisor, Squarespace and more rely on Rootly to power their critical incident management process. They obsess over our delightful enterprise-ready platform and unique partnership model. See why our customers have reviewed us 5 stars on G2.

Investors love Rootly. We are backed by some of the most respected funds in the world from Y Combinator to operators like the CTO of Dropbox and GitHub. We'd be happy to disclose our entire funding and profitability picture live during the interview. As a culture we relentlessly put transparency first. We conduct monthly financial reviews as a team so everyone has a pulse on the health of the business and publish what we are building in our weekly changelog.

 

About the Role

Rootly is seeking a creative and results-driven Demand Generation Specialist to join our marketing team. This role is crucial for driving the company's revenue growth through effective lead generation and marketing funnel optimization strategies. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a knack for identifying opportunities, crafting compelling campaigns, and leveraging data to drive decision-making and improve ROI.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive demand generation strategy to generate leads, accelerate the sales pipeline, and achieve sales targets.
  • Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to create targeted campaigns for various segments, leveraging channels such as email, social media, PPC, SEO, and events.
  • Produce compelling copy that resonates with our audience and effectively communicates the value of our niche product.
  • Manage and optimize marketing automation and lead nurturing processes through email, content, and social channels.
  • Design and implement A/B testing strategies to improve conversion rates across all channels.
  • Track and analyze campaign performance and marketing metrics to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Work closely across the marketing and sales teams to ensure that messaging and materials are aligned with demand generation goals and strategies.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities to adapt and optimize demand generation strategies.
  • Manage the marketing budget allocated for demand generation activities, ensuring maximum ROI.

 

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience in demand generation or digital marketing, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment.
  • Experience in marketing a SaaS product to a technical/developer audience (ideally DevOps or ITSM software)
  • Proven track record of creating and executing successful demand generation campaigns.
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
  • Experience with marketing automation tools (e.g., Mailchimp) and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
  • Creative thinker with the ability to innovate and adapt in a fast-paced startup environment.

 

Benefits

  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision
  • 3 weeks vacation + unlimited sick/mental health days + company-wide shutdown EOY
  • M2 MacBook Pro of choice
  • $1,000 for health and wellness
  • $1,000 for home office
  • $1,000 for visiting a teammate located in a different geography
  • WeWork membership
  • Weekly happy hour on Friday
  • Learning and advancement budget at your discretion
  • Annual retreat - at least once a year we gather together in person üèùÔ∏è
  • Ground floor opportunity to be an early member of a fast growing venture-backed startup
Technology
  • Rails, Postgres and Redis in the backend
  • Sidekiq for background jobs
  • Hosted on AWS with Heroku
  • Terraform for infrastructure as code
  • GitHub, Slack, Notion

job.location: San Jose, CA, US / San Francisco, CA, US / Palo Alto, CA, US / Mountain View, CA, US / Menlo Park, CA, US / Remote (US)
job.title: Founding Engineer at rapidly growing Generative AI focused healthtech co
job.company_description: Addressing Loneliness and Isolation for Seniors
job.description:
About Reviving Mind

At Reviving Mind, we are on a mission to reverse chronic illnesses for the older adult population by addressing loneliness and isolation. Loneliness and isolation is an epidemic that is the equivalent of smoking 15 cigarettes a day and considered to be worse than obesity.

We take great pride in providing the best clinical and product experience for clients and patients, as well as developing automated tools and processes to allow our providers to scale.

This is a very exciting opportunity to leverage your skills and talent to join a rapidly growing early stage telehealth company.

About the role
Skills: Machine learning, Python, Natural Language Processing, Software Architecture

We are a team of multiple time YCombinator founders building a multi-modal (Voice first) AI-agent marketplace for the broader healthcare sector addressing the overhead in clinical operations and poor patient engagement. We have strong traction and a working MVP.

We are looking for a hands-on Founding CTO/Founding Engineer that has experience with AI/ML/GenAI and is excited about it‚Äôs application in an antiquated industry like Healthcare where there is massive opportunity.

Some Challenges You‚Äôll Tackle:

‚Ä¢ AI strategy for Neurality Health's Saas clients (Provider, Health Systems/ACOs, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Research and build cutting edge Voice and Text based conversational AI agents

‚Ä¢ Developing consumable APIs to propagate back-office workflows and integrate with client systems (EHRs, etc)

‚Ä¢ Manage stages of the continuous development and release process

‚Ä¢ Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code

You Should Have:

‚Ä¢ Proven experience as an ML Engineer or similar role

‚Ä¢ Understanding of ML/NLP techniques for text representation, semantic extraction techniques, data structures and modeling

‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of text representation techniques (such as n-grams, bag of words, sentiment analysis etc), statistics and classification algorithms Experience with GPT

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Python (and some frontend React/NextJS)

‚Ä¢ Ability to write robust and testable code

‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements

‚Ä¢ A knack for benchmarking and optimization

‚Ä¢ Ability to effectively design software architecture

‚Ä¢ Team player with excellent written and spoken English communication skills

Ideal candidate has a PhD/MS in CS/EE/or equivalent experience in engineering field

This is an exciting time to join early a very motivated team of experienced founders with multiple exits working on cutting edge AI for healthcare. We are looking to work with an exceptionally intelligent and motivated technologist, and compensate very generously with 10%-20% founder equity.

Technology
  • React
  • React Native
  • DynamoDB
  • Lambdas
  • Python

job.title: QA Automation Engineer - SDET2
job.company_description: A flexible work app that connects businesses with hourly workers.
job.description:
About Instawork

Instawork is the on-demand staffing app for hospitality gigs. We quickly and reliably match businesses with nearby qualified workers. We‚Äôre excited to enable our Professionals, a new generation of the emerging, diverse workforce, to be a part of the growing gig economy.

We‚Äôve been fortunate to be funded by some of the greatest investors in Silicon Valley: Benchmark (Bill Gurley), Y Combinator, SV Angel, Crunchfund, Steve Chen (co-founder of YouTube), Mike Vernal (VP of Product at Facebook), among many more.

About the role

At Instawork, we‚Äôre driven by our vision to create economic opportunity for local businesses and skilled hourly professionals  in communities around the world. With a growing number of hub cities across the world in the U.S., Canada, India, and beyond, we‚Äôre looking for top talent to help rapidly scale our high-tech and high-touch labor marketplace. Our accomplished and dedicated team is passionate about our mission and committed to crafting revolutionary products, all with the backing of our world-class investors, including Benchmark, Spark Capital, Craft Ventures, Greylock Capital, Y Combinator, and more!

This role is open for our Bangalore office and requires hybrid work (2 days in-office per week). 

We welcome recent graduates to apply!

Our QA team is growing and needs someone who is laser-focused on raising the software quality bar in a fast-paced environment. This position will give great exposure to the entire lifecycle of cross-platform development and provide a strong foundation for future roles in development / QA. This person will be responsible for building test automation, communicating quality updates across the engineering/product organizations, and solidifying best practices in testing activities across the organization. 

What You'll Do:

  • Research, Design, and Implement automation framework for tests. Mobile testing (IOS & Android) is the priority and we are willing to train people who have non-Mobile experience
  • Automate functional, regression, and smoke tests using internal and open source tools 
  • Create tooling around the entire testing workflow, all the way from test case management, test data creation, automatic bug captures, test progress measurement etc. 
  • Define test specifications for functional, integration and performance testing
  • Manage and configure build servers used for running automation 
  • Work in collaboration with development team in continuous build & deployment process
  • Report test coverage and participate in troubleshooting 
  • Manual testing and coverage for new features that have not yet been automated; Perform Black Box and White Box testing 
  • Create and maintain test plans as our product grows in functionality

Who You Are:

  • 2-3+ years experience with UI Automation testing tools. Bonus for Mobile (iOS/Android) experience using Appium and Selenium
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related field
  • Programming experience in Python + Javascript or similar language
  • Thorough knowledge of automation testing tools and release processes 
  • Knowledge of Relational Database such as MySQL is preferred
  • Self-motivated, especially in learning new software tools and best practices in software quality assurance
  • Startup mentality: self-starter, proactive, flexible
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • You straddle a fine line between QA, software and DevOps engineering

A variety of factors are considered when determining someone‚Äôs compensation including a candidate‚Äôs professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above.

Why Explore a career at Instawork

Everyone at Instawork works across the stack. You'll have the opportunity to work backend systems work at scale, build frontend user experiences, and work with Product & Business to make the product meaningful.

We work hard and we work fast. We err on the side of being bold and embrace + celebrate failure, because we'd rather make bets on great features at the expense of shipping some bad ones.

 

Perks

Free  snacks ‚Ä¢ Health Insurance ‚Ä¢ Personal Insurance ‚Ä¢ Flexible Hours ‚Ä¢ Maternity/Paternity Leave ‚Ä¢ Broadband Reimbursement ‚Ä¢ Home Office Setup Allowance

 

Our Values

Bias for Action -- We are a growing team and an evolving product. We want a team of do‚Äôers to drive the company forward, even if it means making decisions with incomplete information or being wrong.

Act Like an Owner -- Treat this company as though it is your own. Execute on the fundamentals, and act creatively to drive growth. Your ability to drive impact in any part of our company is only limited by your courage and conviction, not your job title.

Always Be Learning -- We are changing an entire industry. We strive to learn from each other and get better each day, week, and month, so that our team‚Äôs learnings can compound and we can all improve, together.

Empathy, Trust, Candor -- Empathy for our business partners and professionals means we put ourselves in their shoes. Empathy for our colleagues means we are always upfront and honest with each other, which comes from trust.

About Instawork

Founded in 2016, Instawork_ is the leading flexible work app for local, hourly professionals. Its digital marketplace connects thousands of businesses and more than five million workers, filling a critical role in local economies. Instawork has been featured on CBS News, the Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, Associated Press, and more. In 2022, Instawork was ranked among the country‚Äôs top 10% of fastest-growing companies by Inc. 5000 and was included in the Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup list. Instawork was also named the 2022 ACE Award recipient for ‚ÄúBest Innovation‚Äù and one of the ‚ÄúBest Business Apps‚Äù by Business Insider. Instawork helps businesses in the food & beverage, hospitality, and warehouse/logistics industries fill temporary and permanent job opportunities in more than 25 markets across the U.S. and Canada. _

_For more information visit _www.instawork.com

We value diversity on our team and firmly believe Instawork is stronger when we hire people who make their own unique contributions to our culture. We welcome all applicants and encourage candidates from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. 

_To learn more about our company values, please visit: _https://info.instawork.com/about

Technology

Django, React, React Native, AWS, Neo4J

https://engineering.instawork.com/

job.location: Miami, FL, US / Remote (New York, NY, US; S√£o Paulo, SP, BR)
job.title: Marketing Lead
job.company_description: AI estimator & agent for remodelers.
job.description:
About Handoff

Handoff is a new mobile & web app for the $500 billion market of remodeling contractors in the US. We use generative AI technology to provide Remodelers a fast, accurate, and intuitive way to create construction cost estimates in minutes. There are 600,000+ contractors in the US who could be the Users of Handoff and we're looking for teammates as passionate as we are to help us win this market.

Handoff has also established itself as the market leader for construction pricing data and integrations with the top construction materials suppliers. The team at Handoff is distributed worldwide and comes from top technology companies such as Apple, Tesla, and WeWork.

About the role

Handoff is a new mobile & web app for the $500 billion market of remodeling contractors in the US. We use generative AI technology to provide Remodelers a fast, accurate, and intuitive way to create construction cost estimates in minutes. There are 600,000+ contractors in the US who could be the Users of Handoff and we're looking for teammates as passionate as we are to help us win this market.

Handoff is developed by 1build, a venture-backed technology company with origins in Silicon Valley. 1build has established itself as the market leader for construction pricing data and integrations with the top construction materials suppliers. The team at 1build is distributed worldwide and comes from top technology companies such as Apple, Tesla, and WeWork.

As a member of the Marketing team, you will:

  • Be our go-to-market trailblazer, helping Handoff discover the most profitable acquisition channels and develop the systems that allow us to optimize those channels.
  • Achieve rapid growth in leads in the Ideal Customer Profile (residential remodeling contractors) while decreasing cost of acquisition.
  • Develop and grow unpaid channels, including SEO, affiliate/influencer marketing, and social media.
  • Grow and manage our Facebook community to build into a growth channel.
  • Demonstrate expertise in marketing technology tools such as Hubspot, Meta/Google ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and Ahrefs (or similar).
  • Produce excellent written content in English that engages readers and effectively communicates the value of our product.
  • Leverage social media to generate customer acquisition and optimize content for SEO (understand keywords, backlinks, indexing, etc.).
  • Run quick experiments to understand what works and what doesn't, and optimize marketing efforts accordingly.
  • Measure, quantify, and optimize marketing initiatives to achieve maximum impact with limited resources.
  • Assist product and sales teams with marketing collateral, campaigns, and other support as needed.

About you:

  • Product-minded, with experience working with and selling product-led SaaS.
  • Tech-savvy, always finding ways to make your process more efficient and effective.
  • Excited by the challenge of developing and optimizing acquisition channels from 0 to 1.
  • Proactive problem-solver, finding workarounds and removing blockers.
  • Passionate about being part of a startup environment and rolling up your sleeves to get things done.

job.title: Join Us as Front End Engineer in Atlanta, GA
job.company_description: Accelerate development by simulating production conditions with real traffic.
job.description:
About Speedscale

Speedscale is a Y Combinator venture-backed startup out of Atlanta that automatically validates the performance of new code using production traffic. We‚Äôre building a really interesting product with lots of challenging technical problems that need to be solved. As our startup moves to the next stage, we need help upgrading our data collection and storage services using golang, Kubernetes and cloud services. Every day we solve never seen before problems in bleeding edge tech. This is a great opportunity to wear many hats in a tight knit team.

About the role
Skills: React

Excited about revolutionizing the infrastructure software landscape? Join our dynamic team at Speedscale, a Y Combinator- and VC-backed company based in Atlanta, GA. We‚Äôre seeking a talented Front End Engineer who is well-versed in React to contribute to our innovative platform. If you thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, we want to hear from you!

To be considered for this position a successful candidate ideally enjoys being challenged, presents proven skills and knowledge working with front end technologies and enjoys working in a result-oriented work environment hand-in-hand with the founders. The ideal candidate will need to be someone who is proactive and works well individually as well as with the team.

The Job

Employment: Full time
Flexibility: Hybrid, based in Atlanta, GA

  • As a Front End Engineer, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience of our platform. You will collaborate closely with our development team to implement scalable, performant, and visually appealing user interfaces using React.
  • You‚Äôll take ownership of front end development, from concept to deployment, ensuring the highest standards of quality and usability are met.
  • Partnering with the founders, you‚Äôll contribute to strategic decision-making regarding product development and user interface design.
  • You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive innovation within the SaaS industry.
  • We value teamwork and collaboration, so you‚Äôll actively participate in code reviews, brainstorming sessions, and cross-functional initiatives to drive continuous improvement.

You‚Äôll Be Successful If:

  • You have a strong background in front end development, with expertise in React and related technologies.
  • Experience with SaaS platforms and understanding of best practices in UI/UX design is highly desirable.
  • You thrive in a startup environment, demonstrating adaptability, creativity, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication skills are essential, as you‚Äôll be collaborating closely with team members and stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôre passionate about staying up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in front end development, continuously seeking opportunities for learning and growth.

Why Speedscale?

Speedscale is improving the lives of software engineers with the capabilities of Production Traffic Replication. Production Traffic Replication helps engineers build resilient cloud-native apps by simulating production conditions, multiplying traffic or mocking 3rd party dependencies.  Speedscale is revolutionizing how microservices are validated in software development.

What To Expect:

  • Immediately see the results of your hard work ‚Äî startups move fast!
  • Opportunity to make a huge impact with equity upside
  • Flexible hours and unlimited vacation
  • Strong team culture with hybrid work environment; opportunity to work from Atlanta office one day a week 
  • Strong Company Values
    • Integrity
    • Attitude of Service
    • Respect
    • Resourceful
  • Work side-by-side with Founders, actively lead business and product direction, architecture, and tooling
  • Competitive salary and health, dental and vision insurance

If you‚Äôre ready to take on an exciting challenge and be part of a dynamic team driving innovation in the SaaS space, apply now!

Speedscale is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

Technology

We love Kubernetes, golang, nodejs, react and services from the top three cloud providers (like S3, GKE, Kinesis, etc). Our tech is constantly evolving but those technologies form the basis. Everything we use in our core product is the latest and greatest.

Our customers are usually bigger companies which means we get to work new stuff every day.

job.title: Solution Architect
job.company_description: Workflow software for solar & energy contractors ‚òÄÔ∏èüòé
job.description:
About Coperniq

Coperniq is pioneering the future of the energy sector. Our workflow software specifically caters to solar and energy contractors, enabling them to transcend traditional boundaries and become the utility companies of the future.

Our platform simplifies and streamlines operations by replacing Salesforce, spreadsheets, pencil-&-paper, and other disjointed workarounds with a comprehensive, industry-specific application that serves the unique needs of the energy workforce.

By reducing soft costs per installation and accelerating project completion times, Coperniq dramatically increases operational efficiency. Further, we help transform service calls from a cost burden into a revenue engine by integrating real-time health checks for installed systems, automating service tickets, and driving referral revenue.

In essence, Coperniq is more than just a platform ‚Äì it's a launchpad for the energy contractors of the future. By helping our users deploy projects faster, maintain systems effectively, and facilitate energy trade, we're paving the way for the next generation of utility companies.

Fresh off our Seed round and backed by Ycombinator and prominent investors, your impact at this pivotal growth stage will be transformative.

About the role

About Coperniq:
Coperniq is pioneering the future of the energy sector. We are transforming solar and energy contractors into the utility companies of tomorrow. Our platform replaces outdated methods and fragmented tools with a unified, industry-specific workflow that radically enhances operational efficiency and customer value. Coperniq is backed by Y Combinator and Initialized, founded by Y Combinator‚Äôs CEO, Garry Tan.

What You'll Do

  • Serve as the technical point of contact for Coperniq's prospective and current customers, guiding them on best practices for integrating and leveraging our platform.

  • Work closely with the sales, customer success and engineering teams to design solutions tailored to customer needs, especially when it comes to integrating with other tools and systems.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical challenges related to integrations and configurations of the Coperniq platform.

  • Act as a bridge between customers and internal teams, ensuring that feedback and insights are seamlessly integrated into product development and improvement.

Responsibilities

  1. Engage with prospective and current customers to understand their technical requirements and guide them on how to best utilize Coperniq in their environment.

  2. Design and implement integration solutions between Coperniq and customers' existing tools and systems.

  3. Collaborate with the engineering team to identify any custom requirements and work on delivering tailored solutions.

  4. Monitor and analyze customer's usage and integration patterns to identify potential issues or areas for enhancement.

  5. Handle and resolve complex technical inquiries and challenges related to Coperniq's integrations and configurations.

  6. Create and maintain technical documentation related to integration best practices, API usage, and other relevant topics.

  7. Establish strong feedback loops with sales, customer success, product, and engineering teams to ensure that customer insights are at the forefront of product development.

  8. Assist in training and onboarding new members within the team, helping them understand Coperniq's technical landscape and customer needs.

Qualifications

  1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

  2. 3+ years of experience in a solutions engineering or software engineering role, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment.

  3. Experience with modern integration tools, platforms, and cloud services

  4. Strong understanding of software integrations, API implementations, systems architecture, and technical documentation

  5. Familiarity with solar or any other blue-collar industry practices and challenges is a big plus.

  6. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts in a user-friendly manner.

  7. A proactive approach to problem-solving and a strong desire to ensure customer success with Coperniq.

  8. Proven track record of working collaboratively in a team environment and managing multiple stakeholders and priorities.

Compensation and Benefits

  • Base Salary: $80,000 - $140,000

  • Stock Options: 0.05% - 0.2%

  • Comprehensive Health Benefits: 99% coverage of medical, dental, and vision insurance; 50% coverage for dependents.

  • Paid Time Off (PTO): 3 weeks per year

  • Professional Development Opportunities: Access to training and development courses to enhance professional growth

Why Join Coperniq?

Joining Coperniq means participating in a mission that is set to redefine the energy sector. You'll have a pivotal role in shaping our company's future while helping our customers transition into the new utility companies of the future. If you share our ambition to make a significant impact and usher in the future of energy, we'd love to hear from you.

Role

At Coperniq, you will lead the charge in our quest to redefine the energy sector as our Head of Growth. If you are passionate about uncovering untapped markets, unlocking opportunities, and propelling a tech start-up into its next phase of expansion, we look forward to hearing from you. In this pivotal role, you will be reporting directly to our Founder/CEO, Abdullah Al Zandani.

Responsibilities

  1. Develop and execute a growth strategy, targeting specific KPIs such as lead generation, conversion rates, and revenue growth.

  2. Optimize Facebook Ads, Google Ads, SEO, using campaign metrics.

  3. Build and guide a marketing team fostering innovation and data-centricity.

  4. Collaborate with Sales on conducting demos and opportunity conversions.

  5. Adapt strategies in response to market trends and insights.

  6. Foster brand visibility through community-building activities such as webinars, articles, podcasting.

  2. Joined a B2B SaaS company at the 1-3M ARR stage, preferably targeting a similar audience.

  3. Proven experience transitioning from an individual contributor to a team leader.

  4. 7+ years in a marketing role within SaaS, demonstrating leadership capabilities.

  5. Proven success driving growth via Facebook Ads, Google Ads, and SEO.

  6. Exceptional analytical skills; a quick learner who adapts rapidly to new data.

  7. Strong written communication and copywriting skills.

Compensation and Benefits

  • $130k-$150k base salary

  • 0.2% - 0.5% stock options

  • Comprehensive Health Benefits: 99% coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance
